Value: any anomaly in the process through which T cells that express T cell receptors that are restricted by self MHC protein complexes and tolerant to self antigens are selected for further maturation

Subject: abnormal negative T cell selection
Value: any anomaly in the process of elimination of immature T cells which react strongly with self-antigens

Subject: abnormal positive T cell selection
Value: any anomaly in the process of sparing immature T cells which react with self-MHC protein complexes with low affinity levels from apoptotic death

Subject: increased placenta weight
Value: increase in the weight of the organ of metabolic interchange between fetus and mother

Subject: decreased placenta weight
Value: reduction in the weight of the organ of metabolic interchange between fetus and mother

Subject: abnormal common crus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the united, nonampullary ends of the superior and posterior semicircular ducts of the inner ear

Subject: absent common crus
Value: absence of the united, nonampullary ends of the superior and posterior semicircular ducts in the inner ear

Subject: abnormal behavior
Value: any anomaly in the actions, reactions, or performance of an organism in response to external or internal stimuli compared to controls

Subject: decreased susceptibility to noise-induced hearing loss
Value: less than normal reduction in hearing sensitivity following exposure to acute noise that is injurious to the cochlea

Subject: abnormal epididymis size
Value: anomaly in the size of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: abnormal epididymis weight
Value: anomaly in the average weight of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: increased epididymis weight
Value: increase in the average weight of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: decreased epididymis weight
Value: reduction in the average weight of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: small epididymis
Value: decrease in the average size of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: enlarged epididymis
Value: increase in the average size of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: epididymis hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: abnormal epididymis epithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the layer of secretory cells which lines the epididymis

Subject: epididymis epithelium degeneration
Value: pathological deterioration of the layer of secretory cells which lines the epididymis

Subject: epididymis degeneration
Value: pathological deterioration of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: impaired branching involved in ureteric bud morphogenesis
Value: partial or complete failure of the ureteric bud to repeatedly divide into lobules during development of the kidney

Subject: dilated heart
Value: stretched or widened aperture of the luminal spaces of the heart, usually with an increase in contained fluid

Subject: dilated vasculature
Value: stretched or widened aperture of the luminal space of the network of tubes that carries blood through the body

Subject: abnormal B cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of lymphocytes that expresses membrane-bound immunoglobulin complexes in the mature form, and differentiate into antibody-secreting plasma cells and memory cells upon interaction with antigen; B cells are the primary lymphocyte responsible for humoral immunity, and are most effective against extracellular pathogens

Subject: abnormal B-1 B cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the subset of B cells found predominantly in the peritoneum, pleural cavities, and spleen, and are enriched for self-reactivity; B-1 B cells are thought to be the primary source of natural IgM immunoglobulin, that is, IgM produced in large quantities without prior antigenic stimulation and generally reactive against various microorganisms, as well as the source of T-independent IgA immunoglobulin in the mucosal areas

Subject: abnormal regulatory T cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the specialized subpopulation of T cells that act to suppress activation of the immune system and thus maintain immune system homeostasis and prevent pathological self-reactivity; these may include T cells that express the CD8 transmembrane glycoprotein (CD8-positive T cells), those that express CD4 and CD25 (CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cells or Tregs) and other T cell types that have suppressor function

Subject: abnormal B cell selection
Value: anomaly in the process dependent upon B cell antigen receptor signaling in response to self or foreign antigen through which B cells are selected for survival

Subject: abnormal B cell positive selection
Value: any anomaly in the process dependent upon B cell antigen receptor signaling in response to self or foreign antigen through which B cells are selected for survival

Subject: abnormal B cell negative selection
Value: any anomaly in the process through which B cells which react strongly with self-antigens are eliminated, usually through anergy or deletion

Subject: abnormal bone resorption
Value: anomaly in the process of degrading the organic and inorganic phases of bone by absorption, usually by the abnormal function or by absence of osteoclasts

Subject: abnormal regulatory T cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the specialized subpopulation of T cells that act to suppress activation of the immune system and thus maintain immune system homeostasis and prevent pathological self-reactivity; these may include T cells that express the CD8 transmembrane glycoprotein (CD8-positive T cells), those that express CD4 and CD25 (CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cells or Tregs) and other T cell types that have suppressor function

Subject: skin inflammation
Value: local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes in the skin

Subject: abnormal neuronal precursor proliferation
Value: any anomaly in the ability of a neuroblast population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division

Subject: absent neuronal precursor cells
Value: absence of the neuroblast embryonic cells that develop into nerve cells or neurons

Subject: abnormal brain vasculature morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the blood vessel network of the brain

Subject: abnormal spleen weight
Value: anomaly in the average weight of the organ that functions to filter blood and to store red corpuscles and platelets

Subject: increased spleen weight
Value: greater than average weight of the organ that functions to filter blood and to store red corpuscles and platelets

Subject: decreased spleen weight
Value: reduction in the average weight of the organ that functions to filter blood and to store red corpuscles and platelets

Subject: abnormal thymus weight
Value: anomaly in the average weight of the primary lymphoid organ that is required for maturation of T cells

Subject: increased thymus weight
Value: greater than average weight of the primary lymphoid organ that is required for maturation of T cells

Subject: decreased thymus weight
Value: reduction in the average weight of the primary lymphoid organ that is required for maturation of T cells

Subject: abnormal blastocyst morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the preimplantation embryo of mammals consisting of a hollow sphere of cells with an outer cell layer (trophoblast) that forms the placenta, a fluid-filled cavity (blastocoele), and a cluster of cells on the interior (the inner cell mass) that forms the embryo

Subject: enlarged prostate gland
Value: increased size of the gland in males that secretes part of the seminiferous fluid

Subject: abnormal prostate gland size
Value: anomaly in the average size of the gland in males that secretes part of the seminiferous fluid

Subject: abnormal prostate gland weight
Value: anomaly in the average weight of the gland in males that secretes part of the seminiferous fluid

Subject: increased prostate gland weight
Value: greater than average weight of the gland in males that secretes part of the seminiferous fluid

Subject: decreased prostate gland weight
Value: reduction in the average weight of the gland in males that secretes part of the seminiferous fluid

Subject: abnormal blastocoele morphology
Value: any structural anomaly the fluid-filled cavity of the blastocyst of the preimplantation embryo of mammals

Subject: absent inner cell mass
Value: absence of the cells of the blastocyst that develop into the body of the embryo

Subject: inner cell mass degeneration
Value: a retrogressive impairment of function or destruction of the cells of the blastocyst that develop into the body of the embryo

Subject: abnormal inner cell mass proliferation
Value: any anomaly in the ability of the inner cell mass population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division

Subject: abnormal kidney epithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the cellular avascular layer of the kidney luminar surfaces

Subject: kidney epithelium hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due an increased number of cells of the cellular avascular layer of the kidney luminar surfaces

Subject: pale kidney
Value: kidney lacks normal reddish coloration; often occurs with a bloodless or reduced vasculature condition

Subject: kidney atrophy
Value: acquired diminution of the size of the kidney associated with wasting as from death and reabsorption of cells, diminished cellular proliferation, decreased cellular volume, pressure, ischemia, malnutrition, reduced function or malfunction, or hormonal changes

Subject: dermal hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due an increased number of cells in the dermal layer of the skin

Subject: abnormal regulatory T cell number
Value: deviation from the average count of the specialized subpopulation of T cells that act to suppress activation of the immune system and thus maintain immune system homeostasis and prevent pathological self-reactivity

Subject: increased regulatory T cell number
Value: greater number of the specialized subpopulation of T cells that act to suppress activation of the immune system and thus maintain immune system homeostasis and prevent pathological self-reactivity

Subject: decreased regulatory T cell number
Value: reduced number of the specialized subpopulation of T cells that act to suppress activation of the immune system and thus maintain immune system homeostasis and prevent pathological self-reactivity

Subject: absent regulatory T cells
Value: absence of the specialized subpopulation of T cells that act to suppress activation of the immune system and thus maintain immune system homeostasis and prevent pathological self-reactivity

Subject: abnormal B-1 B cell number
Value: deviation from the normal count of the subset of B cells found predominantly in the peritoneum, pleural cavities, and spleen, and enriched for self-reactivity

Subject: increased B-1 B cell number
Value: greater number of the subset of B cells found predominantly in the peritoneum, pleural cavities, and spleen, and enriched for self-reactivity

Subject: decreased B-1 B cell number
Value: reduced number of the subset of B cells found predominantly in the peritoneum, pleural cavities, and spleen, and enriched for self-reactivity

Subject: abnormal neuronal precursor cell number
Value: deviation from the normal count of the neuroblast embryonic cells that develop into nerve cells or neurons

Subject: increased neuronal precursor cell number
Value: increased number of the neuroblast embryonic cells that develop into nerve cells or neurons

Subject: decreased neuronal precursor cell number
Value: reduced number of the neuroblast embryonic cells that develop into nerve cells or neurons

Subject: abnormal osteoclast morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the specialized phagocytic cells associated with the absorption and removal of the mineralized matrix of bone tissue

Subject: abnormal osteoclast cell number
Value: deviation from the average number of the specialized phagocytic cells associated with the absorption and removal of the mineralized matrix of bone tissue

Subject: increased osteoclast cell number
Value: greater than average number of the specialized phagocytic cells associated with the absorption and removal of the mineralized matrix of bone tissue

Subject: decreased osteoclast cell number
Value: reduced number of the specialized phagocytic cells associated with the absorption and removal of the mineralized matrix of bone tissue

Subject: abnormal osteoblast morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a skeletogenic cell that secretes osteoid, is capable of producing mineralized (hydroxyapatite) matrix, is located adjacent to or within osteoid tissue, and arises from the transformation of a preosteoblast cell

Subject: abnormal osteoblast cell number
Value: deviation from the average number of the skeletogenic cells that secrete osteoid, are capable of producing mineralized (hydroxyapatite) matrix, are located adjacent to or within osteoid tissue, and arise from the transformation of a preosteoblast cell

Subject: increased osteoblast cell number
Value: greater than average number of skeletogenic cells that secrete osteoid, are capable of producing mineralized (hydroxyapatite) matrix, are located adjacent to or within osteoid tissue, and arise from the transformation of a preosteoblast cell

Subject: decreased osteoblast cell number
Value: reduction in the number of skeletogenic cells that secrete osteoid, are capable of producing mineralized (hydroxyapatite) matrix, are located adjacent to or within osteoid tissue, and arise from the transformation of a preosteoblast cell

Subject: abnormal ciliary ganglion morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the parasympathetic ganglia in the orbit behind the eye that receives preganglionic innervation through the oculomotor nerve

Subject: decreased bone strength
Value: reduced ability of bone to endure the application of force without yielding or breaking

Subject: increased bone resorption
Value: greater than average amount of degradation of the organic and inorganic phases of bone by absorption, usually by the abnormal function or number of osteoclasts

Subject: decreased bone resorption
Value: reduced amount of degradation of the organic and inorganic phases of bone by absorption, usually by the abnormal function or number of osteoclasts

Subject: abnormal brain wave pattern
Value: any anomaly in the standard pattern of rhythmic and rapid fluctuation of electrical potential between parts of the brain, often visualized on an electroencephalogram (EEG); the pattern is often measured to diagnose neurological conditions such as seizure disorders (epilepsy)

Subject: abnormal B cell clonal deletion
Value: a defect in the process of removal by apoptosis of immature B lymphocytes that interact with self antigens during maturation

Subject: abnormal CNS synapse formation
Value: any anomaly in the process of generating the initial connections between an axon and effector tissue or neuron

Subject: increased CNS synapse formation
Value: greater frequency of the process of generating the initial connections between an axon and effector tissue or neuron

Subject: decreased CNS synapse formation
Value: a reduction in the frequency of the process of generating the initial connections between an axon and effector tissue or neuron

Subject: abnormal blood-inner ear barrier function
Value: anomaly in the function of the group of barriers and transport systems which regulate the transport of various substances from blood to inner ear tissue and maintain the microhomeostasis and functional integrity of the inner ear; the endothelial cells of the inner ear blood capillaries, linked to each other by tight junctions, represent the main component of the blood-inner ear barrier

Subject: abnormal immune tolerance
Value: anomaly in the process that directly activates any of the steps required for tolerance, a physiologic state in which the immune system does not react destructively against the components of an organism that harbors it or against antigens that are introduced to it

Subject: abnormal clonal deletion
Value: a defect in the process of removal of immature lymphocytes that interact with self antigens during maturation

Subject: abnormal T cell clonal deletion
Value: a defect in the process of removal of immature T lymphocytes that interact with self antigens during maturation

Subject: abnormal lymphocyte anergy
Value: anomaly in the process of establishing a state of functional inactivation of self-reactive lymphocytes

Subject: abnormal self tolerance
Value: a defect in the normal lack of response to autologous (self) antigens

Subject: abnormal osteoblast physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of a skeletogenic cell that secretes osteoid, is capable of producing mineralized (hydroxyapatite) matrix, is located adjacent to or within osteoid tissue, and arises from the transformation of a preosteoblast cell

Subject: abnormal CD8-positive, alpha beta T cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the regulatory subset of T lymphocytes that are involved in MHC class I restricted interactions

Subject: increased eosinophil cell number
Value: greater than normal eosinophil numbers

Subject: decreased eosinophil cell number
Value: fewer than normal eosinophil numbers

Subject: increased lymphocyte cell number
Value: greater than normal number of the cells involved in adaptive immune reactions of the body in most inflammatory and autoimmune diseases, including B cells, T cells and natural killer cells

Subject: increased B cell number
Value: greater than normal number of cells that are formed in the bone marrow, migrate to the peripheral lymphatic system, and mature into plasma cells or memory cells; these cells are involved in humoral immunity

Subject: increased T cell number
Value: greater than normal T cell numbers

Subject: decreased lymphocyte cell number
Value: fewer than normal number of the cells involved in adaptive immune reactions of the body in most inflammatory and autoimmune diseases, including B cells, T cells and natural killer cells

Subject: decreased B cell number
Value: fewer than normal number of cells that are formed in the bone marrow, migrate to the peripheral lymphatic system, and mature into plasma cells or memory cells; these cells are involved in humoral immunity

Subject: decreased T cell number
Value: fewer than normal T cell numbers

Subject: abnormal early pro-B cell
Value: any structural anomaly of cells in the B lymphocyte lineage that undergo D-J rearrangement of the immunoglobulin heavy chain

Subject: abnormal late pro-B cell
Value: any structural anomaly of the cells in the B lymphocyte lineage that undergo V-DJ rearrangement of the immunoglobulin heavy chain

Subject: abnormal immature B cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the cells of the B lymphocyte lineage that have undergone VDJ rearrangement of the heavy chain and V-J rearrangement of the light chain; these cells express IgM on the cell surface but have not yet been selected for self-reactivity

Subject: abnormal wound healing
Value: aberrant process of repair of trauma to any tissues of the body, especially that caused by physical means

Subject: abnormal response to infection
Value: any anomaly in the body's reaction to invasion and multiplication of microorganisms in its tissues, or the body's reaction to components of or toxins produced by pathogenic microorganisms

Subject: decreased susceptibility to parasitic infection
Value: reduced likelihood that an organism will develop ill effects from a parasitic infection or from components of or toxins produced by parasites

Subject: increased susceptibility to parasitic infection
Value: greater likelihood that an organism will develop ill effects from a parasitic infection or from components of or toxins produced by parasites

Subject: abnormal trophectoderm morphology
Value: any structural anomaly outermost layer of cells in the blastodermic vesicle, which will develop into the trophoblast layer and then contact the endometrium and take part in establishing the embryo's means of nutrition

Subject: abnormal amnion morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the thin innermost layer of the extraembryonic membranes that contains the amniotic fluid; the membrane forms a closed sac in which the embryo and later, the fetus, is suspended and protected

Subject: absent amnion
Value: absence of the thin innermost layer of the extraembryonic membranes that contains the amniotic fluid; the membrane forms a closed sac in which the embryo and later, the fetus, is suspended and protected

Subject: abnormal trophoblast layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the mesectodermal cell layer arising from the trophectoderm that erodes the uterine mucosa and contributes to the formation of the placenta

Subject: abnormal ectoplacental cone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the thickened trophoblast of the blastocyst in rodents that becomes the fetal portion of the placenta

Subject: abnormal trophoblast giant cell morphology
Value: anomaly of the cells covering the blastocyst that erode the uterine mucosa and contribute to the formation of the placenta

Subject: abnormal anus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the lower opening of the digestive tract

Subject: perianal ulcer
Value: lesion around or near the anus

Subject: diarrhea
Value: abnormally frequent discharge of semi-solid or fluid fecal matter from the bowel

Subject: mucous diarrhea
Value: presence of considerable mucous in the stools

Subject: hypoxia
Value: reduced oxygenation of body tissues resulting in the decreased pressure of this component of body gases; commonly due to hypoxemia

Subject: abnormal MHC II cell surface expression on macrophages
Value: anomaly in the ability of macrophages to express major histocompatibility complex class II at the cell surface

Subject: abnormal antigen presentation via MHC class II
Value: anomaly in the process by which peptide, bound to major histocompatibility complex class II, is presented to lymphocytes at the surface of antigen presenting cells

Subject: abnormal level of surface class II molecules
Value: deviation from the normal concentration of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules expressed at the cell surface

Subject: defective assembly of class II molecules
Value: impaired production of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules

Subject: sepsis
Value: presence of various pathogenic organisms, or their toxins, in the blood or tissues

Subject: absent spleen white pulp
Value: absence of the parenchymatous tissue of the spleen that surrounds splenic blood vessels, consists of compact masses of lymphatic cells and is where foreign material removed from the blood is used to initiate an immune reaction that results in the production of antibodies

Subject: enlarged celiac lymph nodes
Value: increased size of the celiac lymph nodes

Subject: abnormal thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation within a tissue or the vascular lumen of a thrombus, an aggregation of coagulated blood containing platelets, fibrin, and entrapped cellular elements

Subject: abnormal lysosome morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of any of the cytoplasmic, membrane bound vesicles that contain a variety of hydrolases

Subject: lysosomal protein accumulation
Value: buildup of protein in the lysosome

Subject: accumulation of giant lysosomes in kidney/renal tubule cells
Value: buildup of contents in lysosomes in cells of the kidney tubules

Subject: abnormal eosinophil morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the immature or mature forms of a granular leukocyte with a nucleus that usually has two lobes connected by one or more slender threads of chromatin, and cytoplasm containing coarse, round granules that are uniform in size and which can be stained by the dye eosin and is involved in clearance of parasitic infections and in allergic reactions

Subject: abnormal neutrophil morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the immature or mature forms of a granular leukocyte that in its mature form has a nucleus with three to five lobes connected by slender threads of chromatin, and cytoplasm containing fine inconspicuous granules and stainable by neutral dyes

Subject: abnormal NK cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors, and also regulate immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells

Subject: impaired natural killer cell mediated cytotoxicity
Value: impaired ability of directed killing of a target cell by a natural killer cell through the release of granules containing cytotoxic mediators or through the engagement of death receptors

Subject: enlarged hair follicle melanin granules
Value: increased size of the pigment particles located in the hair follicle

Subject: abnormal hair follicle melanin granule morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the pigment particles in the hair follicles

Subject: impaired granulocyte bactericidal activity
Value: inability or reduced ability of neutrophils, eosinophils, or basophils to kill bacteria

Subject: abnormal melanosome morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the tissue-specific cytoplasmic organelles within which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored

Subject: abnormal cell differentiation
Value: anomaly in the process whereby relatively unspecialized cells, e. g. embryonic or regenerative cells, acquire specialized structural and/or functional features that characterize the cells, tissues, or organs of the mature organism or some other relatively stable phase of the organism's life history

Subject: abnormal melanogenesis
Value: anomaly in the biosynthetic pathway of melanin formation in cells

Subject: abnormal cytotoxic T cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the subset of CD8-positive T lymphocytes capable of directly killing appropriately targeted cells

Subject: decreased cytotoxic T cell cytolysis
Value: impaired ability of cytotoxic T cells to induce pathological breakdown of target cells by the destruction of their outer membrane

Subject: abnormal dermis reticular layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the thicker, deeper layer of the dermis, comprised of criss-crossing collagen fibers that form a strong elastic network and also containing blood and lymph vessels, nerves and nerve endings, and hair follicles

Subject: abnormal biliary tract morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the gall bladder or its bile ducts

Subject: abnormal gallbladder morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the organ which serves as a storage reservoir for bile

Subject: abnormal gallbladder physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the organ that stores and concentrates bile

Subject: decreased acute inflammation
Value: less than the expected early reaction of the microcirculation, characterized by movement of fluid and leukocytes from the blood into extravascular tissues; initiated by injury, infection, or local immune response

Subject: increased acute inflammation
Value: greater than the expected early reaction of the microcirculation, characterized by movement of fluid and leukocytes from the blood into extravascular tissues; initiated by injury, infection, or local immune response

Subject: decreased double-negative T cell number
Value: reduced numbers of the subset of T cells found in the thymus that express neither CD4 nor CD8

Subject: increased double-negative T cell number
Value: greater than expected numbers of the subset of T cells found in the thymus that express neither CD4 nor CD8

Subject: increased double-positive T cell number
Value: greater than the expected number of the subset of T cells found in the thymus that express both CD4 and CD8

Subject: decreased double-positive T cell number
Value: less than the expected number of the subset of T cells found in the thymus that express both CD4 and CD8

Subject: decreased B cell proliferation
Value: absent or reduced expansion rate of the B cell population by cell division in response to stimuli

Subject: abnormal T cell proliferation
Value: anomaly in the ability of a naive T cell population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division in response to stimuli

Subject: decreased T cell proliferation
Value: reduction in the ability of a naive T cell population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division in response to stimuli

Subject: erythroblastosis
Value: presence of erythroblasts in great number in the blood

Subject: polychromatophilia
Value: condition characterized by the presence of red blood cells that have an affinity for acid, basic, and neutral stains

Subject: abnormal optic choroid morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the thin, highly vascularized membrane covering most of the posterior of the eye between the retina and the sclera

Subject: abnormal ciliary body morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the thickened portion of the vascular tunic, which lies between the choroid and the iris, and is made up of the ciliary muscle and the ciliary processes; the processes radiate from the ciliary muscle and give attachments to ligaments supporting the lens of the eye

Subject: abnormal choroid pigmentation
Value: anomalous coloring of the thin, highly vascularized membrane covering most of the posterior of the eye between the retina and the sclera

Subject: abnormal ciliary body pigmentation
Value: anomalous coloring of the thickened portion of the vascular tunic, which lies between the choroid and the iris

Subject: abnormal iris pigmentation
Value: anomalous coloring of the adjustable membrane, composed of the stroma and pigmented epithelium, located just in front of the crystalline lens within the eye

Subject: abnormal retinal pigmentation
Value: anomalous coloring of the thin layer of neural tissue lining the back of the eyeball which contains visual receptors

Subject: abnormal tarsal bone morphology
Value: <any structural anomaly of any of the eight bones of the instep of the paw/foot: tibiale, talus, calcaneus, navicular, 3 cuneiform, and cuboid bones>

Subject: abnormal middle ear ossicle morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the three small bones of the middle ear

Subject: abnormal incus morphology
Value: <any structural anomaly of the anvil-shaped, central bone of the three auditory ossicles which articulates with the head of the malleus anteromedially and the stapes inferomedially; its parts include: a body which articulates with the head of the malleus, and to which the superior ligament of the incus is attached (to the roof of the middle ear cavity); a long crus down to the lentiform process (lenticular process) which articulates with the stapes; and a short crus to which the posterior ligament of the incus is attached>

Subject: abnormal stapes morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the smallest and innermost of the three auditory ossicles

Subject: abnormal ulna morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the medial and larger of the two bones of the forearm

Subject: abnormal talus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the bone that articulates with the tibia and fibula

Subject: absent talus
Value: absence of the bone that articulates with the tibia and fibula

Subject: hyperdipsia
Value: intense thirst that is relatively temporary

Subject: abnormal spinal cord ventral horn morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the ventral grey column of the spinal cord

Subject: decreased spinal cord ventral horn cell number
Value: fewer than the expected number of cells in the ventral grey column of the spinal cord

Subject: premature hair loss
Value: release of fur at an earlier than expected time

Subject: abnormal circulating pituitary hormone level
Value: aberration in the blood concentration of any of the hormones secreted by the pituitary

Subject: increased circulating pituitary hormone level
Value: greater than expected concentration of any of the pituitary hormones in the blood

Subject: decreased circulating pituitary hormone level
Value: less than expected concentration of any of the pituitary hormones found in the blood

Subject: decreased circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone level
Value: reduced amount in the blood of the hormone that stimulates the growth and function of the thyroid gland

Subject: decreased circulating growth hormone level
Value: less than the expected blood concentration of the hormone that promotes body growth, fat mobilization, and inhibition of glucose utilization

Subject: decreased circulating prolactin level
Value: less than expected blood concentration of the hormone that stimulates milk secretion

Subject: increased circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone level
Value: greater amount in the blood of the hormone that stimulates the growth and function of the thyroid gland

Subject: increased circulating growth hormone level
Value: greater than the expected blood concentration of the hormone that promotes body growth, fat mobilization, and inhibition of glucose utilization

Subject: increased circulating prolactin level
Value: greater than expected blood concentration of the hormone that stimulates milk secretion

Subject: decreased adrenocorticotropin level
Value: decreased concentration of adrenocorticotropic hormone

Subject: increased adrenocorticotropin level
Value: increased concentration of adrenocorticotropic hormone

Subject: decreased follicle stimulating hormone level
Value: less than expected concentration of the hormone that, in females, stimulates the graafian follicles of the ovary and assists in follicular maturation and the secretion of estradiol; in the male it stimulates the epithelium of the seminiferous tubules and is partly responsible for spermatogenesis

Subject: increased follicle stimulating hormone level
Value: greater than expected concentration of the hormone that, in females, stimulates the graafian follicles of the ovary and assists in follicular maturation and the secretion of estradiol; in the male it stimulates the epithelium of the seminiferous tubules and is partly responsible for spermatogenesis

Subject: decreased luteinizing hormone level
Value: lower than normal concentration of LH

Subject: increased luteinizing hormone level
Value: higher than normal levels of LH

Subject: decreased thyroid-stimulating hormone level
Value: reduced amount of the hormone that stimulates the growth and function of the thyroid gland

Subject: increased thyroid-stimulating hormone level
Value: greater amount of the hormone that stimulates the growth and function of the thyroid gland

Subject: decreased growth hormone level
Value: less than the expected concentration of the hormone that promotes body growth, fat mobilization, and inhibition of glucose utilization

Subject: increased growth hormone level
Value: greater than the expected concentration of the hormone that promotes body growth, fat mobilization, and inhibition of glucose utilization

Subject: decreased prolactin level
Value: less than expected concentration of the hormone that stimulates milk secretion

Subject: increased prolactin level
Value: greater than expected concentration of the hormone that stimulates milk secretion

Subject: decreased cardiac muscle contractility
Value: inability or reduced ability of the heart muscle to shorten or to develop increased tension, often measured by dP/dT max, fractional shortening (FS), velocity of circumferential fiber shortening (Vcfc), peak of aortic outflow velocity (PAV), and ventricular ejection fraction volume

Subject: liver hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size of the liver, usually due an increased number of cells

Subject: abnormal circulating VLDL cholesterol level
Value: <any anomaly in the amount in the blood of the lipoprotein:cholesterol complex that transports triglycerides from the intestine and liver to muscle and adipose tissue>

Subject: increased circulating VLDL cholesterol level
Value: <greater amount in the blood of the lipoprotein:cholesterol complex that transports triglycerides from the intestine and liver to muscle and adipose tissue>

Subject: decreased circulating VLDL cholesterol level
Value: <reduced amount in the blood of the lipoprotein:cholesterol complex that transports triglycerides from the intestine and liver to muscle and adipose tissue>

Subject: prostate gland hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size of the prostate, usually due to a reduced number of cells

Subject: seminal vesicle hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, of one of the two folded, sac shaped glands that is a diverticulum of the ductus deferens

Subject: abnormal gubernaculum morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the genitoinguinal ligaments that, in the male, connect the fetal testis to the developing scrotum, and, in the female, connect the ovaries to the uterus

Subject: cachexia
Value: general weight loss and wasting occurring in the course of chronic disease

Subject: diffuse hepatic necrosis
Value: morphological changes resulting from disseminated pathological death of some or all liver tissue; usually due to irreversible damage

Subject: pancytopenia
Value: reduction in the number of erythrocytes, all types of white blood cells, and platelets in the circulating blood

Subject: abnormal B cell proliferation
Value: anomaly in the ability of the B cell population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division in response to stimuli

Subject: increased B cell proliferation
Value: greater than normal expansion rate of the B cell population by cell division in response to stimuli

Subject: herniated intestine
Value: protrusion of any portion of the intestine from its normal anatomical position

Subject: bradykinesia
Value: decreased spontaneity and movement, without external stimulus

Subject: holoprosencephaly
Value: presence of a single forebrain hemisphere or lobe; often accompanied by a deficit in median facial development

Subject: ovary hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size of the ovaries, usually due to a reduced number of cells

Subject: azoospermia
Value: a condition where there is no measurable level of spermatozoa in the semen

Subject: hematuria
Value: presence of blood in the urine

Subject: carpoptosis
Value: paralysis of the extensors of the wrist and fingers; most often caused by a lesion of the radial nerve

Subject: cyclopia
Value: a congenital defect characterized by the failure of the embryonic prosencephalon to properly divide the orbits of the eye into two cavities; cyclopia is a rare form of holoprosencephaly that typically presents with a median single eye or a partially divided eye in a single orbit, absent nose, and a proboscis above the eye

Subject: abnormal response to injury
Value: anomaly in the body's reaction to trauma, especially that by physical means

Subject: increased susceptibility to injury
Value: greater than the normal reaction to trauma, especially that by physical means

Subject: decreased susceptibility to injury
Value: less than the normal reaction to trauma, especially that by physical means

Subject: abnormal blood-brain barrier function
Value: anomaly in the function of the group of barriers and transport systems in the brain capillary endothelium that controls the entrance of substances into the brain extracellular space from the blood

Subject: abnormal female meiosis
Value: anomaly in the process of nuclear division that results in ova with one half the normal chromosome number of the original cell

Subject: abnormal male meiosis
Value: anomaly in the process of nuclear division that results in sperm with one half the normal chromosome number of the original cell

Subject: cleft upper lip
Value: defect in the upper lip where the maxillary prominence fails to merge with the merged medial nasal prominences

Subject: absent coat pigmentation
Value: fur or hair is devoid of coloration and appears white

Subject: decreased eye pigmentation
Value: the eye has less pigmentation than normal with a possible range of color from dark red, somewhat reduced in pigment, to pink, typical of albinism or ocular albinism

Subject: abnormal tail pigmentation
Value: anomaly in the coloration of the tail due to changes in the amount, shape, or distribution of cells producing pigment

Subject: non-pigmented tail tip
Value: lack of color at the end of the tail

Subject: eyelids fail to open
Value: eyes remain shut when eyelids are expected to be open

Subject: increased circulating cholesterol level
Value: greater than the normal amount in the blood of the principal sterol of vertebrates and the precursor of many steroids, including bile acids and steroid hormones; it is a component of the plasma membrane lipid bilayer and of plasma lipoproteins and can be found in all animal tissues

Subject: decreased circulating cholesterol level
Value: less than the normal amount in the blood of the principal sterol of vertebrates and the precursor of many steroids, including bile acids and steroid hormones; it is a component of the plasma membrane lipid bilayer and of plasma lipoproteins and can be found in all animal tissues

Subject: abnormal circulating testosterone level
Value: anomaly in the blood concentration of a potent androgen that promotes development of male secondary sex characteristics and the development of spermatozoa and may regulate sexual desire and help maintain bone and muscle health in both males and females

Subject: decreased circulating estradiol level
Value: less than the normal blood concentration of this most potent naturally occurring estrogen in mammals

Subject: increased circulating estradiol level
Value: greater than the normal blood concentration of this most potent naturally occurring estrogen in mammals

Subject: abnormal circulating estradiol level
Value: aberration in the blood concentration of this most potent estrogen

Subject: abnormal circulating progesterone level
Value: anomaly in the blood concentration of the antiestrogenic steroid released by the corpus luteum that stimulates the uterus to prepare for pregnancy

Subject: decreased circulating progesterone level
Value: reduced blood concentration of the antiestrogenic steroid released by the corpus luteum that stimulates the uterus to prepare for pregnancy

Subject: increased circulating progesterone level
Value: increased blood concentration of the antiestrogenic steroid released by the corpus luteum that stimulates the uterus to prepare for pregnancy

Subject: abnormal penis morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the organ of copulation and urination in the male

Subject: small penis
Value: reduced size of the organ of copulation and urination in the male

Subject: abnormal anogenital distance
Value: in comparison to the norm, aberration in the measure of the length of space from the genitals to the anus

Subject: osteomyelitis
Value: bone inflammation

Subject: head tilt
Value: condition in which the portion of the body containing the brain and organs of sight, hearing, taste, and smell lists to the side

Subject: increased motor neuron number
Value: greater than the normal number of cells that innervate an effector (muscle or glandular) tissue and are responsible for transmission of motor impulses

Subject: abnormal anterior eye segment morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of any of the parts of the eye that lie in front of, or ventral to, the lens (inclusive)

Subject: abnormal anterior uvea morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of any of the parts of the front, or ventral, portion of the vascular, pigmentary, or middle coat of the eye, including the ciliary body and the iris

Subject: abnormal posterior eye segment morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of any of the parts of the eye that lie in back of, or dorsal to, the lens (but not inclusive)

Subject: obsolete abnormal posterior uvea morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the rear, or dorsal, portion of the vascular, pigmentary, or middle coat of the eye, includes the choroid

Subject: abnormal uvea morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the pigmented vascular coat of the eyeball, consisting of the iris, ciliary body, and choroid

Subject: abnormal aqueous drainage system morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the structures associated with drainage of the aqueous humor from the eye, that include the trabecular meshwork, Schlemm's canal, the uveoscleral network, and the aqueous veins

Subject: abnormal iris pigment epithelium
Value: anomaly in the epithelial layer of the iris composed of cells containing pigment granules

Subject: abnormal retinal pigment epithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the epithelial layer of the retina composed of cells containing pigment granules

Subject: lethargy
Value: mild impairment of consciousness resulting in reduced alertness and awareness and/or sluggish behavior or inactivity; can be due to generalized brain dysfunction

Subject: abnormal trabecular meshwork morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the pore-like structure surrounding the entire circumference of the anterior chamber through which aqueous humor circulates

Subject: abnormal canal of Schlemm morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the vascular structure encircling the anterior chamber of the eye, through which the aqueous humor is returned to the blood circulation

Subject: abnormal eye anterior chamber morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the space in the eye, filled with aqueous humor, and bounded anteriorly by the cornea and a small portion of the sclera and posteriorly by a small portion of the ciliary body, the iris, and part of the crystalline lens

Subject: abnormal aqueous humor
Value: anomaly in the clear, watery fluid that fills the anterior and posterior chambers of the eye

Subject: abnormal aqueous vein morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of this vessel that receives aqueous humor from the sinus venosus sclerae (canal of Schlemm)

Subject: abnormal iris stroma morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the lamellated vascular connective tissue of the iris

Subject: disorganized stomach mucosa
Value: derangement of the pattern of the mucous layer of the stomach wall

Subject: increased stomach mucosa thickness
Value: greater than the normal depth or width of the of the mucous layer of the stomach wall

Subject: gastric metaplasia
Value: condition in which there is a change of one adult cell type to another adult cell type in the stomach

Subject: regional gastric metaplasia
Value: localized areas of the stomach in which there is a change from one adult cell type to another adult cell type

Subject: abnormal pancreatic islet morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the clusters of hormone-producing cells that are scattered throughout the pancreas

Subject: abnormal pancreatic alpha cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the cells of the pancreas that secrete glucagon

Subject: abnormal pancreatic beta cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a cell that secretes insulin and is located towards the center of the islets of Langerhans in the pancreas

Subject: abnormal pancreatic delta cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the cells found in the pancreas that secrete somatostatin

Subject: abnormal exocrine pancreas morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the acinar gland portion of the pancreas that secretes digestive enzymes

Subject: abnormal rostral-caudal axis patterning
Value: anomaly in the development or formation of the axis that runs from the head to the tail of the body

Subject: abnormal somite size
Value: atypical size of any of mesodermal clusters that are arranged segmentally along the anterior posterior axis of an embryo

Subject: abnormal dorsal-ventral polarity of the somites
Value: anomalous development or formation of the pattern of somites along the axis that runs from the front (ventral) to the back (dorsal) surface of the body

Subject: abnormal left-right axis symmetry of the somites
Value: anomaly in the formation or development of the somites in relation to the left and right sides of the body

Subject: abnormal vertebrae development
Value: anomalous formation of the vertebrae from the sclerotome

Subject: abnormal vertebral arch development
Value: anomalous formation of the posterior projection from the body of a vertebra that encloses the vertebral foramen

Subject: abnormal vertebral body development
Value: anomalous formation of the main portion of the vertebra anterior to the vertebral canal, and distinct from the vertebral arch

Subject: abnormal intervertebral disk development
Value: any anomaly in the formation of the cartilaginous and gelatinous structure found between vertebrae

Subject: ectrodactyly
Value: absence of the middle rays, i.e., the central digits; usually associated with cleft hands/feet and may also include syndactyly or aplasia of remaining digits

Subject: abnormal brachial lymph node morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the lymph nodes located along the brachial vein that receive drainage from most of the free upper limb and send efferent vessels to the central axillary lymph nodes

Subject: abnormal mesenteric lymph node morphology
Value: <any structural anomaly of the lymph nodes located in the mesentery, of which there are 3 classes: ileocolic, juxtaintestinal mesenteric, and central superior group>

Subject: abnormal olfactory nerve morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the first cranial nerve, which conveys the sense of smell

Subject: abnormal olfactory tract morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the nerve-like, white band composed primarily of nerve fibers originating from the mitral cells and tufted cells of the olfactory bulb, but also containing the scattered cells of the anterior olfactory nucleus

Subject: increased brain size
Value: larger than the normal physical proportions of the brain

Subject: abnormal Bruch membrane morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the transparent, nearly structureless inner layer of the choroid in contact with the pigmented layer of the retina

Subject: abnormal amacrine cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of one of the three types of interneurons found in the inner nuclear layer of the mature retina; they integrate, modulate, and interpose a temporal domain in the visual message presented to the retinal ganglion cells, with which they synapse in the inner plexiform layer

Subject: abnormal retinal ganglion layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the innermost nuclear layer of the retina, which contains neurons that project axons through the optic nerve to the brain

Subject: cryptophthalmos
Value: congenital anomaly in which the skin is continuous over the eyeball without any indication of the formation of eyelids

Subject: hemothorax
Value: bleeding into the pleural space

Subject: hemopericardium
Value: bleeding into the pericardial space

Subject: hemarthrosis
Value: bleeding into a joint space

Subject: abnormal extraocular muscle morphology
Value: <any structural anomaly of any of the striated muscles that are located within the orbit but are extrinsic and separate from the eyeball itself and control the movements of the eyeball and the superior eyelid; there are seven extraocular muscles: superior rectus, inferior rectus, medial rectus, lateral rectus, inferior oblique, superior oblique, and levator palpebrae superioris>

Subject: abnormal Harderian gland morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the retroocular sebaceous gland found within the orbit of mammals that possess a nictitating membrane (third eyelid); the chief products of the gland vary between different groups of vertebrates, and epithelial cells possess granules or vacuoles whose contents may be mucous, serous or lipid; in rodents, the Harderian gland is especially large and secretes lipids (by a merocrine mechanism), melatonin and porphyrins; ascribed functions include a role in lubrication and protection for the eyeball and nictitating membrane (by lipids), photoprotection (by porphyrin), photoreception (by regulation of the incidence of light on the retina), and thermoregulation (in some rodents) of the sebaceous gland located behind the eyeball that excretes fluid that facilitates movement of the nictitating membrane

Subject: abnormal palatine bone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of either of two irregularly L-shaped bones located posterior to the maxilla that in part forms the back of the hard palate, part of the nasal cavity and part of the floor of the orbits

Subject: Sertoli cell hypoplasia
Value: decreased number of cells of the seminiferous tubules that create the blood-testes barrier and enable spermatogenesis

Subject: blepharitis
Value: inflammation of the eyelids

Subject: abnormal Meibomian gland morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the sebaceous glands embedded in the tarsal plate of each eyelid

Subject: abnormal eye physiology
Value: any functional anomaly and/or activity of the spheroid organ and optic nerve that serves to detect light

Subject: strabismus
Value: misalignment of the visual axes of the eyes

Subject: exotropia
Value: a form of ocular misalignment in which the lateral rectus muscle pulls the eye in an outward direction

Subject: esotropia
Value: a form of ocular misalignment in which there is excessive convergence of the visual axes, giving a cross-eyed appearance

Subject: abnormal intraocular pressure
Value: anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye

Subject: ocular hypertension
Value: abnormal elevation of the intraocular pressure

Subject: ocular hypotension
Value: abnormally low intraocular pressure

Subject: aniridia
Value: abnormality in which there is only a rudimentary iris, due to the failure of optic cup growth

Subject: coloboma
Value: anomaly in which some of the structures of the eye are absent due to incomplete fusion of the fetal intraocular fissure during gestation

Subject: ectopia lentis
Value: congenital displacement of the lens due to defective zonule formation

Subject: glomerulosclerosis
Value: hyaline deposits or scarring within the renal glomeruli, often occurring with renal arteriosclerosis or diabetes

Subject: abnormal blood urea nitrogen level
Value: aberrant circulating concentration of nitrogen, in the form of urea; commonly used to measure renal function

Subject: abnormal metabolism
Value: any anomaly in the processes that cause many of the chemical changes in living organisms, including anabolism and catabolism; metabolic processes typically transform small molecules, but also include macromolecular processes such as DNA repair and replication, and protein synthesis and degradation

Subject: abnormal olfactory cortex morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of cortex area which receives its major afferents from the olfactory bulb, and is primarily responsible for the identification of odors

Subject: abnormal occipital bone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the bone at the lower, posterior part of the skull

Subject: abnormal zygomatic bone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the quadrilateral bone that forms the prominence of the cheek

Subject: abnormal lacrimal bone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the irregularly thin plate that forms part of the medial wall of the orbit behind the frontal process of the maxilla

Subject: abnormal temporal bone morphology
Value: <any structural anomaly of the large, irregular bone located at the base and side of the skull; consists of three parts at birth: squamous, tympanic, and petrous>

Subject: abnormal viscerocranium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the part of the skull that comprises the facial bones

Subject: abnormal skin tensile strength
Value: change from the normal maximum tension the skin can withstand without tearing

Subject: abnormal brainstem morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord

Subject: abnormal cholesterol homeostasis
Value: anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium of cholesterol, the principal sterol of vertebrates and the precursor of many steroids, including bile acids and steroid hormones; it is a component of the plasma membrane lipid bilayer and of plasma lipoproteins and can be found in all animal tissues

Subject: narcolepsy
Value: recurring episodes of sleep during normal waking hours and often disrupted sleep during normal sleeping period; often accompanied by cataplexy, sleep paralysis and hallucinations

Subject: abnormal fatty acids level
Value: any anomaly in the concentration of aliphatic monocarboxylic acids derived from or contained in esterified form in an animal or vegetable fat, oil or wax; natural fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons (usually unbranched and even-numbered), which may be saturated or unsaturated

Subject: increased fatty acids level
Value: elevated concentration of aliphatic monocarboxylic acids derived from or contained in esterified form in an animal or vegetable fat, oil or wax; natural fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons (usually unbranched and even-numbered), which may be saturated or unsaturated

Subject: decreased fatty acids level
Value: reduction in the concentration of aliphatic monocarboxylic acids derived from or contained in esterified form in an animal or vegetable fat, oil or wax; natural fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons (usually unbranched and even-numbered), which may be saturated or unsaturated

Subject: increased unsaturated fatty acids level
Value: elevated concentration of unsaturated aliphatic monocarboxylic acids derived from or contained in esterified form in an animal or vegetable fat, oil or wax; unsaturated fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons which possess one or more double or triple bonds between carbon atoms

Subject: increased saturated fatty acids level
Value: elevated concentration of saturated aliphatic monocarboxylic acids derived from or contained in esterified form in an animal or vegetable fat, oil or wax; saturated fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons which contains no ethylenic or other unsaturated linkages between carbon atoms

Subject: decreased unsaturated fatty acids level
Value: reduced concentration of unsaturated aliphatic monocarboxylic acids derived from or contained in esterified form in an animal or vegetable fat, oil or wax; unsaturated fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons which possess one or more double or triple bonds between carbon atoms

Subject: decreased saturated fatty acids level
Value: reduced concentration of saturated aliphatic monocarboxylic acids derived from or contained in esterified form in an animal or vegetable fat, oil or wax; saturated fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons which contains no ethylenic or other unsaturated linkages between carbon atoms

Subject: narrow eye opening
Value: less than the normal distance from one eyelid to the other without fusion of the eyelid margins

Subject: abnormal oxygen consumption
Value: deviation from the normal rate at which oxygen enters the blood from alveolar gas; this is equal in the steady state to the consumption of oxygen by tissue metabolism throughout the body

Subject: increased oxygen consumption
Value: greater than the normal rate at which oxygen enters the blood from alveolar gas; this is equal in the steady state to the consumption of oxygen by tissue metabolism throughout the body

Subject: decreased oxygen consumption
Value: less than the normal rate at which oxygen enters the blood from alveolar gas; this is equal in the steady state to the consumption of oxygen by tissue metabolism throughout the body

Subject: abnormal glucose tolerance
Value: deviation from the normal response to oral consumption or intravenous injection of specified amounts of glucose; measured by determining whole blood or plasma sugar level in a fasting state before and after taking glucose at specified intervals

Subject: improved glucose tolerance
Value: better than the normal response to oral consumption or intravenous injection of specified amounts of glucose and indicative of insulin sensitivity; measured by determining whole blood or plasma sugar level in a fasting state before and after taking glucose at specified intervals

Subject: impaired glucose tolerance
Value: less than the normal response to oral consumption or intravenous injection of specified amounts of glucose and indicative of insulin resistance; measured by determining whole blood or plasma sugar level in a fasting state before and after taking glucose at specified intervals

Subject: abnormal heart ventricle morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of one or both of the two lower chambers of the heart

Subject: abnormal humerus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the bone of the forelimb that articulates with the scapula above and the radius and ulna below

Subject: spina bifida occulta
Value: defective closure of the laminae of the vertebral column in the lumbosacral region without hernial protrusion of the spinal cord or meninges; the mildest, most common and often asymptomatic form of spina bifida, identified externally by a skin depression or dimple, dark tufts of hair, telangiectasis, or soft subcutaneous lipomas at the site of defect

Subject: abnormal clavicle morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the doubly curved long bone that forms part of the shoulder girdle and articulates with the sternum and the scapula

Subject: abnormal eye posterior chamber morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the ring-like space, filled with aqueous humor, between the iris/pupil anteriorly and the lens and ciliary body posteriorly

Subject: abnormal corneal stroma morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the lamellated connective tissue of the cornea between the Bowman and Descemet membranes

Subject: abnormal corneal endothelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the single layer of large flattened cells that cover the surface of the cornea

Subject: neurogenic bladder
Value: defective functioning of the bladder due to impaired innervation, either within the CNS or the PNS

Subject: cystic bulbourethral gland
Value: presence of membrane-lined sacs containing gas, fluid, or semisolid matter in the gland in males that lies along the prostate gland and secretes a fluid component of the seminal fluid into the urethra

Subject: prostate gland anterior lobe hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due an increased number of cells in the anterior lobe of the prostate

Subject: abnormal phalanx morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of any of the long bones of the digits

Subject: head tossing
Value: repetitive flailing of the head in multiple directions

Subject: abnormal circulating ammonia level
Value: aberrant amount of ammonia or its compounds in blood, formed in the body during organic decomposition

Subject: increased circulating ammonia level
Value: significantly elevated levels of ammonia or its compounds in blood; often associated with liver failure and hepatic encephalopathy

Subject: abnormal salivary gland physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of any of the glands in the mouth that secrete saliva

Subject: abnormal circulating amino acid level
Value: any anomaly in the amount in the blood of a carboxylic acid containing one or more amino groups (-NH2) and a carboxyl (-COOH) group

Subject: pericardial effusion
Value: escape of fluid from blood vessels or lymphatic vessels into the fibrous sac surrounding the heart

Subject: absent adrenal gland
Value: absence of the pair of endocrine glands located above the kidney that are responsible for steroid hormone secretion from the cortex and neurotransmitter (such as epinephrine and norepinephrine) secretion from the medulla

Subject: absent thyroid gland
Value: lack of the endocrine gland that is normally located in the front and to the sides of the upper part of the trachea and which secretes thyroid hormone and calcitonin

Subject: absent pituitary gland
Value: lack of the gland that is normally suspended from the base of the hypothalamus and which secretes somatotropins, prolactin, TSH (thyroid-stimulating hormone), gonadotropins, adrenal corticotropin

Subject: abnormal response to tactile stimuli
Value: anomaly in the reflex action normally induced by touch or pain

Subject: increased triglyceride level
Value: greater concentration of naturally occurring esters of three fatty acids and glycerol; triglycerides are widespread in adipose tissue, commonly circulate in the blood in the form of lipoproteins, and are involved in the process of bidirectional transference of adipose fat and blood glucose with the liver

Subject: decreased triglyceride level
Value: reduced concentration of naturally occurring esters of three fatty acids and glycerol; triglycerides are widespread in adipose tissue, commonly circulate in the blood in the form of lipoproteins, and are involved in the process of bidirectional transference of adipose fat and blood glucose with the liver

Subject: abnormal enzyme/coenzyme level
Value: altered level of any enzyme or their cofactors, that act as catalysts to induce chemical changes in other substances

Subject: abnormal biopterin level
Value: anomaly in the concentration of this pterin found in yeast, the fruit fly and in normal human urine, the reduced form of which acts as a coenzyme for many enzymatic reactions

Subject: abnormal neopterin level
Value: anomaly in the concentration of a pteridine derivative, which is present in body fluids and is a precursor in the biosynthesis of biopterin; elevated levels result from immune activation, malignant disease, allograft rejection, and viral infection

Subject: abnormal serotonin level
Value: anomaly in the amount of biochemical messenger and regulator, found in the CNS, gastrointestinal tract, and produced by platelets that mediates neurotransmission, gastrointestinal motility, hemostasis, and cardiovascular integrity

Subject: dystonia
Value: impairment of muscle tone resulting in prolonged muscle contraction and involuntary movements such as repetitive movements, or twisting or writhing of the limbs

Subject: ascites
Value: accumulation or retention of fluid within the peritoneal cavity

Subject: abnormal renal glomerulus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the tuft formed of capillary loops and mesangium at the beginning of each nephretic tubule in the kidney that normally function as a filtration unit

Subject: abnormal podocyte morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a modified epithelial cell of the visceral layer of the Bowman capsule in the renal corpuscle; it has a small perikaryon and a number of primary and secondary foot processes that interdigitate with those of other podocytes and are attached to the outer surface of the glomerular capillary basement membrane

Subject: abnormal mesangial cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the modified smooth muscle cells that are interposed between endothelial cells and the basement membrane in the central or stalk region of the capillary tuft of the renal glomerulus, which regulate blood flow by their contractile activity, and secrete extracellular matrix, prostaglandins, and cytokines; mesangial cells also have phagocytic activity, removing proteins and other molecules trapped in the glomerular basement membrane or filtration barrier

Subject: abnormal circulating creatinine level
Value: anomaly in the blood concentration of this product of creatine catabolism; abnormal levels indicative of renal dysfunction

Subject: abnormal myocardium layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the middle layer of the heart, comprised mainly of striated cardiac muscle fibers

Subject: cardiomyopathy
Value: diseases of the heart (myocardium); may result from many causes

Subject: insulin resistance
Value: diminished effectiveness of insulin in lowering plasma glucose levels

Subject: abnormal amino acid level
Value: any anomaly in the amount of a carboxylic acid containing one or more amino groups (-NH2) and a carboxyl (-COOH) group

Subject: decreased heart rate
Value: fewer than average resting heart beats per minute, usually measured by the number of times the heart ventricles contract per unit of time, usually per minute

Subject: abnormal fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue

Subject: abnormal gonadal fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the ovaries or testes

Subject: abnormal inguinal fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue found in the groin

Subject: abnormal retroperitoneal fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue found on the dorsal side of the peritoneum

Subject: atherosclerotic lesions
Value: thickening and loss of elasticity of arterial walls, involving plaque-like lipid deposition and thickening of intimal layers within arteries; progresses to narrowing of arterial lumens with fibrosis and calcification resulting in restriction of blood flow

Subject: increased susceptibility to atherosclerosis
Value: more likely than normal to develop thickening and loss of elasticity of arterial walls, involving lipid deposition and thickening of intimal layers within arteries

Subject: altered susceptibility to atherosclerosis
Value: a change in the likelihood that an organism will develop thickening and loss of elasticity of arterial walls, involving lipid deposition and thickening of intimal layers within arteries

Subject: decreased susceptibility to atherosclerosis
Value: less likely than normal to develop thickening and loss of elasticity of arterial walls, involving lipid deposition and thickening of intimal layers within arteries

Subject: abnormal intestinal lipid absorption
Value: any anomaly in the ability of the body to take up lipids into the blood by absorption from the small intestine

Subject: increased circulating aspartate transaminase level
Value: greater than normal concentration in the blood of this enzyme, which catalyzes the reversible transfer of an amine group from l-glutamic acid to oxaloacetic acid, forming alpha-ketoglutaric acid and l-aspartic acid; aids in diagnosis of viral hepatitis and myocardial infarction

Subject: increased circulating bilirubin level
Value: increased concentration in the blood of the bile pigment bilirubin, normally found in the liver and in red blood cells

Subject: abnormal circulating corticosterone level
Value: anomaly in the amount of the adrenocortical steroid in the blood that induces glycogen deposition and regulates sodium conservation and potassium secretion

Subject: abnormal circulating aldosterone level
Value: anomaly in the blood concentration of the hormone that is secreted by the adrenal cortex and regulates sodium conservation and potassium secretion in the distal renal tubule

Subject: increased T cell proliferation
Value: increase in the ability of a naive T cell population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division in response to stimuli

Subject: increased susceptibility to autoimmune disorder
Value: greater likelihood that an organism will develop disease characterized by production of antibodies that react with host tissues or immune effector cells that are autoreactive to endogenous peptides

Subject: decreased susceptibility to autoimmune disorder
Value: reduced likelihood that an organism will develop disease characterized by production of antibodies that react with host tissues or immune effector cells that are autoreactive to endogenous peptides

Subject: small cranium
Value: reduced size of the cranium

Subject: abnormal patella morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the large sesamoid bone that covers the anterior surface of the knee

Subject: abnormal ilium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the broad, flaring portion of the hip bone, which is distinct at birth, but later fuses with the ischium and the pubis

Subject: enlarged thyroid gland
Value: increased size of the endocrine gland located in the front and to the sides of the upper part of the trachea, and which secretes thyroid hormone and calcitonin

Subject: positive geotaxis
Value: mice, when placed on a downward on a slanting grid, walk down without turning around, or exhibit a delay in turning around, whereas wild type mice will always turn around and walk upward

Subject: novel environmental response-related retropulsion
Value: when confronted with a novel stimulus, subjects exhibit involuntary backward walking

Subject: abnormal incisor morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the long teeth, normally consisting of two pairs, top and bottom, that are the most anterior and prominent in the jaw

Subject: growth retardation of incisors
Value: developmental delay of the growth of the incisors, the long pointed teeth, most anterior and prominent in the jaw

Subject: urolithiasis
Value: presence of calculi in any part of the urinary system

Subject: small pituitary gland
Value: reduced size of the pituitary gland, the compound gland suspended from the base of the hypothalamus

Subject: abnormal Langerhans cell physiology
Value: atypical or failure of normal function of the stellate dendritic cell of myeloid origin, that appears clear on light microscopy and has a dark-staining, indented nucleus and characteristic inclusions (Birbeck granules) in the cytoplasm; Langerhans cells are found principally in the stratum spinosum of the epidermis, but they also occur in other stratified epithelia and have been identified in the lung, lymph nodes, spleen, and thymus

Subject: decreased susceptibility to prion infection
Value: reduced likelihood that an organism will develop ill effects from the small proteinaceous infectious particles which are resistant to inactivation by procedures that modify nucleic acids and which contain an abnormal isoform of a cellular protein that is a major and necessary component

Subject: increased susceptibility to prion infection
Value: increased likelihood that an organism will develop ill effects from the small proteinaceous infectious particles which are resistant to inactivation by procedures that modify nucleic acids and which contain an abnormal isoform of a cellular protein that is a major and necessary component

Subject: abnormal bile salt homeostasis
Value: anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium of the steroid salts derived from cholesterol in the liver, produced as bile acids and secreted in the biliary system as bile salts; these play an important role in the digestion and absorption of fats

Subject: variegated coat color
Value: an irregular and random patchwork of two or more colors in the coat

Subject: renal/urinary system phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of any of the organs or tissues responsible for fluid volume regulation, regulating electrolytes, maintaining acid-base homeostasis, and elimination of water and water soluble waste products in a mammalian organism that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: muscle phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the mammalian tissue composed of contractile cells or fibers that effects movement of an organ or part of the body that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: liver/biliary system phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the  mammalian liver, gall bladder, or bile ducts that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: limbs/digits/tail phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the subdivision of a mammalian organism that protrudes from the body that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: adipose tissue phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of mammalian fat tissue that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: homeostasis/metabolism phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics related to a state of equilibrium in the body with respect to various functions and to chemical composition of the fluids and tissues or the processes that cause many of the chemical changes in living mammalian organisms that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: hearing/vestibular/ear phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of mammalian system responsible for the perception of spatial orientation and auditory stimuli that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: growth/size/body region phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics related to the overall or change in physical magnitude or an anatomical structure which is a subpart of the whole organism manifested in a mammalian organism through development and lifespan

Subject: endocrine/exocrine gland phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of an organ that functions as a secretory or excretory organ in a mammalian organism that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: embryo phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the manifested in a mammalian organism before birth, including embryonic and fetal stages and embryonic and extraembryonic tissues

Subject: digestive/alimentary phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the mammalian system dedicated to the mechanical, chemical, and enzymatic processing of food that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: craniofacial phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the face or head of a mammalian organism that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: cellular phenotype
Value: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the basic structural and functional unit of all mammalian organisms that are manifested through development and lifespan

Subject: cardiovascular system phenotype
