Value: reduction in the production or release of a cytokine which enhances the cytotoxic activity of NK cells and cytotoxic T-cells and appears to play a role both as neuroimmunomodulator and in the induction of mucosal immunity

Subject: abnormal interleukin-2 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a soluble substance elaborated by antigen- or mitogen-stimulated T-cells which induces DNA synthesis in naive lymphocytes

Subject: increased interleukin-2 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a soluble substance elaborated by antigen- or mitogen-stimulated T-cells which induces DNA synthesis in naive lymphocytes

Subject: decreased interleukin-2 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a soluble substance elaborated by antigen- or mitogen-stimulated T-cells which induces DNA synthesis in naive lymphocytes

Subject: abnormal interleukin-23 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a heterodimeric cytokine that plays a role in innate and adaptive immune responses; it is produced by dendritic cells, macrophages and a variety of other immune cells

Subject: increased interleukin-23 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a heterodimeric cytokine that plays a role in innate and adaptive immune responses; it is produced by dendritic cells, macrophages and a variety of other immune cells

Subject: decreased interleukin-23 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a heterodimeric cytokine that plays a role in innate and adaptive immune responses; it is produced by dendritic cells, macrophages and a variety of other immune cells

Subject: abnormal interleukin-23a secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of the p19 subunit of interleukin-23

Subject: increased interleukin-23a secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of the p19 subunit of interleukin-23

Subject: decreased interleukin-23a secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of the p19 subunit of interleukin-23

Subject: abnormal interleukin-3 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a multilineage cell growth factor secreted by lymphocytes, epithelial cells and astrocytes which stimulates clonal proliferation and differentiation of various types of blood and tissue cells

Subject: increased interleukin-3 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a multilineage cell growth factor secreted by lymphocytes, epithelial cells and astrocytes which stimulates clonal proliferation and differentiation of various types of blood and tissue cells

Subject: decreased interleukin-3 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a multilineage cell growth factor secreted by lymphocytes, epithelial cells and astrocytes which stimulates clonal proliferation and differentiation of various types of blood and tissue cells

Subject: abnormal interleukin-4 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a soluble factor produced by activated T-cells that induces the expression of MHC class II genes and FC receptors on B-cells and causes their proliferation and differentiation; it also acts on T-cells, mast cells and several other hematopoietic lineage cells

Subject: increased interleukin-4 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a soluble factor produced by activated T-cells that induces the expression of MHC class II genes and FC receptors on B-cells and causes their proliferation and differentiation; it also acts on T-cells, mast cells and several other hematopoietic lineage cells

Subject: decreased interleukin-4 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a soluble factor produced by activated T-cells that induces the expression of MHC class II genes and FC receptors on B-cells and causes their proliferation and differentiation; it also acts on T-cells, mast cells and several other hematopoietic lineage cells

Subject: abnormal interleukin-5 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a cytokine that promotes differentiation and activation of eosinophils; it also triggers activated B-cells to differentiate into immunoglobulin-secreting cells

Subject: increased interleukin-5 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a cytokine that promotes differentiation and activation of eosinophils; it also triggers activated B-cells to differentiate into immunoglobulin-secreting cells

Subject: decreased interleukin-5 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a cytokine that promotes differentiation and activation of eosinophils; it also triggers activated B-cells to differentiate into immunoglobulin-secreting cells

Subject: abnormal interleukin-6 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a cytokine that stimulates the growth and differentiation of B-cells and is also a growth factor for hybridomas and plasmacytomas, and is produced by many different cells including T-cells, monocytes and fibroblasts

Subject: increased interleukin-6 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a cytokine that stimulates the growth and differentiation of B-cells and is also a growth factor for hybridomas and plasmacytomas, and is produced by many different cells including T-cells, monocytes and fibroblasts

Subject: decreased interleukin-6 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a cytokine that stimulates the growth and differentiation of B-cells and is also a growth factor for hybridomas and plasmacytomas, and is produced by many different cells including T-cells, monocytes and fibroblasts

Subject: abnormal interleukin-7 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a cytokine produced by bone marrow stromal cells that promotes the growth of B-cell precursors and is co-mitogenic with interleukin-2 for mature T-cell activation

Subject: increased interleukin-7 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a cytokine produced by bone marrow stromal cells that promotes the growth of B-cell precursors and is co-mitogenic with interleukin-2 for mature T-cell activation

Subject: decreased interleukin-7 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a cytokine produced by bone marrow stromal cells that promotes the growth of B-cell precursors and is co-mitogenic with interleukin-2 for mature T-cell activation

Subject: abnormal interleukin-9 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a multifunctional cytokine secreted by primarily by activated TH2 cells that may play a role as a regulator of allergic inflammation, and has been shown to enhance the growth and differentiation of mast cells, and can act on a variety of other immune cells

Subject: increased interleukin-9 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a multifunctional cytokine secreted by primarily by activated TH2 cells that may play a role as a regulator of allergic inflammation, and has been shown to enhance the growth and differentiation of mast cells, and can act on a variety of other immune cells

Subject: decreased interleukin-9 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a multifunctional cytokine secreted by primarily by activated TH2 cells that may play a role as a regulator of allergic inflammation, and has been shown to enhance the growth and differentiation of mast cells, and can act on a variety of other immune cells

Subject: abnormal cytokine level
Value: deviation from the normal levels of any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells

Subject: increased lung carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a malignant neoplasm of the lung, arising from epithelial cells, usually glandular or squamous, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased lung small cell carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of an anaplastic, highly malignant, and usually bronchogenic carcinoma composed of small ovoid cells with scanty neoplasm, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased lung non-small cell carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a heterogeneous aggregate of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased lung squamous cell carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a lung carcinoma derived from stratified squamous epithelium, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased lung large cell carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a bronchogenic tumor of undifferentiated (anaplastic) cells of large size, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: impaired neutrophil recruitment
Value: reduced diffusion or accumulation of neutrophils in tissues or cells in response to a wide variety of substances released at the sites of inflammatory reactions

Subject: impaired neutrophil chemotaxis
Value: defect in the movement of neutrophils guided by a specific chemical concentration gradient

Subject: abnormal chemokine level
Value: deviation from the normal levels of any of the class of pro-inflammatory cytokines that attract and activate leukocytes

Subject: abnormal chemokine secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or cellular release of any of the class of pro-inflammatory cytokines that attract and activate leukocytes

Subject: impaired eosinophil recruitment
Value: reduced diffusion or accumulation of eosinophils in tissues or cells in response to a wide variety of substances released at the sites of inflammatory reactions

Subject: impaired eosinophil chemotaxis
Value: defect in the movement of eosinophils guided by a specific chemical concentration gradient

Subject: enlarged heart atrium
Value: increased size of one or both of the two upper chambers of the heart, to which the blood returns from the circulation

Subject: enlarged heart left atrium
Value: increased size of the left upper chamber of the heart

Subject: enlarged heart right atrium
Value: increased size of the right upper chamber of the heart

Subject: increased memory B cell number
Value: greater number of distinctly differentiated long-lived B cells that are readily activated upon reencounter of an antigenic determinant; memory B cells differentiate from antigen-activated B cells which have been selected for expression of higher affinity immunoglobulin

Subject: decreased memory B cell number
Value: reduced number of distinctly differentiated long-lived B cells that are readily activated upon reencounter of an antigenic determinant; memory B cells differentiate from antigen-activated B cells which have been selected for expression of higher affinity immunoglobulin

Subject: fused phalanges
Value: anomaly of the long bones of the digits resulting in some or all the bones being joined together

Subject: abnormal hair shaft melanin granule morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of pigment polymers in the hair shaft

Subject: reduced hair shaft melanin granule number
Value: the number of pigment polymers in the hair shaft is less than normal

Subject: abnormal hair shaft melanin granule distribution
Value: disruption in the regular arrangement of pigment polymers in the hair shaft

Subject: decreased susceptibility to endotoxin shock
Value: less than the expected early reaction of the microcirculation to endotoxins such as LPS, characterized by movement of fluid and leukocytes from the blood into extravascular tissues and often resulting in death

Subject: increased susceptibility to endotoxin shock
Value: more than the expected early reaction of the microcirculation to endotoxins such as LPS, characterized by movement of fluid and leukocytes from the blood into extravascular tissues and often resulting in death

Subject: micromelia
Value: disproportionately short or small limbs

Subject: abnormal spleen physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the organ that filters blood and stores red corpuscles and platelets

Subject: abnormal liver iron level
Value: anomaly in the amount of iron present in the liver tissue

Subject: abnormal spleen iron level
Value: anomaly in the amount of iron present in the spleen tissue

Subject: abnormal intestinal iron level
Value: anomaly in the amount of iron present in the large or small intestinal tissue

Subject: abnormal heart iron level
Value: anomaly in the amount of iron present in the heart tissue

Subject: abnormal kidney iron level
Value: anomaly in the amount of iron present in the kidney tissue

Subject: decreased liver iron level
Value: reduction in the amount of iron present in the liver tissue

Subject: abnormal B cell anergy
Value: any anomaly in the process contributing to anergy in B cells, a state of functional inactivation which is part of B cell tolerance induction

Subject: abnormal central B cell anergy
Value: any anomaly of the processes of B cell anergy that occur in the bone marrow

Subject: abnormal peripheral B cell anergy
Value: any anomaly of the processes of B cell anergy that occur outside the bone marrow

Subject: abnormal T cell anergy
Value: any anomaly in the process contributing to anergy in T cells, a state of functional inactivation which is part of T cell tolerance induction

Subject: abnormal central T cell anergy
Value: any anomaly of the processes of T cell anergy that occur in the thymus

Subject: abnormal peripheral T cell anergy
Value: any anomaly of the processes of T cell anergy that occur outside the thymus

Subject: abnormal interferon level
Value: deviation from the normal levels of proteins secreted by vertebrate cells in response to a wide variety of inducers; they confer resistance against many different viruses, inhibit proliferation of normal and malignant cells, impede multiplication of intracellular parasites, enhance macrophage and granulocyte phagocytosis, augment natural killer cell activity, and show several other immunomodulatory functions

Subject: abnormal interleukin level
Value: deviation from the normal levels of soluble factors which stimulate growth-related activities of leukocytes as well as other cell types; they enhance cell proliferation and differentiation, DNA synthesis, secretion of other biologically active molecules and responses to immune and inflammatory stimuli

Subject: abnormal tumor necrosis factor level
Value: deviation from the normal levels of a serum glycoprotein produced by activated macrophages and NK cells and involved in initiating local inflammatory responses, particularly by its action on the endothelium of local blood vessels; its actions result in increased vascular permeability and induction of expression of adhesion molecules on the endothelium

Subject: abnormal osteocyte morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a mature osteoblast that has become embedded in the bone matrix (osteoid) in a small cavity called lacuna and that extends cytoplasmic (dendritic) processes away from the cell body toward other osteocytes and neighboring cells in small channels called canaliculi

Subject: abnormal T cell receptor V(D)J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which T cell receptor V, D, and J, or V and J gene segments, depending on the specific locus, are recombined within a single locus

Subject: abnormal immunoglobulin V(D)J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which immunoglobulin V, D, and J or V and J gene segments, depending on the specific locus, are recombined within a single locus

Subject: abnormal T cell receptor alpha chain V-J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which V and J gene segments of the T cell receptor alpha chain are recombined

Subject: abnormal T cell receptor gamma chain V-J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which V and J gene segments of the T cell receptor gamma chain are recombined

Subject: abnormal T cell receptor beta chain V(D)J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which V, D, and J segments of the T cell receptor beta chain are recombined

Subject: abnormal T cell receptor delta chain V(D)J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which V, D, and J segments of the T cell receptor delta chain are recombined

Subject: abnormal immunoglobulin heavy chain V(D)J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which V, D, and J gene segments of the immunoglobulin heavy chain are recombined

Subject: abnormal immunoglobulin light chain V-J recombination
Value: any anomaly in the process by which V and J gene segments of the immunoglobulin light chain are recombined

Subject: embryonic lethality
Value: <death of an animal within the embryonic period prior to organogenesis (Mus: prior to E14)>

Subject: abnormal mast cell degranulation
Value: abnormalities in the exocytosis of secretory granules containing preformed mediators such as histamine, serotonin, and neutral proteases by a mast cell

Subject: increased mast cell degranulation
Value: increase in the exocytosis of secretory granules containing preformed mediators such as histamine, serotonin, and neutral proteases by a mast cell

Subject: decreased mast cell degranulation
Value: reduction in the exocytosis of secretory granules containing preformed mediators such as histamine, serotonin, and neutral proteases by a mast cell

Subject: abnormal B cell receptor editing
Value: any anomaly in the process of replacing receptors on B cells, in which RAG gene expression allows continued light-chain gene rearrangement and expression of a new light change which combines with the previous heavy chain to form a new receptor

Subject: abnormal hair medullary septa cells
Value: septa-forming cells of hair medulla are abnormal in size or arrangement

Subject: abnormal hair medulla air spaces
Value: air spaces between septa-forming cells of hair medulla are larger or smaller than normal

Subject: abnormal plasmacytoid dendritic cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of phagocytic dendritic cells that are morphologically similar to plasma cells, but do not express B lineage markers, and produce large amounts of alpha/beta interferons (IFN-/) in response to viral and bacterial stimuli; plasmacytoid dendritic cells are found in the thymic medulla and lymph node T cell areas and are responsible for immune tolerance

Subject: decreased survivor rate
Value: a smaller percentage of organisms than expected survive to adulthood and have a lifespan similar to controls

Subject: elongated vertebral column
Value: increased rostral-caudal length of the complete structure forming the rostral-caudal axis of the skeleton formed from the alternating segments of vertebra and intervertebral discs which support the spinal cord

Subject: increased heart ventricle size
Value: increased average size of the heart ventricles compared to the average for a particular population

Subject: abnormal heart ventricle pressure
Value: any anomaly in the pressure within a cardiac ventricle

Subject: increased right ventricle peak pressure
Value: increase in the difference between right ventricular systolic and diastolic pressures

Subject: increased right ventricle diastolic pressure
Value: increase in the pressure of the right ventricle between heart beats when the heart is relaxed

Subject: abnormal lymphangiogenesis
Value: any anomaly in the formation of lymphatic vessels from pre-existing lymphatic vessels

Subject: abnormal maternal behavior
Value: any response from the mother or attending female related to the ability of young to thrive

Subject: increased pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of an adenocarcinoma arising from cells of the pancreas that secrete digestive enzymes, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: abnormal B cell apoptosis
Value: change in the timing or the number of B cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: increased B cell apoptosis
Value: increase in the timing or the number of B cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: decreased B cell apoptosis
Value: reduction in the timing or the number of B cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: craniorachischisis
Value: the most severe form of neural tube defect leaving the neural tube open from the midbrain or rostral hindbrain to the base of the spine; in mammals, craniorachischisis arises as a failure of a de novo closure event occurring during primary neurulation at the boundary of the future hindbrain and cervical spine (day 22 postfertilization in humans and E8.5 in mice); craniorachischisis totalis, the most complete form of craniorachischisis, presents anencephaly and total spina bifida together and is lethal

Subject: abnormal sternum manubrium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the broad, handle-like part of the sternum which articulates with the clavicles and the first two pairs of ribs

Subject: abnormal hindgut morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the caudal portion of the primitive digestive tube of the embryo

Subject: abnormal tailgut morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the extension of the hindgut of the primitive digestive tube of the embryo, caudal to the location of the anal opening

Subject: abnormal fetal cardiomyocyte morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of fetal and neonatal heart cells that undergo proliferation and are not yet terminally differentiated into binucleate or multinucleate cardiac myocytes

Subject: abnormal olfactory epithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the epithelial cells that line the interior of the nose

Subject: abnormal NK cell degranulation
Value: anomaly in the exocytosis of secretory granules containing preformed mediators, such as perforin and granzyme, from NK cells

Subject: decreased NK cell degranulation
Value: reduction in the exocytosis of secretory granules containing preformed mediators, such as perforin and granzyme, from NK cells

Subject: increased NK cell degranulation
Value: increase in the exocytosis of secretory granules containing preformed mediators, such as perforin and granzyme, from NK cells

Subject: abnormal lens epithelium apoptosis
Value: anomaly in the number of lens epithelial cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: increased lens epithelium apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of lens epithelial cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal lens fiber apoptosis
Value: anomaly in the number of lens fibers cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: increased lens fiber apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of lens fibers cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: facial cleft
Value: a cleft resulting from incomplete merging or fusion of any of the embryonic facial processes that normally unite to form the face

Subject: lateral facial cleft
Value: presence of a primitive oral fissure (macrostomia) that extends into the anlage region of the ears, between the 1st and 2nd pharyngeal arches

Subject: oblique facial cleft
Value: presence of a facial fissure that runs from the lower lid edge to the lower edge of the nasal opening that results from a deficient fusion of the epithelium of the lacrimonasal duct

Subject: increased small intestinal crypt cell apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of small intestinal crypt cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal erythroid progenitor cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a progenitor cell committed to the erythroid lineage

Subject: abnormal intestinal smooth muscle morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the nonstriated, involuntary muscle tissue lining the intestine

Subject: abnormal placental labyrinth vasculature morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of blood vessels of the layer of the placenta where embryonic and maternal blood exchange nutrients and waste products

Subject: abnormal circulating amylase level
Value: any anomaly in the concentration of a group of amylolytic enzymes that cleave starch, glycogen, and related alpha-1,4-glucans in the blood

Subject: decreased circulating amylase level
Value: reduction in the concentration of a group of amylolytic enzymes that cleave starch, glycogen, and related alpha-1,4-glucans in the blood

Subject: increased circulating amylase level
Value: greater concentration of a group of amylolytic enzymes that cleave starch, glycogen, and related alpha-1,4-glucans in the blood

Subject: increased liver iron level
Value: increase in the amount of iron present in the liver tissue

Subject: decreased spleen iron level
Value: reduction in the amount of iron present in the spleen tissue

Subject: increased spleen iron level
Value: increase in the amount of iron present in the spleen tissue

Subject: increased circulating iron level
Value: elevation in the concentration of iron in the blood

Subject: abnormal brain iron level
Value: any anomaly in the amount of iron present in the brain tissue

Subject: abnormal rostrocaudal coat patterning
Value: irregular or unusual pigmentation pattern of the rostral-to-caudal axis compared to control animals

Subject: decreased common myeloid progenitor cell number
Value: reduced number of progenitor cells committed to myeloid lineage, including the megakaryocyte and erythroid lineages

Subject: decreased nerve conduction velocity
Value: decrease in the rate at which an electrical impulse travels through a nerve

Subject: anterior staphyloma
Value: any structural anomaly resulting in bulging near the anterior pole of the eyeball

Subject: petechiae
Value: very small blood spots or splotches that appear especially in skin as a result of localized hemorrhage

Subject: hematoma
Value: an abnormal localized accumulation of clotted or partially clotted blood in an organ or a soft tissue space as a result of localized hemorrhage

Subject: abnormal interfrontal bone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly or presence of a bone between the frontal bones in the skull; an extra bony plate within the anterior fontanelle that is not usually present

Subject: abnormal mastication
Value: any anomaly in the process of biting and mashing food with the teeth prior to swallowing

Subject: abnormal blood uric acid level
Value: aberrant concentration in the blood of the final oxidation product of purine catabolism in humans and primates, but which in rodents and most other mammals is normally is further oxidized by uricase to allantoin that is excreted in the urine

Subject: increased blood uric acid level
Value: greater concentration in the blood of the final oxidation product of purine catabolism in humans and primates, but which in rodents and most other mammals is normally is further oxidized by uricase to allantoin that is excreted in the urine

Subject: decreased blood uric acid level
Value: reduced concentration in the blood of the final oxidation product of purine catabolism in humans and primates, but which in rodents and most other mammals is normally is further oxidized by uricase to allantoin that is excreted in the urine

Subject: abnormal interventricular septum membranous part morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the membranous portion of the wall between the two lower chambers of the heart

Subject: absent interventricular septum membranous part
Value: absence of the membranous portion of the wall between the two lower chambers of the heart

Subject: abnormal cardiac epithelial to mesenchymal transition
Value: anomaly in the process by which endocardial cells of the atrioventricular canal or the outflow tract lose their epithelial characteristics, delaminate from the endocardial sheet, become migratory and invade the cardiac jelly, and develop mesenchymal characteristics eventually forming both the endocardial cushions required for septum and atrioventricular valve formation and the cushions of the outflow tract that form the conotruncal septum

Subject: abnormal splenic cell ratio
Value: deviation from the standard ratios of splenocyte subpopulations compared to control samples

Subject: abnormal thymus cell ratio
Value: deviation from the standard ratios of thymocyte subpopulations compared to control samples

Subject: abnormal lymph node cell ratio
Value: deviation from the standard ratios of lymph node cell subpopulations compared to control samples

Subject: triphalangia
Value: anomaly in which three phalanges are present in the thumb or great toe

Subject: abnormal nucleolus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the small rounded nuclear substructure that produces ribonucleoprotein

Subject: abnormal insulin-like growth factor I level
Value: anomaly in the concentration of a polypeptide hormone with growth-regulating, insulin-like, and mitogenic activities

Subject: hemivertebra
Value: a congenital malformation of the spine in which only half of a vertebral body develops

Subject: caudal hemivertebra
Value: a congenital malformation of the caudal vertebrae in which only half of the vertebral body develops

Subject: abnormal melanosome transport
Value: any anomaly in the directed movement of melanosomes into, out of, within or between cells

Subject: abnormal intercellular signaling peptide or protein level
Value: abnormal concentration of any regulatory protein or peptide that is a signaling molecule involved in the process of paracrine communication

Subject: abnormal transforming growth factor beta level
Value: abnormal concentration of a paracrine growth factor that has a potential role in embryonic development, cellular differentiation, hormone secretion, and immune function

Subject: increased transforming growth factor beta level
Value: greater concentration of a paracrine growth factor that has a potential role in embryonic development, cellular differentiation, hormone secretion, and immune function

Subject: decreased transforming growth factor beta level
Value: reduced concentration of a paracrine growth factor that has a potential role in embryonic development, cellular differentiation, hormone secretion, and immune function

Subject: absent acrosome
Value: mature spermatozoa lack the cap-like structure at the anterior end of the sperm head that produces enzymes needed for egg penetration

Subject: abnormal spike wave discharge
Value: anomaly in the characteristic epileptiformic electroencephalographic (EEG) activity detected in generalized absence epilepsy

Subject: ruptured lens capsule
Value: a break or tear in the elastic, clear, membrane-like structure, that is outer most layer of the lens

Subject: lipofuscinosis
Value: accumulation of intracellular autofluorescent material, in the form of brownish fatty pigment, in lysosomes as a normal part of senescence or aging

Subject: absent subcutaneous adipose tissue
Value: absence of adipose tissue beneath the skin

Subject: decreased subcutaneous adipose tissue amount
Value: reduction in amount of adipose tissue beneath the skin

Subject: abnormal paraventricular hypothalamic nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a group of magnocellular neurons located in the periventricular zone of the anterior half of the hypothalamus

Subject: abnormal supraoptic nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a group of cells in the hypothalamus located over the lateral border of the optic tract; neurons produce and transport vasopressin

Subject: abnormal suprachiasmatic nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of an ovoid densely packed collection of small cells of the anterior hypothalamus lying close to the midline in a shallow impression of the optic chiasm; it receives input from the retina and influences neuroendocrine function

Subject: abnormal anterior hypothalamic nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a loose heterogeneous collection of cells in the anterior hypothalamus, continuous rostrally with the medial and lateral preoptic areas and caudally with the tuber cinereum

Subject: abnormal hemoglobin concentration distribution width
Value: anomaly in the standard deviation of the distribution of erythrocytes by their cellular (individual) hemoglobin concentrations

Subject: increased hemoglobin concentration distribution width
Value: higher than normal standard deviation of the distribution of erythrocytes by their cellular (individual) hemoglobin concentrations; high HDW is indicative of some types of anemia/thalassemia

Subject: decreased hemoglobin concentration distribution width
Value: lower than normal standard deviation of the distribution of erythrocytes by their cellular (individual) hemoglobin concentrations

Subject: retinal neovascularization
Value: formation of new blood vessels originating from the retinal veins and extending along the inner (vitreal) surface of the retina

Subject: decreased abdominal adipose tissue amount
Value: reduction in amount of adipose tissue associated with internal organs

Subject: bleb
Value: presence of a blister-like, nearly hemispherical structure filled with air, serous fluid or blood

Subject: eye bleb
Value: presence of blister-like structures formed in the eye during embryonic development that are usually filled with blood

Subject: fetal bleb
Value: presence of subepidermal blister-like structures on the skin, often on the head, formed during embryonic development and usually filled with blood

Subject: myelencephalic blebs
Value: presence of blister-like structures formed on the posterior portion of the embryonic hindbrain that are usually filled with blood

Subject: abnormal hair cycle anagen phase
Value: anomaly in the growth phase of the hair cycle

Subject: abnormal hair cycle catagen phase
Value: anomaly in the phase of the hair growth cycle during which cell proliferation ceases, the hair follicle shortens, and an anchored hair is produced

Subject: abnormal hair cycle telogen phase
Value: anomaly in the resting or quiescent phase of the hair growth cycle which follows cessation of proliferation (catagen) and precedes hair loss

Subject: abnormal hair shedding
Value: anomaly in the hair cycle changes the timing of the hair loss that normally follows the anagen phase

Subject: asymmetric snout
Value: presence of a snout that lacks mirrored identity on either side of the median plane

Subject: craniofacial asymmetry
Value: head or facial features that lack mirrored identity on either side of the median plane

Subject: abnormal intestinal secretion
Value: any anomaly in the quantity or rate of any substance transported from intestinal cells into the lumen of the intestine

Subject: chromosomal instability
Value: abnormalities of DNA metabolism, DNA repair, cell-cycle governance, or control of apoptosis that increase the probability that whole chromosomes or pieces of chromosomes are gained or lost during cell division, resulting in an imbalance in the number of chromosomes per cell (aneuploidy) and an enhanced rate of loss of heterozygosity

Subject: uniparental disomy
Value: abnormal assortment of chromosomes from parent to offspring whereby the chromosome number is correct, but both members of a chromosome pair or segments of a chromosome pair are inherited from the same parent

Subject: abnormal granulosa cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a supporting cell for the developing female gamete in the ovary of mammals; granulosa cells form a single layer around the mammalian oocyte in the primordial ovarian follicle and advance to form a multilayered cumulus oophorus surrounding the ovum in the Graafian follicle

Subject: anovulation
Value: complete failure of ovum to be released from an ovarian follicle

Subject: increased mature ovarian follicle number
Value: than normal numbers of ovarian follicles that are ready for ovulation and present a blanched spot (the follicular stigma) where the graafian follicle is about to rupture on the surface of the ovary; a first maturation (meiotic) division of the primary oocyte usually occurs just prior to rupture of the follicle

Subject: abnormal ovarian follicle number
Value: abnormal numbers of spheroid cell aggregations in the ovary

Subject: abnormal physiological response to xenobiotic
Value: any anomaly in the physiological or morphological changes induced by a compound foreign to living organisms  such as changes in blood pressure, changes in hormone or protein levels or hypertrophy or hypotrophy of an organ

Subject: increased physiological sensitivity to xenobiotic
Value: decrease in the dose or concentration of a compound foreign to living organisms required to induce a specific level of physiological response  or increase in the severity of physiological response to a given dose or concentration of a compound foreign  to living organisms

Subject: decreased physiological sensitivity to xenobiotic
Value: increase in the dose or concentration of a compound foreign to living organisms required to induce a specific level of physiological response or decrease in the severity of physiological response to a given dose or concentration of a compound foreign  to living organisms

Subject: abnormal xenobiotic pharmacokinetics
Value: any anomaly in the absorption, distribution, metabolism or elimination of a compound foreign to living organisms

Subject: decreased uterine NK cell number
Value: reduced cell number of a natural killer cell subset that is found in the decidual of the uterus, is CD56-high, Galectin-1-positive and CD16-negative, and is the most abundant immune cell type in the decidual during the first trimester of pregnancy

Subject: abnormal DNA methylation
Value: any anomaly in the covalent transfer of a methyl group to either N-6 of adenine or C-5 or N-4 of cytosine of DNA

Subject: abnormal DNA methylation during gametogenesis
Value: any anomaly of the covalent transfer of a methyl group to C-5 of cytosine during gamete generation, when DNA methylation patterns are established

Subject: submandibular gland inflammation
Value: local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes in either of the large major salivary glands situated beneath the mandible

Subject: lacrimal gland inflammation
Value: local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes in the glands that secrete tears

Subject: absent Harderian gland
Value: absence of the sebaceous gland located behind the eyeball that excretes fluid that facilitates movement of the nictitating membrane

Subject: abnormal enterocyte physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the epithelial cells that have an apical plasma membrane folded into microvilli to provide ample surface for the absorption of nutrients from the intestinal lumen

Subject: abnormal enterocyte proliferation
Value: anomaly in the ability of the enterocyte cell population to undergo expansion by cell division

Subject: abnormal enterocyte apoptosis
Value: change in the timing or the number of enterocytes undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: increased enterocyte apoptosis
Value: increase in the timing or the number of enterocytes undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal PML bodies
Value: alteration in structure, number or location of the subnuclear structures associated with functions including transcription, DNA repair, viral defense, stress, cell cycle regulation, proteolysis and apoptosis

Subject: abnormal splicing factor domain morphology
Value: alteration in structure, number or location of subnuclear structures comprising storage locations for elements responsible for excising non-coding regions from a primary messenger RNA transcript and joining coding regions to produce mature messenger RNA

Subject: abnormal Cajal body morphology
Value: alteration in structure, number or location of subnuclear structures involved in snRNP biogenesis and in the trafficking of snoRNPs and snRNPs

Subject: abnormal Gem morphology
Value: alteration in structure, number or location of subnuclear structures involved in snRNP biogenesis and in the trafficking of snoRNPs and snRNPs and found paired with or juxtaposed to Cajal bodies

Subject: abnormal nuclear lamina morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the inner nuclear membrane surrounding the nuclear periphery, comprising a scaffold-like network of protein filaments responsible for trafficking of mRNA to the cytoplasm

Subject: decreased hepatocyte apoptosis
Value: reduction in the number of hepatocytes undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal sperm flagellum morphology
Value: <any structural anomaly of the whiplike posterior filiform portion of the spermatozoon composed of a number of cytoskeletal elements whose proper assembly is critical for sperm motility; the mammalian flagellum is structurally divided into four major parts: the connecting piece, the midpiece, the principal piece, and the end piece>

Subject: detached sperm flagellum
Value: fragmentation of the whiplike posterior filiform portion of the spermatozoon that provides sperm motility from the sperm head

Subject: abnormal intraepithelial T cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a T cell present in columnar epithelia such as in the gastrointestinal tract; intraepithelial T cells often have distinct developmental pathways and activation requirements

Subject: abnormal intraepithelial T cell number
Value: reduced number of T cell present in columnar epithelia such as in the gastrointestinal tract; intraepithelial T cells often have distinct developmental pathways and activation requirements

Subject: increased IgG2c level
Value: greater than normal immunoglobulin class G2c level

Subject: decreased IgG2c level
Value: less than normal immunoglobulin class G2c level

Subject: abnormal acrosome morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the cap-like structure at the anterior end of the sperm head that produces enzymes needed for egg penetration

Subject: plush coat
Value: coat has a thick, velvet-like appearance

Subject: abnormal uterine fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the uterus

Subject: absent epididymal fat pad
Value: absence of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the epididymis

Subject: abnormal renal fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the kidney

Subject: abnormal mesenteric fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the mesentery

Subject: abnormal mammary fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the mammary gland

Subject: abnormal femoral fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the femur

Subject: abnormal parametrial fat pad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the extension of the subserous coat of the uterus laterally between the layers of the broad ligament

Subject: decreased total fat pad weight
Value: less than average weight of the fat pads

Subject: increased total fat pad weight
Value: greater than average weight of the fat pads

Subject: supination
Value: rotation of the pedal or prehensile extremity so the forefoot (hand) faces anteriorly to the anatomic position; rotation of the hindfoot (foot) such that the plantar surface turns upward

Subject: thin long bone epiphysis
Value: thinner than normal rounded end of a long bone

Subject: induced hyperactivity
Value: increased physical activity following stimulation such as handling, touching or noise

Subject: nervous
Value: increased, skittish, behavior induced by stimulation such as handling, touching or noise

Subject: weaving
Value: momentary, slow motions of the whole body from side to side sometimes followed by a sudden drop from an erect position

Subject: enlarged cerebellum
Value: increased size of the cerebellum

Subject: fused carpal bones
Value: anomaly of the nine nodular bones of the joint between the forelimb bones and the front paws/hands resulting in some or all the bones being joined together

Subject: abnormal astrocyte physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of one of the large neuroglia cells of nervous tissue

Subject: abnormal oligodendrocyte physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the neuroglia of the central nervous system that form the insulating myelin sheath of axons in the CNS

Subject: microgliosis
Value: a proliferation or spread of microglia in the area of a degenerative lesion or damaged tissue

Subject: fused tarsal bones
Value: anomaly of the eight bones of the instep of the paw/foot resulting in some or all the bones being joined together

Subject: absent cervical axis
Value: absence of the second cervical vertebra (C2) which forms the pivot upon which the first cervical (atlas, C1) vertebra rotates

Subject: increased neurotransmitter release
Value: increased production or release of endogenous signaling molecules normally secreted by neurons that alter the behavior of neurons or effector cells

Subject: abnormal cervical rib
Value: alternate location or appearance of a rare supernumerary rib commonly articulating with the seventh cervical vertebrae (above the normal first rib) but not reaching the sternum anteriorly

Subject: thoracoschisis
Value: congenital fissure of the chest wall

Subject: decreased cerebellar granule cell number
Value: reduction in the number of the small neurons of the granule cell layer that send parallel fibers to the upper molecular layer, where they synapse with Purkinje cell dendrites

Subject: increased cerebellar granule cell number
Value: greater number of the small neurons of the granule cell layer that send parallel fibers to the upper molecular layer, where they synapse with Purkinje cell dendrites

Subject: abnormal anterior definitive endoderm morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the mesendoderm which first migrates from the node and evolves into the foregut, from which pancreas, liver and lungs will eventually emerge

Subject: abnormal paracentral nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of one of the intralaminar nuclei of the thalamus, located medial to the central lateral nucleus

Subject: abnormal central medial nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a small cell group in the interthalamic adhesion of the thalamus that occupy the midline region of the internal medullary lamina, between the left and right paracentral nuclei

Subject: abnormal medial geniculate nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of groups of nerve cells that function as a relay of auditory input to auditory cortex, receiving the brachium of the inferior colliculus and sending processed information to the auditory cortex in the superior temporal gyrus

Subject: abnormal embryonic tissue physiology
Value: any functional anomaly in any of the tissues of the embryo proper

Subject: abnormal motile primary cilium physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the cilia of the mouse embryo found on the cells of the embryonic node, which generate flow of extraembryonic fluid surrounding the node in a distinct twirling motion that directs fluid flow asymmetrically across the cellular surface to affect asymmetric body plan organization

Subject: absent choroid plexus
Value: absence of the infoldings of blood vessels of the pia mater covered by a thin coat of ependymal cells that form tufted projections into the third, fourth, and lateral ventricles of the brain

Subject: decreased mean platelet volume
Value: reduced average content of platelet cells over normal

Subject: abnormal pituitary gland size
Value: anomaly in the average size of the compound gland suspended from the base of the hypothalamus

Subject: abnormal pituitary gland weight
Value: anomaly in the average weight of the compound gland suspended from the base of the hypothalamus

Subject: decreased pituitary gland weight
Value: reduction in the average weight of the compound gland suspended from the base of the hypothalamus

Subject: increased pituitary gland weight
Value: greater than average weight of the compound gland suspended from the base of the hypothalamus

Subject: delayed balanopreputial separation
Value: the separation of the prepuce from the glans penis (balanus), a result of the cornification of the balano-preputial epithelium, occurring at a later than expected age; balanopreputial separation is used as an index for the onset of male puberty and is androgen-sensitive in the rat

Subject: reticulocytopenia
Value: decrease in the normal number of circulating reticulocytes

Subject: abnormal induced cell death
Value: anomaly in the response to an agent that induces cessation of function at the cellular level

Subject: increased sensitivity to induced cell death
Value: decrease in the exposure level to an agent that is required to induce cessation of function at the cellular level

Subject: decreased sensitivity to induced cell death
Value: increase in the exposure level to an agent that is required to induce cessation of function at the cellular level

Subject: hyperchromic macrocytic anemia
Value: deficiency of red blood cells in which the remaining circulating erythrocyte corpuscular volume is larger than normal and the total amount of hemoglobin per cell is increased, but the percentage of hemoglobin per cell is usually in the normochromic range

Subject: abnormal neuron number
Value: anomaly in the number of the cells of the nervous system that receive, conduct, and transmit impulses

Subject: increased neuron number
Value: greater than normal numbers of the cells of the nervous system that receive, conduct, and transmit impulses

Subject: decreased neuron number
Value: fewer than normal numbers of the cells of the nervous system that receive, conduct, and transmit impulses

Subject: increased Cajal-Retzius cell number
Value: greater number of the distinct population of large, bipolar cells, distributed in a continuous band along the marginal zone of the cortex extending to the molecular layer of the dentate gyrus

Subject: ventricular tachycardia
Value: paroxysmal rapid beating of the heart originating in an ectopic focus in the heart ventricle

Subject: long radius
Value: increased length of the short bone of the lateral forearm

Subject: abnormal pancreatic delta cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the cells found in the pancreas that secrete somatostatin

Subject: abnormal pancreatic somatostatin secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release from pancreatic delta cells of a 14 amino acid peptide that inhibits growth hormone release and is found in the central and peripheral nervous systems, the gut, and other organs

Subject: abnormal cellular hemoglobin content
Value: anomaly in the mean of the red blood cell hemoglobin concentration (RBC CH) histogram, which represents the distribution of red blood cells by the amount of hemoglobin present in each individual cell independent of cell volume

Subject: increased cellular hemoglobin content
Value: increase in the mean of the red blood cell hemoglobin concentration (RBC CH) histogram, which represents the distribution of red blood cells by the amount of hemoglobin present in each individual cell independent of cell volume

Subject: decreased cellular hemoglobin content
Value: decrease in the mean of the red blood cell hemoglobin concentration (RBC CH) histogram, which represents the distribution of red blood cells by the amount of hemoglobin present in each individual cell independent of cell volume

Subject: abnormal placenta junctional zone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the fetally derived placental region that separates the maternal uterine tissue from the placenta labyrinth

Subject: abnormal trophoblast glycogen cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a glycogen-accumulating trophoblast cell that arises in the junctional zone of the placenta

Subject: abnormal spongiotrophoblast cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a trophoblast cell that arises in the junctional zone of the placenta

Subject: abnormal axon pruning
Value: defects in the developmental elimination of axons that fail to participate in an active neuronal circuit by retraction, degeneration, shedding or other mechanism

Subject: abnormal basal metabolism
Value: any anomaly in heat production of an organism at the lowest level of cell chemistry in an inactive, awake, and fasting state

Subject: abnormal carbon dioxide production
Value: deviation from the normal rate at which carbon dioxide leaves the blood and enters the alveolar gas

Subject: increased carbon dioxide production
Value: increase in the rate at which carbon dioxide leaves the blood and enters the alveolar gas

Subject: decreased carbon dioxide production
Value: reduction in the rate at which carbon dioxide leaves the blood and enters the alveolar gas

Subject: increased basal metabolism
Value: increase in heat production of an organism at the lowest level of cell chemistry in an inactive, awake, and fasting state

Subject: abnormal chiasmata formation
Value: atypical contact between nonsister chromatids of homologous chromosomes during meiosis I, precluding formation of the expected number of cross-shaped configurations representing recombination events

Subject: absent chiasmata formation
Value: during meiosis I there are no observable cross-over regions where nonsister chromatids of homologous chromosomes recombine with each other

Subject: abnormal lacrimal apparatus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the network of orbital structures of the eye that secrete and drain tears from the surface of the eyeball into the nasal cavity; these parts include the lacrimal glands, lacrimal lake, lacrimal ducts, lacrimal canals, lacrimal sacs, nasolacrimal ducts, and lacrimal puncta

Subject: abnormal nasolacrimal duct morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the paired channels leading from the lacrimal sacs to the inferior meatus of the nose, through which tears are conducted through the nasal cavity

Subject: choanal atresia
Value: blockage of the back of the nasal passage by abnormal bony or soft tissue, usually due to failure of the bucconasal membrane to involute during development

Subject: abnormal ethmoturbinate morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the conchae of the ethmoid bone which occupy the caudal part of the nasal fossae and form the lateral and superior portions of the turbinate bones in mammals

Subject: ethmoturbinate hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, of the conchae of the ethmoid bone which occupy the caudal part of the nasal fossae and form the lateral and superior portions of the turbinate bones in mammals

Subject: decreased erythroid progenitor cell number
Value: reduced numbers of progenitors of the erythrocyte lineage

Subject: proportional dwarf
Value: abnormally undersized with both limbs and trunk symmetrically shorter; usually due to chemical, endocrine, nutritional or nonosseous influences

Subject: delayed male fertility
Value: ability of a male organism to produce live offspring occurring at a later than expected age

Subject: delayed female fertility
Value: ability of a female organism to produce live offspring occurring at a later than expected age

Subject: abnormal vagina size
Value: anomaly in the size of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva

Subject: abnormal vagina weight
Value: anomaly in the weight of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva

Subject: increased vagina weight
Value: increase in the weight of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva

Subject: decreased vagina weight
Value: decrease in the weight of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva

Subject: enlarged vagina
Value: increase in the size of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva

Subject: vagina hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size of the vagina, usually due an increased number of cells

Subject: small vagina
Value: decrease in the size of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva

Subject: vagina hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size of the vagina, usually due to a reduced number of cells

Subject: hemimelia
Value: congenital absence of part of an extremity, such as absent fibula with the tibia present

Subject: abnormal liver parenchyma morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the functional units of the liver including the lobules

Subject: abnormal liver lobule morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the polygonal structure of the liver that consists of hepatocytes radiating outward from a hepatic vein

Subject: abnormal liver perisinusoidal space morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the extravascular space in the liver between the parenchymal cells and a sinusoid that contains the blood plasma

Subject: abnormal liver sinusoid morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the hepatic distensible vascular blood channels lined with highly fenestrated endothelial cells that function to exchange fluids, nutrients, proteins and wastes

Subject: abnormal Ito cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the fat-storing cells that line the hepatic sinusoids

Subject: abnormal bile canaliculus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the intercellular channels that take up bile from hepatocytes and transport it to the bile ducts

Subject: abnormal portal lobule morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the triangular region on the periphery of the liver lobules that contain a bile duct and a terminal branch of the hepatic artery and portal vein, and may also include a lymphatic vessel

Subject: abnormal portal triad morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the three vessels of the portal lobule including the bile duct, a terminal branch of the hepatic artery and portal vein, and may also include a lymphatic vessel

Subject: early vaginal opening
Value: the opening of the genital canal in a female occurring at an earlier than expected age

Subject: early reproductive senescence
Value: loss of reproductive capacity occurring at an earlier than expected age

Subject: abnormal blood osmolality
Value: anomaly in the concentration of ions in the blood or blood fractions compared to the normal state, sometimes reported as increased or decreased osmotic fragility

Subject: increased blood osmolality
Value: increase in the concentration of ions in the blood compared to the normal state

Subject: decreased blood osmolality
Value: decrease in the concentration of ions in the blood compared to the normal state

Subject: absent anus
Value: absence of the lower opening of the digestive tract

Subject: absent cecum
Value: absence of the large sac at the ileum and large intestine junction

Subject: absent hallux
Value: absence of the first or primary digit of the foot

Subject: premature hair regrowth
Value: faster initiation of the hair growth cycle (anagen) after catagen phase

Subject: abnormal vibrissa number
Value: any anomaly in the number of the stiff hairs projecting from the face around the nose of most mammals which act as touch receptors

Subject: progressive hair loss
Value: thinning of hair (coat) over time, usually in a defined pattern, until entirely gone with no recurrent growth

Subject: abnormal sesamoid bone of gastrocnemius morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the small sesamoid bones situated behind the condyles of the femur

Subject: prolonged estrous cycle
Value: increase in the length of the estrous cycle

Subject: short estrous cycle
Value: decrease in the length of the estrous cycle

Subject: delayed estrous cycle
Value: onset of the estrous cycle of females occurring at a later than expected day/age

Subject: absent estrous cycle
Value: failure of female animals to enter or progress through the estrous cycle

Subject: abnormal diestrus
Value: any anomaly or aberrant timing of the last phase of the estrous cycle, during which unfertilized eggs are eliminated, the vagina and vulva are at a minimum size, and new follicles begin to undergo a rapid growth for the next ovulation; if pregnancy does not occur, the metestrous phase is ultimately followed by the diestrous phase

Subject: prolonged diestrus
Value: increase in the length of the diestrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: short diestrus
Value: decrease in the length of the diestrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: abnormal proestrus
Value: any anomaly or aberrant timing of the first phase of the estrous cycle which begins when a new batch of eggs reach maturity within ovarian follicles that are ripe and large; external examination of the female usually shows a bloated vulva with an open vagina

Subject: prolonged proestrus
Value: increase in the length of the proestrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: short proestrus
Value: decrease in the length of the proestrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: abnormal estrus
Value: any anomaly or aberrant timing of the phase of the estrous cycle which begins with the ovulation of fully mature oocytes and during which the vulva remains in an extended state with an open vagina, and females are maximally receptive to male advances

Subject: prolonged estrus
Value: increase in the length of the estrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: short estrus
Value: decrease in the length of the estrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: abnormal metestrus
Value: any anomaly or aberrant timing of the phase of the estrous cycle which follows estrus when mature eggs move through the oviducts and into the uterus; the vulva is no longer bloated, and the vagina is now closed

Subject: prolonged metestrus
Value: increase in the length of the metestrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: absent estrus
Value: absence or failure of the estrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: abnormal brain meninges morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in any of the membranes covering the brain, including the dura mater (external), arachnoid (middle), and pia mater (internal)

Subject: abnormal spinal cord meninges morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in any of the membranes covering the spinal cord, including the dura mater (external), arachnoid (middle), and pia mater (internal)

Subject: abnormal brain arachnoid mater morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the fibrous membrane forming the middle of the three coverings that surrounds the brain within the cranial cavity

Subject: abnormal brain dura mater morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the fibrous membrane forming the outer of the three coverings that surrounds the brain within the cranial cavity; consists of two layers including the periosteal layer and the meningeal layer

Subject: abnormal brain pia mater morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the fibrous membrane forming the innermost of the three coverings that surrounds the brain within the cranial cavity that is firmly attached to the glial capsule

Subject: abnormal subarachnoid space morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the space between the arachnoid and pia mater that is traversed by fibrous trabeculae and contains cerebrospinal fluid

Subject: abnormal chiasmatic cistern morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the region of the subarachnoid space that is located below and anterior to the optic chiasm

Subject: abnormal basal cistern morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the enclosed space where the arachnoid membrane stretches between the two temporal lobes and encloses the cerebral peduncles including the structures contained in the interpeduncular fossa

Subject: abnormal pontine cistern morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the space located on lateral aspects of the pons at the junction with the cerebellum

Subject: abnormal cerebellomedullary cistern morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the largest of the subarachnoid spaces between the cerebellum and the medulla oblongata

Subject: abnormal subarachnoid cistern morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the widening portions of the subarachnoid space within the cranium where the arachnoid bridges over a depression on the surface of the brain

Subject: abnormal posterior cerebellomedullary cistern
Value: any structural anomaly of the space between the cerebellum and the dorsal surface of the medulla

Subject: abnormal lateral cerebellomedullary cistern morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the space between the cerebellum and the lateral aspect of the medulla

Subject: abnormal quadrigeminal cistern morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the enclosed space extending forward between the corpus callosum and the thalamus that contains the internal cerebral veins

Subject: absent posterior cerebellomedullary cistern
Value: absence of the space between the cerebellum and the dorsal surface of the medulla

Subject: abnormal subarachnoid space development
Value: anomaly in the formation of the space between the arachnoid and pia mater that is traversed by fibrous trabeculae and contains cerebrospinal fluid

Subject: decreased inferior colliculus size
Value: decreased size of the paired inferior eminence of the mesencephalic tectum

Subject: absent inferior colliculus
Value: absence of the paired inferior eminence of the mesencephalic tectum

Subject: absent superior colliculus
Value: absence of the paired superior eminence of the mesencephalic tectum

Subject: absent colliculi
Value: absence of the inferior and superior colliculus

Subject: pilar cyst
Value: an epithelial cyst of the skin arising from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle

Subject: increased pancreas adenoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a benign epithelial neoplasm with a glandular organization arising in the pancreas, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased adrenal gland adenoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a benign epithelial neoplasm with a glandular organization arising in the adrenal gland, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: muscle tetany
Value: a condition of mineral imbalance in the body that results in severe muscle spasms occurring when the concentration of calcium ions (Ca++) in extracellular fluids such as plasma falls below normal

Subject: muscle twitch
Value: minor, sometimes imperceptible, local muscle contractions or uncontrollable movement of a single muscle group served by a single motor nerve fiber or filament sometime, but not always, indicating a neurological disorder

Subject: short metestrus
Value: decrease in the length of the metestrous phase of the estrous cycle in female animals

Subject: enlarged tectum
Value: increased size of the rostral part of the midbrain roof

Subject: abnormal hallux morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the first or primary digit of the foot

Subject: dilated proximal convoluted tubules
Value: stretched or widened aperture of the luminal space of the convoluted portion of the duct system of the nephron that extends from the renal glomerular capsule in the kidney cortex into the kidney medulla where it joins the loop of Henle

Subject: dilated distal convoluted tubules
Value: stretched or widened aperture of the luminal space of the convoluted portion of the duct system of the nephron between the ascending portion of the loop of Henle and the collecting duct system in the kidney cortex

Subject: anal stenosis
Value: abnormal narrowing or constriction of the anal orifice

Subject: abnormal anal canal morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the terminal portion of the alimentary canal, which begins at the anorectal junction, where the rectal ampulla abruptly narrows as the alimentary canal pierces the pelvic diaphragm (levator ani), and ends at the anal verge, when the anoderm that lines the lower anal canal changes to hairy perianal skin; surrounded by the internal and external anal sphincters

Subject: absent anal canal
Value: absence of the terminal portion of the alimentary canal

Subject: abnormal internal anal sphincter morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the smooth muscle ring, formed by an increase of the circular muscle fibers of the rectum, situated at the upper end of the anal canal, internal to the outer voluntary external anal sphincter

Subject: abnormal interleukin-21 secretion
Value: anomaly in the production or release of a pleiotropic cytokine that regulates immunoglobulin production, plasma cell and Th17 T cell differentiation, CD8+ T cell expansion, and inhibits antigen presentation by dendritic cells

Subject: increased interleukin-21 secretion
Value: increase in the production or release of a pleiotropic cytokine that regulates immunoglobulin production, plasma cell and Th17 T cell differentiation, CD8+ T cell expansion, and inhibits antigen presentation by dendritic cells

Subject: decreased interleukin-21 secretion
Value: reduction in the production or release of a pleiotropic cytokine that regulates immunoglobulin production, plasma cell and Th17 T cell differentiation, CD8+ T cell expansion, and inhibits antigen presentation by dendritic cells

Subject: abnormal circulating interleukin-21 level
Value: anomaly in the amount in the blood of a pleiotropic cytokine that regulates immunoglobulin production, plasma cell and Th17 T cell differentiation, CD8+ T cell expansion, and inhibits antigen presentation by dendritic cells

Subject: increased circulating interleukin-21 level
Value: increase in the amount in the blood of a pleiotropic cytokine that regulates immunoglobulin production, plasma cell and Th17 T cell differentiation, CD8+ T cell expansion, and inhibits antigen presentation by dendritic cells

Subject: decreased circulating interleukin-21 level
Value: reduction in the amount in the blood of a pleiotropic cytokine that regulates immunoglobulin production, plasma cell and Th17 T cell differentiation, CD8+ T cell expansion, and inhibits antigen presentation by dendritic cells

Subject: impaired lectin complement pathway
Value: abnormal function of the plasma protein cascade triggered by binding of lectin(s) to carbohydrate groups found on pathogen cell surfaces

Subject: abnormal oviduct size
Value: anomaly in the average size of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus

Subject: oviduct atrophy
Value: acquired diminution of the size of the oviduct associated with wasting as from death and reabsorption of cells, diminished cellular proliferation, decreased cellular volume, pressure, ischemia, malnutrition, reduced function or malfunction, or hormonal changes

Subject: abnormal oviduct weight
Value: anomaly in the average weight of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus

Subject: decreased oviduct weight
Value: reduction in the average weight of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus

Subject: increased oviduct weight
Value: greater average weight of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus

Subject: enlarged oviduct
Value: increased size of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus

Subject: dilated oviduct
Value: an expansion in the volume or area of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus, usually with an increase in contained fluid

Subject: small oviduct
Value: reduced size of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus

Subject: short oviduct
Value: length reduction or truncation of the tube through which the ova pass from the ovary to the uterus

Subject: absent cranial vagina
Value: absence of the upper third of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva, usually due to a developmental arrest or agenesis of the caudal Mullerian ducts

Subject: absent Wolffian ducts
Value: absence of the transient embryonic drainage tubes of the embryonic kidney (mesonephric tubules) that empty into the cloaca and later develop into the ductus deferens in the male

Subject: Wolffian duct degeneration
Value: a retrogressive impairment of function or destruction of the transient embryonic drainage tubes of the embryonic kidney (mesonephric tubules) that empty into the cloaca and later develop into the ductus deferens in the male

Subject: rudimentary Wolffian ducts
Value: not fully developed or remnants of the transient embryonic drainage tubes of the embryonic kidney (mesonephric tubules) that empty into the cloaca and later develop into the ductus deferens in the male

Subject: rudimentary Mullerian ducts
Value: not fully developed or remnants of the transient embryonic drainage tubes of the embryonic kidney (mesonephric tubules) that empty into the cloaca and in the female develop into the oviducts, uterus, and cranial vagina

Subject: abnormal cranial vagina morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the upper third of the female reproductive canal located between the uterus and the vulva, usually due to a developmental arrest or agenesis of the caudal Mullerian ducts

Subject: adrenal gland hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due to a increased number of cells, of the endocrine glands located above the kidney and responsible for hormone and epinephrine secretion

Subject: prolapsed intervertebral disk
Value: extrusion of the cartilaginous and gelatinous structure found between vertebrae

Subject: uterus inflammation
Value: local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes in the uterus

Subject: thin uterus
Value: reduced thickness or depth of the female muscular organ of gestation

Subject: uterus cysts
Value: presence of fluid-filled structures inside the lumen of the uterus; usually refers to benign growths

Subject: uterus hypertrophy
Value: increase in the bulk size of the female muscular organ of gestation due to cell enlargement

Subject: blind uterus
Value: presence of a female muscular organ of gestation that ends in a blind segment or sac and does not communicate with the cervix or vagina

Subject: abnormal uterine horn morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of either one of the pair of tubular extensions from the uterine body where the uterus and the uterine tubes meet; uterine horns are anterior Mullerian duct-derived structures

Subject: blind uterine horn
Value: presence of a blind-ended segment or pouch at the junction of the uterine horn and the uterine body; the blind horn is typically distended by fluid

Subject: dilated uterine horn
Value: an expansion in the volume or area of either one of the pair of tubular extensions from the uterine body where the uterus and the uterine tubes meet, usually with an increase in contained fluid

Subject: thin uterine horn
Value: reduced thickness of either one of the pair of tubular extensions from the uterine body where the uterus and the uterine tubes meet

Subject: short uterine horn
Value: length reduction or truncation of either one of the pair of tubular extensions from the uterine body where the uterus and the uterine tubes meet

Subject: myometrium hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, of the smooth muscle coat of the uterus, which forms the main mass of the organ and surrounds and supports the endometrium

Subject: endometrium hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, of the glandular mucous membrane lining of the uterine cavity that is hormonally responsive during the estrous/menstrual cycle and during pregnancy

Subject: endometrium hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due an increased number of cells, of the glandular mucous membrane lining of the uterine cavity that is hormonally responsive during the estrous/menstrual cycle and during pregnancy

Subject: oocyte degeneration
Value: a retrogressive impairment of function or destruction of the female germ cells

Subject: abnormal endometrial gland morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the numerous simple or branched tubular glands lined by ciliated columnar epithelium and found in the mucus membrane of the uterus which secrete mucus, lipids, glycogen, and protein; endometrial glands and their secretions (termed histotroph) are critical regulators of peri-implantation embryo survival and implantation as well as establishment of uterine receptivity

Subject: abnormal endometrial gland number
Value: abnormal number of the simple or branched tubular glands located in the mucous membrane of the uterus

Subject: decreased endometrial gland number
Value: fewer than normal numbers of the simple or branched tubular glands found in the mucus membrane of the uterus

Subject: absent endometrial glands
Value: absence of the simple or branched tubular uterine glands

Subject: anovaginal fistula
Value: an abnormal anatomical passage that connects the anal canal and the vagina

Subject: abnormal uterine NK cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of a natural killer cell subset that is found in the decidual of the uterus, is CD56-high, Galectin-1-positive and CD16-negative, and is the most abundant immune cell type in the decidual during the first trimester of pregnancy

Subject: abnormal clitoris size
Value: anomaly in the size of the small cylindrical erectile body located at the most anterior portion of the vulva

Subject: clitoris hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size of the clitoris, usually due to a reduced number of cells

Subject: abnormal glans penis morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the conic expansion of the corpus spongiosum that forms the head of the penis

Subject: abnormal penile bone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the unique bone located in the glans penis of most mammals except humans; it is used for copulation and varies in size and shape by species

Subject: small penile bone
Value: size reduction or truncation of the unique bone of variable size and shape located in the glans penis of most mammals except humans

Subject: penis prolapse
Value: inability to withdraw the penis into the prepuce (the fold of skin covering the glans penis), other than a paraphimosis; not to be confused with phimosis

Subject: abnormal pancreas size
Value: anomaly in the average size of the organ that secretes pancreatic juice into the duodenum and secretes glucagon and insulin into the bloodstream

Subject: abnormal pancreas weight
Value: anomaly in the average weight of the organ that secretes pancreatic juice into the duodenum and secretes glucagon and insulin into the bloodstream

Subject: increased pancreas weight
Value: increase in the average weight of the organ that secretes pancreatic juice into the duodenum and secretes glucagon and insulin into the bloodstream

Subject: decreased pancreas weight
Value: reduction in the average weight of the organ that secretes pancreatic juice into the duodenum and secretes glucagon and insulin into the bloodstream

Subject: pancreas hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size of the pancreas, usually due an increased number of cells

Subject: pancreas hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size of the pancreas, usually due to a reduced number of cells

Subject: abnormal pancreatic beta cell mass
Value: anomaly in the total physical bulk or volume of a pancreatic beta cell compared to the normal state

Subject: increased pancreatic beta cell mass
Value: greater total physical bulk or volume of a pancreatic beta cell compared to the normal state

Subject: decreased pancreatic beta cell mass
