Subject: abnormal thymus corticomedullary boundary morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the dense region demarcating the thymus medulla from the surrounding cortex that is characterized by numerous blood vessels (predominantly arterioles) with some perivascular connective tissue, mature and immature T lymphocytes, dendritic cells, variable numbers of perivascular B-lymphocytes and plasma cells; site of entry of bone marrow stem cells and exit of mature, functional T cells

Subject: abnormal thymus epithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the supporting framework of the thymus

Subject: abnormal dermis papillary layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the more superficial, thin layer of the dermis that interdigitates with the epidermis

Subject: absent gastric milk in neonates
Value: failure of nursing offspring to ingest milk as indicated by stomach content

Subject: elliptocytosis
Value: hematologic disorder in which an abnormally large number of erythrocytes are elliptical rather than the typical biconcave, disc shape

Subject: abnormal platelet aggregation
Value: any functional anomaly in the adhesion of one platelet to one or more other platelets via adhesion molecules

Subject: decreased platelet aggregation
Value: decrease in the ability of one platelet to one or more other platelets via adhesion molecules

Subject: increased urinary bladder carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a malignant neoplasm of the urinary bladder, arising from epithelial cells, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased urinary bladder transitional cell carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a malignant neoplasm of the transitional epithelial layer of the urinary bladder, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: urinary bladder obstruction
Value: any impediment or blockage of the musculomembranous elastic bag serving as a storage place for urine

Subject: fused lips
Value: an anomaly of the fleshy margins of the mouth resulting in the upper and lower lips being joined together into one structure

Subject: abnormal hair follicle melanin granule shape
Value: the form of pigment polymers in the hair follicle differs compared to controls

Subject: abnormal hair follicle melanin granule distribution
Value: anomaly in the spatial arrangement of particles produced by melanocytes that confer color in the hair follicle

Subject: abnormal platelet ADP level
Value: anomaly in the amount of the major energy source adenosine diphosphate produced by dense bodies located in platelets

Subject: decreased platelet ADP level
Value: reduced concentration of the major energy source adenosine diphosphate produced by dense bodies located in platelets

Subject: increased platelet ADP level
Value: increased concentration of the major energy source adenosine diphosphate produced by dense bodies located in platelets

Subject: thymus cortex hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due to an increased cell number, of the outer part of a thymus lobule that surrounds the medulla and is composed of closely packed lymphocytes

Subject: absent epidermis stratum granulosum
Value: absence of the layer of flattened cells containing basophilic granules of keratohyalin and lying just above the stratum spinosum (spiny layer) of the epidermis

Subject: superior cervical ganglion degeneration
Value: retrogressive pathological change or loss of the largest group of paravertebral ganglia of the sympathetic trunk which normally lies at the base of the skull and innervates the head and neck

Subject: abnormal odor adaptation
Value: altered ability or failure of the olfactory receptor neurons to adapt to ambient conditions by time-dependent modification in the sensitivity to a given odorant stimulus, as seen in the decline of the sensory response during prolonged odor stimulation; a major mechanism for the rapid calcium-calmodulin-mediated desensitization of the CNG channel

Subject: dyskeratosis
Value: premature keratinization in individual epithelial cells that have not reached the keratinizing surface layer; dyskeratotic cells generally become rounded and they may break away from adjacent cells and fall off

Subject: abnormal meiotic configurations
Value: uncharacteristic chromosome arrangement produced by anomalous chromosome pairing and chiasma formation from prophase to metaphase of meiosis I due to abnormal chromosome structure and necessary to produce functional gametes

Subject: multivalent meiotic configurations
Value: any association of more than two completely or partially homologous chromosomes whose homologous regions are held together by pairing and chiasma formation from prophase to metaphase of meiosis I

Subject: meiotic nondisjunction
Value: failure of homologous chromosomes to separate to the cell poles at anaphase

Subject: mitotic nondisjunction
Value: failure of sister-chromatids to separate to the cell poles at anaphase

Subject: abnormal red blood cell deformability
Value: a measure (DImax) related to cell surface area, of the changeability of the membrane of circulating oxygen transporting cells as a function of physiologically relevant osmolality at a constant applied shear stress

Subject: abnormal left lung morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the organ of respiration located on the left side of the body

Subject: abnormal right lung morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the part of the organ of respiration located on the right side of the body and consists of the caudal, cranial, middle and accessory lobes

Subject: abnormal right lung accessory lobe morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the right lung lobe which lies against the diaphragm and has a considerable volume residing in the left hemi-thorax

Subject: abnormal pubic symphysis morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the firm fibrocartilaginous joint in the median plane between the two opposing surfaces of the pubic bones, which are united by an interpubic disc of fibrocartilage as well as the superior and arcuate pubic ligaments

Subject: oral atresia
Value: congenital blockage, fusion, or absence of the normal opening of the oral cavity

Subject: abnormal developmental vascular remodeling
Value: any anomaly in the process by which existing vessels are reorganized during development

Subject: otocephaly
Value: a structural anomaly of the head consisting of absence or malformation of the lower jaw and the ears united or closely approaching below the face

Subject: acephaly
Value: congenital absence of the head

Subject: increased keratinocyte apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of keratinocytes undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: decreased keratinocyte apoptosis
Value: reduction in the number of keratinocytes undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal keratinocyte proliferation
Value: anomaly in the ability of keratinocytes to undergo expansion by cell division

Subject: increased keratinocyte proliferation
Value: increase in the expansion rate of keratinocytes by cell division

Subject: decreased keratinocyte proliferation
Value: reduction in the expansion rate of keratinocytes by cell division

Subject: increased platelet aggregation
Value: increase in the ability of one platelet to one or more other platelets via adhesion molecules

Subject: abnormal plasma membrane sphingolipid content
Value: altered amounts of the phospholipids found especially in, but not limited to, the cell membrane of nerve tissue that yield sphingosine, choline, a fatty acid, and phosphoric acid upon hydrolysis

Subject: increased plasma membrane sphingolipid content
Value: abnormal accumulation of the phospolipids found especially in, but not limited to, the cell membrane of nerve tissue that yield sphingosine, choline, a fatty acid, and phosphoric acid upon hydrolysis

Subject: sphingomyelinosis
Value: the abnormal accumulation of sphingomyelin in the plasma membrane of cells of the nervous tissue, liver and spleen, usually due to sphingomyelinase deficiency

Subject: increased gonad tumor incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of an abnormal rapidly proliferating cells in the testis or ovary, usually in the form of a distinct mass, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased liver adenocarcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a malignant neoplasm of epithelial cells in the liver, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: increased Leydig cell tumor incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of rare testicular tumors of the male gonadal interstitium, occurring in a specific population in a given time period; Leydig cell tumors are frequently hormonally active, leading to feminizing or virilizing syndromes; Leydig cell tumors comprise 1-3% of all testicular neoplasms, can be pure or mixed with other sex cord-stromal or germ cell tumors, and are usually benign, although malignant variants also occur

Subject: absent chorion
Value: absence of the outermost extraembryonic membrane

Subject: abnormal corneocyte envelope morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the electron-dense layer of highly transglutaminase cross-linked protein that is deposited on the inner surface of the plasma membrane of corneocytes in the outermost layers of the epidermis; a monomolecular layer of ceramides is covalently attached to the outer surface of the CE to form a hydrophobic lipid envelope that covers each corneocyte and provides continuity with the lipid matrix

Subject: enlarged corneocyte envelope
Value: increased size of the electron-dense layer of highly transglutaminase cross-linked protein that is deposited on the inner surface of the plasma membrane of corneocytes in the outermost layers of the epidermis

Subject: abnormal stratum corneum lipid matrix formation
Value: altered lipid composition or intercellular lipid matrix assembly in the stratum corneum, usually resulting in loss of epidermal barrier function; normally, the intercorneocyte lipid matrix consists of a complex lipid mixture of ceramides, cholesterol and long-chain saturated fatty acids that self-assembles into an ordered multilayer structure known as lipid lamellae

Subject: impaired stratum corneum desquamation
Value: dysregulated shedding of the outermost layer of corneocytes, affecting the integrity and thickness of the stratum corneum; may result in xerotic and ichthyotic conditions

Subject: thin epidermis stratum granulosum
Value: decreased thickness of the layer of flattened cells containing basophilic granules of keratohyalin and lying just above the stratum spinosum (spiny layer) of the epidermis

Subject: thick epidermis stratum granulosum
Value: increased thickness of the layer of flattened cells containing basophilic granules of keratohyalin and lying just above the stratum spinosum (spiny layer) of the epidermis

Subject: hypergranulosis
Value: increased thickness of the granular layer of the epidermis

Subject: epidermis stratum granulosum hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due an increased number of cells, of the layer of flattened cells containing basophilic granules of keratohyalin and lying just above the stratum spinosum (spiny layer) of the epidermis

Subject: abnormal keratohyalin granule morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the irregularly shaped basophilic granules in the cells of the stratum granulosum of the epidermis that may play a role in keratinization and barrier function

Subject: absent keratohyalin granules
Value: absence of the irregularly shaped basophilic granules in the cells of the stratum granulosum of the epidermis that may play a role in keratinization and barrier function

Subject: increased keratohyalin granule number
Value: increased number of the irregularly shaped basophilic granules in the cells of the stratum granulosum of the epidermis that may play a role in keratinization and barrier function

Subject: decreased keratohyalin granule number
Value: reduced number of the irregularly shaped basophilic granules in the cells of the stratum granulosum of the epidermis that may play a role in keratinization and barrier function

Subject: increased keratohyalin granule size
Value: increased size of the irregularly shaped basophilic granules in the cells of the stratum granulosum of the epidermis that may play a role in keratinization and barrier function

Subject: decreased keratohyalin granule size
Value: reduced size of the irregularly shaped basophilic granules in the cells of the stratum granulosum of the epidermis that may play a role in keratinization and barrier function

Subject: abnormal epidermal lamellar body morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a membrane-bounded organelle present in the epidermis, specialized for the storage and secretion of various substances (such as glycoproteins and acid phosphates), and which are arranged in the form of tightly packed, concentric, membrane sheets or lamellae

Subject: absent basioccipital bone
Value: absence of the basilar process of the occipital bone in the base of the cranium, frequently forming a direct part of the occipital in the adult, but usually distinct in the young

Subject: abnormal epidermis stratum lucidum morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the layer of lightly staining corneocytes foud between the stratum granulosum and stratum corneum layers; found primarily in the thick epidermis of the palmar and plantar skin and is composed of three to five layers of dead, flattened keratinocytes

Subject: epidermis stratum spinosum hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due an increased number of cells, of the layer of polyhedral cells in the epidermis; shrinkage and adhesion of these cells gives a spiny or prickly appearance

Subject: thick epidermis suprabasal layer
Value: increased thickness of the suprabasal layer of the epidermis

Subject: thin epidermis suprabasal layer
Value: decreased thickness of the suprabasal layer of the epidermis

Subject: absent epidermis stratum spinosum
Value: absence of the layer of polyhedral cells in the epidermis; shrinkage and adhesion of these cells gives a spiny or prickly appearance

Subject: abnormal zinc homeostasis
Value: anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium of zinc that normally is a cofactor in many proteins

Subject: abnormal brain zinc level
Value: any anomaly in the amount of zinc present in mammalian brain tissue, where 5-15 percent of total zinc is concentrated in synaptic vesicles in a subset of glutamatergic neurons; histochemically reactive zinc is present in many regions of the central nervous system and is especially abundant in the hippocampus

Subject: decreased brain zinc level
Value: reduction in the amount of zinc present in the brain tissue

Subject: increased brain zinc level
Value: increase in the amount of zinc present in the brain tissue

Subject: abnormal optokinetic reflex
Value: any anomaly in the nystagmus or deviation of the eyes in response to stimulation of the visual system by movement; normally, this reflex functions to stabilize a moving image on the retina

Subject: abnormal primary vitreous morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the fibrovascular mesodermal tissue located between the optic cup and lens vesicle that normally regresses during the development of the vitreous body

Subject: primary vitreous hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size of the primary vitreous, usually due an increased number of cells

Subject: absent inguinal lymph nodes
Value: absence of the lymph nodes normally located in the groin area

Subject: enlarged inguinal lymph nodes
Value: increased size of the lymph nodes located in the groin area

Subject: small inguinal lymph nodes
Value: reduced size of the lymph nodes located in the groin area

Subject: abnormal abdominal lymph node morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the visceral glands that are located in the abdomen

Subject: abnormal celiac lymph node morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the visceral glands that are associated with the branches of the celiac artery, including the gastric, hepatic, and pancreaticolienal (splenic) lymph nodes

Subject: absent brachial lymph nodes
Value: absence of the lymph nodes located along the brachial vein that receive drainage from most of the free upper limb and send efferent vessels to the central axillary lymph nodes

Subject: small brachial lymph nodes
Value: reduced size of the lymph nodes located along the brachial vein that receive drainage from most of the free upper limb and send efferent vessels to the central axillary lymph nodes

Subject: absent axillary lymph nodes
Value: absence of the lymph nodes located around the axillary vein that receive lymphatic drainage from the upper or forelimb, scapular region and pectoral region

Subject: enlarged axillary lymph nodes
Value: increased size of the lymph nodes located around the axillary vein that receive lymphatic drainage from the upper or forelimb, scapular region and pectoral region

Subject: small axillary lymph nodes
Value: reduced size of the lymph nodes located around the axillary vein that receive lymphatic drainage from the upper or forelimb, scapular region and pectoral region

Subject: absent cervical lymph nodes
Value: absence of the lymph nodes normally found near the neck and shoulders

Subject: absent popliteal lymph nodes
Value: absence of the lymph nodes which drain the legs

Subject: enlarged popliteal lymph nodes
Value: increased size of the lymph nodes which drain the legs

Subject: small popliteal lymph nodes
Value: reduced size of the lymph nodes which drain the legs

Subject: abnormal pretectal region morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a narrow, transversely oriented rostral zone of the mesencephalic tectum, bounded caudally by the superior colliculus, rostrally by the habenular trigone, and laterally by the pulvinar thalami; the pretectal area contains several nuclei that receive fibers from the optic tract; it has bilateral efferent connections with the Edinger-Westphal nucleus of the oculomotor nuclear complex by way of which it mediates the pupillary light reflex

Subject: abnormal pretectal nuclei morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the groups of neurons located between the thalamus and midbrain that receive binocular sensory input from retinal ganglion cells of the eyes and are responsible for maintaining the pupillary light reflex

Subject: abnormal olivary pretectal nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of one of several pretectal nuclei with direct input from the eye and the only one containing neurons whose rate of firing is linearly related to the intensity of light falling on the retina

Subject: abnormal renal tubule epithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the cellular avascular layer of the renal tubule luminar surfaces

Subject: kidney degeneration
Value: a retrogressive impairment of function or destruction of either or both of the two excretory organs that filter wastes (especially urea) from the blood and excrete them and water in urine

Subject: abnormal blood homeostasis
Value: anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium of various functions or chemical or protein composition of the blood

Subject: abnormal urine homeostasis
Value: anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium of the various chemical or protein components of the urine

Subject: uremia
Value: an excess of urea, creatinine, and other nitrogenous end products of protein and amino acid metabolism in the blood; usually indicative of kidney dysfunction

Subject: crystalluria
Value: excretion of crystalline material in the urine

Subject: urinary bladder inflammation
Value: local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes in the urinary bladder

Subject: decreased fertilization frequency
Value: the number of secondary oocytes each penetrated by a spermatozoon followed by fusion of the male and female pronuclei are fewer than expected

Subject: abnormal superovulation
Value: altered ability of a female to be induced to ovulate an expected number of ova after treatment with specific gonadotrophic hormones

Subject: delayed embryo implantation
Value: any lag in the normal time course necessary for the attachment of the blastocyst to the endometrium

Subject: dormant blastocysts
Value: blastocysts sometimes larger than normal in size, showing no development or mitotic activity as a result of delayed implantation

Subject: abnormal eyelid development
Value: aberrant formation of the skin folds covering the front of the eyeball

Subject: abnormal palatal rugae morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the series of transverse folds (ridges) of the mucosa located on the anterior third part of the secondary (hard) palate of most mammalian species; rugae are present on each side of the median palatal raphe and behind the incisive papillae, but their number and arrangement are species specific; together with the teeth and the tongue, rugae take part in mastication by helping to sense, hold and mash the food; rugae harbor various types of intraepithelial sensory structures (such as Merckel cells, corpuscular endings and free nerve endings), and play a sensory role when the food is pressed by the tongue against the hard palate

Subject: abnormal palate development
Value: abnormal formation of the roof of the mouth in vertebrates formed anteriorly by a bony projection of the upper jaw (hard palate) and posteriorly by the fold of connective tissue (soft palate)

Subject: abnormal primary palate development
Value: any anomaly in the formation of the part of the shelf separating the oral and nasal cavities that is formed during early embryonic development from the medial nasal processes which derive from the frontonasal process; these merge with each other and with the bilateral maxillary processes to form the upper lip and the primary palate

Subject: abnormal secondary palate development
Value: any anomaly in the formation of the part of the palate that is formed during embryonic development when palatal projections from the inner part of the maxillary processes emerge, extend and elevate into a horizontal position above the tongue

Subject: delayed chorioallantoic fusion
Value: late onset of the initiation and/or completion of the formation of a highly vascularized extra-embryonic fetal membrane by fusion of the chorion and allantois

Subject: failure of chorioallantoic fusion
Value: failure to initiate and/or complete the formation of a highly vascularized extra-embryonic fetal membrane by fusion of the chorion and allantois

Subject: increased placenta apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of cells of the placenta undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: striated fur
Value: hair or fur characterized by transverse, usually parallel, markings due to an anomaly in hair color, texture, or growth

Subject: abnormal induced retinal neovascularization
Value: any anomaly in the response to conditions which induce the pathological growth of vessels into the retina

Subject: abnormal pregnancy
Value: any anomaly in the process of maintaining a developing embryo or fetus within the female body from conception to birth

Subject: abnormal uterine receptivity
Value: any alteration in the time sensitive process of uterine differentiation that occurs in response to implantation competent blastocysts and precedes and is necessary for embryo implantation

Subject: abnormal uterine-embryonic axis
Value: any anomaly in the process whereby the implantation chamber orients in the uterus in response to decidual growth to insure correct alignment of the embryo to the uterus

Subject: abnormal luminal closure
Value: an anomaly in the degree to which (for each species) the uterine epithelium closes over and makes contact with, and secures an implanting blastocyst

Subject: abnormal embryo apposition
Value: any anomaly that prevents the initial positioning of the blastocyst trophoblast and uterine luminal epithelium causing the blastocyst to fail to orientate correctly along the uterine wall

Subject: abnormal embryo attachment
Value: any anomaly in the process whereby the blastocyst anchors to the uterine luminal epithelium and cannot be dislodged by flushing

Subject: abnormal embryo invasion
Value: any anomaly in the process that enables the embryo to establish connection to the uterine luminal epithelium

Subject: ectopic pregnancy
Value: a fertilized egg attaches and begins development in a location other than in the inner lining of the uterus, most commonly in the Fallopian tube

Subject: abnormal postimplantation uterine environment
Value: failure of the uterus to undergo the changes necessary to support pregnancy following implantation of the embryo

Subject: abnormal uterine angiogenesis
Value: any anomaly in vascular permeability and blood vessel development that normally occurs in the uterus to support embryonic growth during pregnancy

Subject: abnormal uterus physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the female muscular organ of gestation in which the developing embryo or fetus is nourished until birth

Subject: abnormal birth weight
Value: anomaly in average weight at birth compared to controls

Subject: increased birth weight
Value: increase in average weight at birth compared to controls

Subject: decreased birth weight
Value: reduction in average weight at birth compared to controls

Subject: orthokeratosis
Value: thickening of the stratum corneum of the epidermis (hyperkeratosis) with non-nucleated keratinocytes retained in this layer

Subject: abnormal hemostasis
Value: any anomaly in the spontaneous arrest of bleeding from vessels carrying blood under pressure or the arrest of circulation to an organ or part

Subject: abnormal spinal cord dorsal column morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the wedge-shaped fiber bundle of white matter in the dorsomedial side of the spinal cord that is made up of the fasciculus gracilis and fasciculus cuneatus; it is part of the ascending posterior column-medial lemniscus pathway that is important for well-localized fine touch and conscious proprioception

Subject: abnormal spinal cord lateral column morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the region of white matter of the spinal cord that is located between the dorsal and ventral spinal roots

Subject: abnormal spinal cord ventral column morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the area of white matter of the spinal cord located on either side of the ventral (anterior) medial fissure

Subject: abnormal medulla oblongata anterior median fissure morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the longitudinal groove in the midline of the anterior aspect of the medulla oblongata

Subject: abnormal pyramidal decussation morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the bundles of pyramidal fibers that intercross obliquely over the midline at the lower border region of the medulla oblongata

Subject: abnormal anterior corticospinal tract morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the small bundle of corticospinal motor fibers that do not cross the midline at the pyramidal decussation and descend into the anterior funiculus of the spinal cord; the anterior corticospinal tract controls central axial and girdle muscles

Subject: abnormal lateral corticospinal tract morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the large bundle of corticospinal motor fibers that cross the midline at the pyramidal decussation and descend in the dorsal half of the lateral funiculus; the lateral corticospinal tract controls movement of contralateral limbs

Subject: abnormal spinal cord lateral motor column morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the subclasses of motor neurons which innervate muscles in the limb; motor neurons in the lateral motor column are further organized into pools, each of which innervates a specific muscle in the limb

Subject: abnormal spinal cord motor column morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the subclasses of motor neurons which are organized into longitudinally oriented columns that occupy distinct and, in some cases, discontinuous domains along the rostrocaudal axis of the spinal cord; motor neurons within a single column send their axons to a common peripheral target

Subject: abnormal spinal cord medial motor column morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the subclasses of motor neurons which project their axons to axial muscles that lie close to the vertebral column; motor neurons in the lateral subdivision of the MMC project their axons to body wall muscles

Subject: empty decidua capsularis
Value: the implanted embryo normally covered opposite the placenta by uterine mucosa and epithelium following implantation is missing, suggesting the embryo died early during implantation but after the decidual response and modification of uterine stromal cells

Subject: abnormal spinal cord central canal morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the ependyma-lined lumen of the spinal cord that is filled with cerebrospinal fluid; it is patent with the ventricular system of the brain and frequently becomes occluded in aging adults

Subject: abnormal neural tube ventricular layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the layer of undifferentiated, proliferating cells that line the neural tube lumen

Subject: abnormal neural tube mantle layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the layer of glia and differentiating neurons that will form the gray matter of the spinal cord; this lies between the ventricular and marginal layers and includes the basal and alar plates

Subject: abnormal neural tube marginal layer morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the outermost layer of the neural tube that contains nerve fibers and will form the white matter

Subject: abnormal spinal cord alar plate morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the region of the mantle layer of the neural tube that lies dorsal to the sulcus limitans and contains primarily sensory neurons and interneurons involved in communication of sensory impulses; the alar plate develops into the dorsal horn in the grey matter of the spinal cord

Subject: abnormal spinal cord basal plate morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the region of the mantle layer of the neural tube that lies ventral to the sulcus limitans and contains primarily motor neurons and interneurons

Subject: abnormal spinal cord commissure morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of any of the nerve fiber tracts that span the midline of the spinal cord

Subject: abnormal spinal cord ventral commissure morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the band of nerve fibers which cross the midline of the spinal cord ventral to the central canal and posterior grey commissure

Subject: abnormal spinal cord grey commissure morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the band of grey substance spanning the midline of the spinal cord that surrounds the central canal

Subject: abnormal copulation
Value: an anomaly in sexual union that normally enables the transfer of ejaculate (sperm) from male to female, sometimes resulting in the fertilization of an egg

Subject: heart hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into the heart

Subject: hyperchylomicronemia
Value: increased plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins

Subject: abnormal birth body size
Value: anomaly in average body size at birth compared to controls

Subject: increased birth body size
Value: increase in average body size at birth compared to controls

Subject: decreased birth body size
Value: reduction in average body size at birth compared to controls

Subject: increased skin squamous cell carcinoma incidence
Value: greater than the expected number of a skin carcinoma derived from stratified squamous epithelium, occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: abnormal midgut morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the portion of the embryonic gut between the foregut and the hindgut, which originally is open to the yolk sac

Subject: absent midgut
Value: absence of the portion of the embryonic gut between the foregut and the hindgut

Subject: absent external auditory canal
Value: absence of the canal that connects the outer and middle ear

Subject: vaginal septum
Value: a longitudinal or transverse congenital partition within the muscular canal extending from outside of the body to the cervix; usually caused by incomplete fusion of the Mullerian ducts in embryogenesis

Subject: hydrometra
Value: an accumulation in the uterine lumen of normal secretions that ordinarily drain from the body but are retained when the cervix or vagina is significantly or completely closed

Subject: anhedonia
Value: inability to experience pleasure in response to normally pleasurable stimuli

Subject: abnormal conditioned place preference behavior
Value: anomaly in the ability of an animal to learn and remember an association between a putative rewarding internal state produced by a xenobiotic or drug with a neutral, unchanging environment

Subject: impaired conditioned place preference behavior
Value: decrease in the ability of an animal to learn and remember an association between a putative rewarding internal state produced by a xenobiotic or drug with a neutral, unchanging environment

Subject: enhanced conditioned place preference behavior
Value: increase in the ability of an animal to learn and remember an association between a putative rewarding internal state produced by a xenobiotic or drug with a neutral, unchanging environment

Subject: thin epidermis stratum basale
Value: reduced thickness of the deepest layer of the epidermis, which is composed of dividing stem cells and anchoring cells

Subject: thick epidermis stratum basale
Value: increased thickness of the deepest layer of the epidermis, which is composed of dividing stem cells and anchoring cells

Subject: abnormal subcommissural organ morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the circumventricular organ derived from ependymal cells that is located at the junction of the third ventricle and the cerebral aqueduct and which secretes somatostatin

Subject: absent subcommissural organ
Value: absence of the circumventricular organ derived from ependymal cells that is located at the junction of the third ventricle and the cerebral aqueduct and which secretes somatostatin

Subject: absent Purkinje cell layer
Value: there is no evidence of the cell layer that lies just underneath the molecular layer of the cerebellar cortex, normally containing the neuronal cell bodies of the Purkinje cells arranged side by side in a single layer, and candelabrum interneurons vertically oriented between the Purkinje cells

Subject: reduced cerebellar foliation
Value: the cerebellar lobules are reduced in size or number

Subject: abnormal mammary gland pattern
Value: aberration in the spacing and arrangement of mammary glands that differentiate during early embryogenesis as it relates to the norm for the species

Subject: increased mammary gland number
Value: greater than the expected number of the specialized accessory gland of the skin of mammals that secretes milk

Subject: abnormal nipple development
Value: an anomaly in the differentiation of the apex of the mammary gland on the integument surface into which the lactiferous ducts open

Subject: increased nipple number
Value: greater than the expected number of structures located on the apex of the mammary gland on the integument surface into which the lactiferous ducts open; normal female mice have five pairs of mammary glands and nipples (males have no nipples); two pairs of nipples are situated in the abdomino-inguinal region (inguinal group) and three pairs in the ventral thoracic region (pectoral or thoracic group)

Subject: ectopic nipples
Value: abnormal location of structures normally located on the apex of the mammary gland on the integument surface into which the lactiferous ducts open

Subject: absent lens vesicle
Value: absence of the ectodermal invagination that forms opposite the optic cup in the primordium of the lens of the eye

Subject: abnormal primordial meninx morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the outermost mesenchymal covering of the developing brain and spinal cord that is composed of tough fibrous connective tissue from which the arachnoid mater, pia mater and dura mater are formed

Subject: abnormal navicular morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the oval-shaped tarsal bone found between the talus and the 3 cuneiform bones

Subject: abnormal calcaneum morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the largest quadrangular bone at the back of the tarsus; it forms the heel or hock and articulates with the talus above it

Subject: absent tarsus bones
Value: <absence of the eight bones of the instep of the paw/foot: tibiale, talus, calcaneus, navicular, 3 cuneiform, and cuboid bones>

Subject: abnormal offspring retrieval
Value: any anomaly in the ability of a female to collect stray offspring and return them to a defined location, such as a nest or den

Subject: ventricular premature beat
Value: a heartbeat is initiated by abnormal electrical activation originating in the heart ventricles rather than by the sinoatrial node, the normal heartbeat initiator, before a normal heartbeat would occur

Subject: absent nipple
Value: absence of the erectile projection at the apex of the mammary gland where the lactiferous ducts open

Subject: abnormal prostate gland duct morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the minute canals that pass the prostatic secretions to the urethra

Subject: abnormal prostate gland development
Value: anomaly in the formation or pattering of the of the prostate gland

Subject: abnormal prostate gland branching morphogenesis
Value: anomaly of the prostatic bud to repeatedly divide into lobules during development of the prostate gland

Subject: prostate gland cysts
Value: benign epithelial growths, often fluid-filled, within the gland in males that secretes part of the seminiferous fluid

Subject: enlarged prostate gland anterior lobe
Value: increased size of the rodent prostate lobe that appears as a thin tubular structure, attached to the lesser curvature of the paired seminal vesicles

Subject: enlarged prostate gland dorsolateral lobe
Value: increased size of the rodent prostate lobe that lies in the triangular area between urethra and seminal vesicle

Subject: small prostate gland dorsolateral lobe
Value: reduced size of the rodent prostate lobe that lies in the triangular area between urethra and seminal vesicle

Subject: ectopic mammary gland
Value: one or more of the expected number of mammary glands that differentiate during early embryogenesis is/ are not located according to the normal arrangement

Subject: increased corneal stroma thickness
Value: increased width of the lamellated connective tissue layer of the cornea

Subject: preaxial polydactyly
Value: duplication of all or part of the first ray on one or more of the autopods

Subject: postaxial polydactyly
Value: duplication of all or part of any of the rays except the first ray on one or more of the autopods

Subject: abnormal behavioral response to xenobiotic
Value: any anomaly in the behavioral response induced by a compound foreign to living organisms, such as consumption preference, induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior

Subject: enhanced behavioral response to xenobiotic
Value: increased sensitivity to a foreign compound capable of inducing the appearance of behavioral response, such as consumption preference, induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or reduced dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: impaired behavioral response to xenobiotic
Value: decreased sensitivity to a foreign compound capable of inducing the appearance of behavioral response, such as consumption preference, induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or increased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: abnormal behavioral response to addictive substance
Value: any anomaly in the behavioral response induced by an addictive substance, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior

Subject: enhanced behavioral response to addictive substance
Value: increased sensitivity to an addictive substance capable of inducing the appearance of behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or decreased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: impaired behavioral response to addictive substance
Value: decreased sensitivity to an addictive substance capable of inducing the appearance of behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or increased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: enhanced behavioral response to alcohol
Value: increased sensitivity to alcohol resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or decreased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: enhanced behavioral response to nicotine
Value: increased sensitivity to nicotine resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or decreased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: enhanced behavioral response to morphine
Value: increased sensitivity to morphine resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or decreased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: enhanced behavioral response to cocaine
Value: increased sensitivity to cocaine resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or decreased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: impaired behavioral response to alcohol
Value: decreased sensitivity to alcohol resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or increased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: impaired behavioral response to nicotine
Value: decreased sensitivity to nicotine resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or increased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: impaired behavioral response to morphine
Value: decreased sensitivity to morphine resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or increased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: impaired behavioral response to cocaine
Value: decreased sensitivity to cocaine resulting in a behavioral response, such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior, or increased dosage threshold for the appearance of the behavioral response

Subject: abnormal hair follicle bulge morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the area located in the bottom of the permanent portion of a resting (telogen) hair follicle where the cells of the external root sheath of the hair follicle are contiguous with the basal layer of the epidermis; this portion of the follicle is involved in the generation of a new hair at the onset of the hair growth cycle (anagen) and contains the hair follicle stem cells

Subject: abnormal mitotic spindle morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the formation of the ellipsoidal (bipolar) collection of fibers visible during nuclear division and cytokinesis responsible for accurate segregation of chromosomes during mitosis

Subject: abnormal meiotic spindle morphology
Value: an anomaly in the formation of the ellipsoidal (bipolar) collection of fibers visible during nuclear division and cytokinesis responsible for accurate segregation of chromosomes during meiosis

Subject: abnormal mitotic spindle assembly checkpoint
Value: an anomaly in the process that normally prevents inaccurate segregation of chromosome by inhibiting cell-cycle progression in response to a signal generated by mitotic spindle damage or by chromosomes that have not attached to microtubules

Subject: increased sensitivity to induced morbidity/mortality
Value: decrease in the amount of an external agent required to cause death or diseased state

Subject: decreased sensitivity to induced morbidity/mortality
Value: increase in the amount of an external agent required to cause death or diseased state

Subject: abnormal xenobiotic induced morbidity/mortality
Value: any anomaly in induction of a diseased state or death caused by a compound foreign to living organisms

Subject: increased sensitivity to xenobiotic induced morbidity/mortality
Value: decrease in the amount of a compound foreign to living organisms required to cause death or diseased state

Subject: decreased sensitivity to xenobiotic induced morbidity/mortality
Value: increase in the amount of a compound foreign to living organisms required to cause death or diseased state

Subject: impaired somite development
Value: atypical process of somite formation with the result of fewer or none of these cell masses being formed

Subject: abnormal meiotic spindle assembly checkpoint
Value: an anomaly in the process that normally prevents inaccurate segregation of chromosomes by inhibiting cell-cycle progression in response to a signal generated by meiotic spindle damage or by chromosomes that have not attached to microtubules

Subject: abnormal optic chiasm morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the flattened quadrangular body that is the point of crossing of the fibers of the optic nerves

Subject: absent optic chiasm
Value: absence of the flattened quadrangular body that is the point of crossing of the fibers of the optic nerves

Subject: abnormal retinal development
Value: anomaly in any of the steps during embryogenesis that produce the nerve layer lining in the back of the eye which senses light, and creates impulses that travel through the optic nerve to the brain

Subject: absent retina
Value: absence of the nerve layer lining the back of the eye that senses light, and creates impulses that travel through the optic nerve to the brain

Subject: abnormal behavioral withdrawal response
Value: anomaly in the intensity, duration, or type of behaviors displayed after discontinuation of an addictive substance

Subject: increased behavioral withdrawal response
Value: increase in the intensity or duration of behaviors displayed after discontinuation of an addictive substance

Subject: decreased behavioral withdrawal response
Value: decrease in the intensity or duration of behaviors displayed after discontinuation of an addictive substance

Subject: abnormal behavioral response to anesthetic
Value: anomaly in the behavioral changes that follow exposure to an anesthetizing agent

Subject: impaired behavioral response to anesthetic
Value: decrease or delay in the behavioral changes that follow exposure to a given amount of an anesthetizing agent

Subject: enhanced behavioral response to anesthetic
Value: increase or exceleration in the behavioral changes that follow exposure to a given amount of an anesthetizing agent

Subject: abnormal chondrocyte physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of a polymorphic cell that forms cartilage

Subject: abnormal preimplantation embryo development
Value: an anomaly in the developmental progress of an embryo from 2 cell to blastocyst affecting the viability or number of embryos

Subject: abnormal basicranium angle
Value: a deviation from the expected angle formed by a line representing the floor of the anterior cranial fossa intersecting a line representing the axis of the clivus of the base of the skull

Subject: abnormal melanoblast morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a cell that originates from the neural crest and differentiates into a pigment cell

Subject: abnormal melanoblast migration
Value: any anomaly in the movement of the cells that originate from the neural crest and differentiate into pigment cells

Subject: altered susceptibility to infection induced morbidity/mortality
Value: differences from the expected moribund state caused by a pathogenic invasion or from components of or toxins produced by pathogens

Subject: decreased susceptibility to infection induced morbidity/mortality
Value: reduced likelihood that an organism will display the expected moribund state caused by a pathogenic invasion or from components of or toxins produced by pathogens

Subject: increased susceptibility to infection induced morbidity/mortality
Value: increased likelihood that an organism will display the expected moribund state caused by a pathogenic invasion or from components of or toxins produced by pathogens

Subject: increased susceptibility to bacterial infection induced morbidity/mortality
Value: increased likelihood that an organism will display the expected moribund state caused by a bacterial invasion or from components of or toxins produced by bacteria

Subject: decreased susceptibility to bacterial infection induced morbidity/mortality
Value: reduced likelihood that an organism will display the expected moribund state caused by a bacterial invasion or from components of or toxins produced by bacteria

Subject: decreased susceptibility to viral infection induced morbidity/mortality
Value: reduced likelihood that an organism will display the expected moribund state caused by a viral invasion or from components of or toxins produced by a virus

Subject: increased susceptibility to viral infection induced morbidity/mortality
Value: increased likelihood that an organism will display the expected moribund state caused by a viral invasion or from components of or toxins produced by a virus

Subject: seborrheic dermatitis
Value: an inflammatory skin condition that causes flaky, white to yellowish scales to form on oily areas such as the scalp or inside the ear, with or without reddened skin

Subject: sebaceous gland hypertrophy
Value: increase in the bulk size of the sebum secreting glands of the hair shaft due to cell enlargement

Subject: sebaceous gland hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment and increased size of the sebum secreting glands of the hair shaft, usually due to an increase in the number of cells

Subject: epidermal spongiosis
Value: intercellular edema within the epidermis

Subject: abnormal base-excision repair
Value: any anomaly in the process whereby an altered base is removed by a DNA glycosylase enzyme, followed by excision of the resulting sugar phosphate; the small gap left in the DNA helix is filled in by the sequential action of DNA polymerase and DNA ligase

Subject: abnormal mismatch repair
Value: any functional anomaly in the system that promotes genomic fidelity by repairing base-base mismatches, insertion-deletion loops and heterologies generated during DNA replication and recombination

Subject: abnormal ophthalmic nerve morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the sensory nerve subdivision of the trigeminal nerve that transmits sensory information from the orbit and its contents, the nasal cavity and the skin of the nose and forehead

Subject: abnormal maxillary nerve morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the sensory nerve subdivision of the trigeminal nerve that transmits sensory information from the palate, upper teeth and gingiva, the skin between the palpebral fissure and the mouth, and from the nasal cavity and maxillary sinuses

Subject: abnormal mandibular nerve morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the motor and sensory nerve subdivision of the trigeminal nerve that transmits sensory information from the auricle, the external acoustic meatus, tympanic membrane, temporal region, the cheek, the skin overlying the mandible, the anterior portion of the tongue, the floor of the mouth, lower teeth and gingiva and transmits motor information from the muscles of mastication, the mylohyoid muscle and digastric muscle and the muscles tensor tympani and tensor veli palatini

Subject: abnormal hair cortex keratinization
Value: any defect in the formation of the fibrous elements found in the hair cortex comprising acidic (Type I ) and basic (Type II) proteins that give hair such aspects as resilience, and elasticity

Subject: abnormal median aperture morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the large midline opening of the posterior inferior part of the roof of the fourth ventricle that connects the fourth ventricle to the posterior cerebromedullary cistern and the spinal cord

Subject: abnormal lateral aperture morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the two lateral openings of the fourth ventricle into the subarachnoid space at the cerebellopontine angle

Subject: abnormal interventricular foramen morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the paired channels that connect the lateral and third ventricles and allows cerebrospinal fluid produced in the lateral ventricles to flow into the third ventricle

Subject: absent median aperture
Value: absence of the large midline opening of the posterior inferior part of the roof of the fourth ventricle that connects the fourth ventricle to the posterior cerebromedullary cistern and the spinal cord

Subject: abnormal otic vesicle morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the paired sacs of invaginated ectoderm that develop into the membraneous labyrinth of the inner ear

Subject: abnormal pelvic ligament morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the dorsal sacroiliac, the sacrotuberal and/or the iliolumbar ligaments associated with the bony ring formed by the pair of hip bones fused at the symphysis and their firm articulation with the sacrum

Subject: decreased oligodendrocyte number
Value: reduced number of cells of the central nervous system that form the insulating myelin sheath of axons in the CNS

Subject: abnormal urine uric acid level
Value: anomaly in the amount in the urine of the final oxidation product of purine catabolism in humans and primates, but which in rodents and most other mammals is normally is further oxidized by uricase to allantoin that is excreted in the urine

Subject: increased urine uric acid level
Value: greater amount in the urine of the final oxidation product of purine catabolism in humans and primates, but which in rodents and most other mammals is normally is further oxidized by uricase to allantoin that is excreted in the urine

Subject: abnormal prostaglandin level
Value: anomaly in the amount in the body of any of a class of mediators with effects of vasodilation, vasoconstriction, and smooth muscle stimulation

Subject: abnormal bradykinin level
Value: abnormal concentration of a potent, short-lived vasoactive peptide that causes arteriolar dilation and increased capillary permeability

Subject: abnormal leukotriene level
Value: abnormal concentration of a family of mediators derived from arachidonic acid which normally stimulate smooth muscle contraction, increase vascular permeability, and may be chemoattractants for inflammatory cells

Subject: increased prostaglandin level
Value: increase in the amount in the body of any of a class of mediators with effects of vasodilation, vasoconstriction, and smooth muscle stimulation

Subject: decreased prostaglandin level
Value: reduction in the amount in the body of any of a class of mediators with effects of vasodilation, vasoconstriction, and smooth muscle stimulation

Subject: increased leukotriene level
Value: increased concentration of a family of mediators derived from arachidonic acid which normally stimulate smooth muscle contraction, increase vascular permeability, and may be chemoattractants for inflammatory cells

Subject: decreased leukotriene level
Value: reduced concentration of a family of mediators derived from arachidonic acid which normally stimulate smooth muscle contraction, increase vascular permeability, and may be chemoattractants for inflammatory cells

Subject: abnormal thromboxane level
Value: anomalous concentration in the body of any of several compounds, originally derived from prostaglandin precursors in platelets, that stimulate aggregation of platelets and constriction of blood vessels

Subject: abnormal circulating androgen level
Value: anomaly in the blood concentration of any of the steroid hormones that control development and maintenance of masculine characteristics

Subject: abnormal liver vasculature morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the blood vessel network of the bile-secreting exocrine gland

Subject: abnormal vestibular aqueduct morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the small bony canal that surrounds the endolymphatic duct canal and links the vestibule of the inner ear to the posterior part of the internal surface of the petrous temporal bone

Subject: abnormal subarcuate fossa morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the irregular depression found on the posterior inner surface of the petrous portion of the temporal bone just below its crest and above and lateral to the internal acoustic meatus

Subject: abnormal sphingomyelin level
Value: deviation in the expected amount of any of a group of phospholipids that are found especially in, but not restricted to, nerve tissue and yield sphingosine, choline, a fatty acid, and phosphoric acid upon hydrolysis

Subject: spermatic granuloma
Value: a granulomatous nodular lesion that appears in the region of epididymis and can be large enough to totally occlude the epididymal lumen; sperm granulomas are rounded or irregular in shape, and contain dense aggregates of immune cells and degenerating sperm resulting from an autoimmune response against sperm-associated antigens exposed following biochemical or surgical insult (e.g. vasectomy) to the epididymal epithelium

Subject: cornea ulcer
Value: an area of tissue erosion in the transparent anterior portion of the fibrous coat of the eye that serves as the chief refractory structure

Subject: abnormal dermis reticular layer collagen network
Value: an anomaly in the amount or arrangement of the criss-crossing collagen fibers that form a strong elastic network normally arranged in parallel to the surface of the skin

Subject: skin detachment
Value: loss of sections of skin either spontaneously or after gentle handling

Subject: increased tumor latency
Value: later onset of tumor occurrence than expected

Subject: enlarged eye anterior chamber
Value: increased size of the space in the eye, filled with aqueous humor, and bounded anteriorly by the cornea and a small portion of the sclera and posteriorly by a small portion of the ciliary body, the iris, and part of the crystalline lens

Subject: abnormal sperm connecting piece morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the segment of the sperm flagellum that attaches to the implantation fossa of the nucleus in the sperm head; from the remnant of the centriole at this point, the axoneme extends throughout the length of the flagellum

Subject: abnormal sperm midpiece morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the highly organized segment of the sperm flagellum which begins at the connecting piece and is characterized by the presence of 9 outer dense fibers (ODFs) that lie outside each of the 9 outer axonemal microtubule doublets and by a sheath of mitochondria that encloses the ODFs and the axoneme; the midpiece terminates about one-fourth of the way down the sperm flagellum at the annulus, which marks the beginning of the principal piece

Subject: abnormal sperm mitochondrial sheath morphology
Value: any structural anomaly or impairment of the tightly packed helical sheath of ATP-producing mitochondria restricted to the midpiece of the sperm flagellum

Subject: absent sperm mitochondrial sheath
Value: absence of the tightly packed helical sheath of ATP-producing mitochondria, normally found in the midpiece of the sperm flagellum

Subject: abnormal sperm annulus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the ring-like, filamentous structure located at the distal end of the midpiece of the sperm flagellum; the annulus is thought to form a diffusion barrier between the midpiece and the principal piece and serve as a stabilizing structure for tail rigidity

Subject: absent sperm annulus
Value: absence of the ring-like, filamentous structure located at the midpiece-principal piece junction of the sperm flagellum, usually associated with a bent tail morphology

Subject: abnormal sperm principal piece morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the segment of the sperm flagellum where the mitochondrial sheath ends and the outer dense fibers (ODFs) associated with outer axonemal doublets 3 and 8 are replaced by the 2 longitudinal columns of the fibrous sheath (FS) which run the length of the principal piece and are stabilized by circumferential ribs; the principal piece makes up ~2/3 of the length of the sperm flagellum and is defined by the presence of the FS and of only 7 (rather than 9) ODFs which taper and then terminate near the distal end of the principal piece

Subject: abnormal sperm end piece morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the short remaining region of the sperm flagellum, which contains only the axoneme surrounded by the plasma membrane

Subject: abnormal sperm axoneme morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the central core of the sperm flagellum, composed of a ring of 9 outer microtubule doublets surrounding a central pair; inner and outer dynein arms project from each of the outer 9 doublets, and these arms are responsible for generating the motive force of the flagellum; in addition, 9 radial spokes, each of which originates from 1 of the 9 outer microtubular doublet pairs, project inward toward the central pair in a helical fashion

Subject: multiflagellated sperm
Value: presence of more than one sperm flagellum, displaying either one common origin from the sperm head or multiple origins from the same sperm head

Subject: abnormal foam cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a cell with a vacuolated appearance due to abnormal deposition and retention of lipoproteins, and typically seen in atherolosclerotic lesions, as well as other conditions, and derived from or related to the group of cells having the ability to take up and sequester inert particles and vital dyes, including macrophages and macrophage precursors, specialized endothelial cells lining the sinusoids of the liver, spleen, and bone marrow, and macrophages of lymphatic tissue and fibroblasts of bone marrow

Subject: foam cell reticulosis
Value: an increase in cells with a vacuolated appearance due to abnormal deposition and retention of lipoproteins and derived from or related to the group of cells having the ability to take up and sequester inert particles and vital dyes, including macrophages and macrophage precursors, specialized endothelial cells lining the sinusoids of the liver, spleen, and bone marrow, and macrophages of lymphatic tissue and fibroblasts of bone marrow

Subject: abnormal neural crest cell proliferation
Value: any anomaly in the ability of the transient and migratory group of cells that emerge from the dorsal region of the neural tube and migrate to many peripheral locations to form various tissues of the adult, to undergo rapid expansion by cell division

Subject: decreased neural crest cell number
Value: reduction in the number of ransient and migratory group of cells that emerge from the dorsal region of the neural tube and disperse to many peripheral locations to form various tissues of the adult

Subject: abnormal neural crest cell apoptosis
Value: change in the timing or the number of neural crest cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal neural crest cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the transient and highly migratory group of cells that delaminate in early embryonic development from the dorsal neural tube and give rise to a variety of differentiated cell types, including (1) the neurons and glial cells of the sensory, sympathetic, and parasympathetic nervous systems, (2) the epinephrine-producing (medulla) cells of the adrenal gland, (3) the pigment-containing cells of the epidermis, and (4) many of the skeletal and connective tissue components of the head

Subject: abnormal neural crest morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the specialized region of ectoderm found between the neural ectoderm (neural plate) and non-neural ectoderm and composed of highly migratory pluripotent cells that delaminate in early embryonic development from the dorsal neural tube and give rise to an astounding variety of differentiated cell types

Subject: abnormal scrotum pigmentation
Value: anomaly in the coloration of the scrotum due to changes in the amount, shape, or distribution of cells producing pigment

Subject: increased horizontal stereotypic behavior
Value: increase in the frequency of bursts of horizontal crossings (greater than one per second) in a time period

Subject: increased vertical stereotypic behavior
Value: increase in the frequency of bursts of vertical crossings (greater than one per second) in a time period

Subject: embryonic lethality between implantation and placentation
Value: <death anytime between the point of implantation and the initiation of placentation (Mus: E4.5 to less than E9)>

Subject: abnormal Sertoli cell phagocytosis
Value: altered ability of the Sertoli cells to endocytose and degrade the apoptotic spermatogenic cells and residual bodies (shed cytoplasts) during the maturation phase of spermiogenesis; normally, greater than 50 per cent of differentiating spermatogenic cells undergo apoptosis before maturing into spermatozoa, and these cells are selectively and rapidly eliminated through phagocytosis by Sertoli cells

Subject: increased Sertoli cell phagocytosis
Value: enhanced phagocytic activity of testicular Sertoli cells

Subject: decreased Sertoli cell phagocytosis
Value: decreased phagocytic activity of testicular Sertoli cells

Subject: impaired gastric peristalsis
Value: an increase in the time required for solids or liquids to leave the stomach and enter the intestines

Subject: midface retrusion
Value: the portion of the face comprising the nasal, maxillary, and zygomatic bones is shortened relative to the calvaria and located posterior to the normal position

Subject: failure of ejaculation
Value: inability to propulse semen from the genital ducts and the urethra to the exterior within a defined test period

Subject: absent kidney cortex
Value: absence of the outer portion of the kidney located between the renal capsule and the renal medulla and involved in ultrafiltration

Subject: abnormal cellular extravasation
Value: any anomaly in the migration of leukocytes from the blood vessels into the surrounding tissue

Subject: eye opacity
Value: changes in the eye grossly observed as a milky or cloudy appearance that may be progressive and persistent throughout life

Subject: nephrosclerosis
Value: hardening of the kidney from overgrowth, infiltration by fibrous connective tissue, and contraction of the interstitial connective tissue; often a result of renovascular diseases or chronic hypertension

Subject: abnormal pyloric sphincter morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the thick circular layer of gastric musculature encircling the gastroduodenal junction at the gastric outlet of the stomach

Subject: abnormal aorta elastic tissue morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the dense connective tissue which contains predominantly elastic fibers and is found in the aorta wall

Subject: abnormal heart elastic tissue morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the type of heart connective tissue found in the endocardial layer that consists mainly of elastic fibers

Subject: abnormal aorta endothelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the thin layer of flat cells that line the aorta and form a barrier between circulating blood in the lumen and the rest of the vessel wall

Subject: abnormal aorta smooth muscle morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the nonstriated, involuntary muscle tissue located in the wall of the aorta

Subject: abnormal aorta wall morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the part of the aorta that encloses the luminal space

Subject: abnormal ascending aorta morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the portion of the aorta that arises from the base of the left ventricle and extends upward to the aortic arch and from which the coronary arteries arise

Subject: abnormal descending thoracic aorta morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the part of the aorta that extends from the arch of the aorta to the diaphragm, and from which arises numerous branches that supply oxygenated blood to the chest cage and the organs within the chest

Subject: abnormal descending aorta morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the part of the aorta extending from the arch of aorta to the point where it divides into the common iliac arteries

Subject: abnormal abdominal aorta morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the part of the descending aorta that begins at the diaphragm and continues to the point of the common iliac arteries, and supplies oxygenated blood to all of the abdominal and pelvic organs and the legs

Subject: abnormal aorta tunica adventitia morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the outermost layer of the aorta wall, containing connective tissue and collagen and elastic fibers

Subject: abnormal aorta tunica intima morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the innermost layer of the aorta, containing the endothelium and an inner elastic membrane

Subject: abnormal aorta tunica media morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the middle layer of the aorta wall, containing the smooth muscle layer and elastic fibers

Subject: abnormal interdigital cell death
Value: change in the expected number of cells undergoing programmed cell death (apoptosis) in the autopod during development, precluding the sculpting of normal digits

Subject: absent interdigital cell death
Value: no cells undergo programmed cell death (apoptosis) in the autopod during development, precluding the sculpting of any digits

Subject: increased cellular sensitivity to thiophosphamide
Value: a greater frequency of chromosomal aberrations is found in cells after exposure to the alkylating agent thiophosphamide

Subject: exostosis
Value: a projection of bone, sometimes a benign tumor (osteochondroma), that is capped by cartilage and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage; these usually arise on the joints of bones and are most commonly found on ribs, and also the ankles, knees, shoulders, elbows and hips

Subject: decreased susceptibility to bone fracture
Value: reduced probability that injury or disease will result in damaged or broken bones

Subject: abnormal arcus anterior morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the arch that connects the lateral masses of the atlas anteriorly and articulates with the anterior articular facet of the dens of the axis

Subject: microstomia
Value: abnormally decreased size of the mouth

Subject: macrostomia
Value: excessive width of the mouth

Subject: absent palatal shelf
Value: absence of the palatal projections from the inner part of the maxillary processes that fuse to form the secondary palate

Subject: palatal shelf hypoplasia
Value: reduced size of the palatal projections from the inner part of the maxillary processes that fuse to form the secondary palate, often due to reduced cell number

Subject: palatal shelf fusion with tongue or mandible
Value: palatal shelves do not elevate during development and instead fuse with tongue tissues or with the mandible tissues

Subject: abnormal palatal shelf elevation
Value: any anomaly in the process in which the palatal shelves move from a vertical position in the orofacial cavity to a horizontal apposition above the developing tongue

Subject: failure of palatal shelf elevation
Value: the palatal shelves fail to move from a vertical position in the orofacial cavity to a horizontal apposition above the developing tongue

Subject: abnormal palatal shelf fusion at midline
Value: any anomaly in the process in which the palatal shelves grow toward the midline and adhere along the medial edge epithelia, forming the midline epithelial seam which disappears in later stages

Subject: palatal shelves fail to meet at midline
Value: polarized growth towards the midline following palatal shelf elevation does not occur

Subject: persistence of medial edge epithelium during palatal shelf fusion
Value: palatal shelves meet at the midline during development but do not adhere along the medial edge epithelia, and fail to form the midline epithelial seam

Subject: cleft secondary palate
Value: congenital fissure of the tissues normally uniting to form the secondary palate

Subject: abnormal palate bone morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the maxillary or palatine shelves that comprise the bones of the hard palate

Subject: palate bone hypoplasia
Value: reduced size of the maxillary or palatine shelves that comprise the bones of the hard palate, usually due to reduced cell number

Subject: cleft primary palate
Value: congenital fissure of the tissues normally uniting to form the primary palate; the primary palate will form the premaxillary portion of the maxilla (anterior one-third of the final palate)

Subject: absent hard palate
Value: absence of the anterior part of the palate that is supported by and includes the palatal extensions of the maxillary and palatine bones in the adult

Subject: decreased palatine bone horizontal plate size
Value: reduced size of the bony plate of the palatine bone that normally fuses with maxillary shelf to form secondary (hard) palate

Subject: palatine bone horizontal plate hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment, usually due to a deficiency in the number of cells, of the bony plate of the palatine bone that normally fuses with maxillary shelf to form secondary (hard) palate

Subject: decreased maxillary shelf size
Value: reduced size of the bony projection of the maxilla that normally fuses with palatine shelf to form secondary (hard) palate

Subject: maxillary shelf hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment, usually due to a deficiency in the number of cells, of the bony projection of the maxilla that normally fuses with palatine shelf to form secondary (hard) palate

Subject: hyoid bone hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment of the hyoid bone, usually due to a deficiency in the number of cells

Subject: vomer bone hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment of the vomer bone, usually due to a deficiency in the number of cells

Subject: abnormal frontonasal prominence morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of an unpaired facial process in the embryo formed from the tissues surrounding the forebrain vesicle that develops into the forehead and bridge of the nose/snout

Subject: abnormal lateral nasal prominence morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the lateral area of the two branches of a horseshoe-shaped mesenchymal swelling in the future nasal region of the embryo; it separates the olfactory pit from the developing eye and the ala of the nose/snout develops from it

Subject: abnormal medial nasal prominence morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the central area of the two limbs of a horseshoe-shaped mesenchymal swelling that lie medial to the olfactory placode or pit in the future nasal region of the embryo; it joins with the ipsilateral maxillary prominence in the formation of half of the upper jaw, and the nasal tip and philtrum of the upper lip develop from it

Subject: tongue hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment of the tongue, usually due to a deficiency in the number of cells

Subject: absent tongue
Value: absence of the mobile mass of muscular tissue and surrounding epithelial tissue occupying the cavity of the mouth and forming part of the floor

Subject: increased tongue size
Value: greater size the mobile mass of muscular tissue and surrounding epithelial tissue occupying the cavity of the mouth and forming part of the floor

Subject: decreased tongue size
Value: reduced size of the mobile mass of muscular tissue and surrounding epithelial tissue occupying the cavity of the mouth and forming part of the floor

Subject: protruding tongue
Value: the tongue extends out beyond the oral cavity past the lips; may be due to paralysis, oral cavity size, tongue hypoplasia or dysfunction of the hypoglossal nerve

Subject: bifid tongue
Value: tongue is fully divided by a lengthwise midline cleft

Subject: bifurcated tongue
Value: tongue is split into two halves at the anterior tip; division does not extend the full length of the tongue; this is normal in some animals such as reptiles

Subject: increased hyoid bone size
Value: greater size of the U-shaped bone lying between the mandible and the larynx that supports the tongue muscles

Subject: decreased hyoid bone size
Value: reduced size of the U-shaped bone lying between the mandible and the larynx that supports the tongue muscles

Subject: abnormal hyoid bone greater horn morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the larger and more lateral of the paired processes on either side of the hyoid bone

Subject: abnormal hyoid bone lesser horn morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of shorter and more medial of the paired processes on either side of the hyoid bone

Subject: absent hyoid bone lesser horns
Value: absence of shorter and more medial of the paired processes on either side of the hyoid bone

Subject: absent hyoid bone greater horns
Value: absence of the larger and more lateral of the paired processes on either side of the hyoid bone

Subject: abnormal hyoid bone body morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the main curve of the hyoid bone, from which the horns extend

Subject: abnormal stylohyoid ligament morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the fibrous cord that connects the tip of the styloid process of the temporal bone to the lesser horn of the hyoid bone

Subject: abnormal transitional stage T1 B cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a type of transitional stage B cell that migrates from the bone marrow into the peripheral circulation, and finally to the spleen; this cell type has the phenotype surface IgM-positive, surface IgD-negative, CD21-negative, CD23-negative, and CD62L-negative

Subject: abnormal transitional stage T2 B cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a type of transitional stage B cell that has the phenotype surface IgM-positive, surface IgD-postive, CD21-positive, CD23-positive, CD62L-negative, and is located in the splenic B follicles

Subject: abnormal transitional stage T3 B cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a type of a transitional stage B cell that expresses surface IgM and IgD, and CD62L; it is an anergic B cell that does not proliferate upon BCR signaling, is found in the spleen and lymph nodes, and has the phenotype surface IgM-positive, surface IgD-positive, CD21-positive, CD23-positive, and CD62L-positive

Subject: increased transitional stage T1 B cell number
Value: greater number of a type of transitional stage B cell that migrates from the bone marrow into the peripheral circulation, and finally to the spleen; this cell type has the phenotype surface IgM-positive, surface IgD-negative, CD21-negative, CD23-negative, and CD62L-negative

Subject: decreased transitional stage T1 B cell number
