Subject: abnormal Weber's gland morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the lingual glands located on the lateral margins of the tongue, at the level of the foliate papillae and in the root of the tongue behind the circumvallate papillae; in humans, the ducts of posterior superficial lingual glands open into the crypts of lingual tonsils; mucous supplied by these glands may help to cleanse the crypts and aid in deglutition

Subject: increased brain apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of cells of the brain undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal blood-retinal barrier function
Value: anomaly in the function of the part of the blood-ocular barrier that consists of cells that are joined tightly together to prevent certain substances from entering the tissue of the retina; the BRB consists of non-fenestrated capillaries of the retinal circulation and tight-junctions between retinal epithelial cells preventing passage of large molecules from choriocapillaris into the retina; the BRB barrier becomes more leaky in patients with diabetic retinopathy

Subject: abnormal thymus apoptosis
Value: change in the timing or the number of cells located in the thymus that are undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal respiratory epithelial sodium ion transmembrane transport
Value: any anomaly in the directed movement of a sodium from one side of the respiratory epithelial cell membrane to the other

Subject: decreased respiratory epithelial sodium ion transmembrane transport
Value: decrease in the directed movement of sodium ions from one side of the respiratory epithelial cell membrane to the other

Subject: increased respiratory epithelial sodium ion transmembrane transport
Value: increase in the directed movement of sodium ion from one side of the respiratory epithelial cell membrane to the other

Subject: hindbrain atrophy
Value: acquired diminution of the size of the hindbrain associated with wasting as from death and reabsorption of cells, diminished cellular proliferation, decreased cellular volume, pressure, ischemia, malnutrition, reduced function or malfunction, or hormonal changes

Subject: cerebellum atrophy
Value: acquired diminution of the size of the cerebellum associated with wasting as from death and reabsorption of cells, diminished cellular proliferation, decreased cellular volume, pressure, ischemia, malnutrition, reduced function or malfunction, or hormonal changes

Subject: epididymis hypertrophy
Value: increase in the bulk size of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens due to cell enlargement

Subject: spermatocele
Value: a retention cyst of a tubule of the rete testis or the head of the epididymis distended with barely watery fluid that contains spermatozoa

Subject: epididymis fibrosis
Value: invasion of fibrous connective tissue into the epididymis, often resulting from inflammation or injury

Subject: testis fibrosis
Value: invasion of fibrous connective tissue into the testis, often resulting from inflammation or injury

Subject: abnormal epididymis physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the elongated structure connected to the posterior surface of the testis that transports, stores, and matures spermatozoa between testis and vas deferens

Subject: abnormal epididymal cell proliferation
Value: anomaly in the expansion rate of any epididymal cell population by cell division

Subject: increased epididymal cell proliferation
Value: increase in the expansion rate of any epididymal cell population by cell division

Subject: decreased epididymal cell proliferation
Value: decrease in the expansion rate of any epididymal cell population by cell division

Subject: increased epididymal epithelium cell proliferation
Value: increase in the expansion rate of the cells of the epididymal epithelium by cell division

Subject: abnormal endocrine pancreas secretion
Value: anomaly in the synthesis and/or release of any of the hormones produced by different types of cells in the islets of Langerhans of the endocrine pancreas and secreted directly into the blood stream to regulate blood glucose homeostasis; these hormones include glucagon secreted by alpha cells, insulin and amylin (also known as Islet Amyloid Polypeptide or IAPP) co-secreted by beta cells, somatostatin secreted by delta cells, gherlin secreted by epsilon cells, and pancreatic polypeptide secreted by PP cells (also known as F cells

Subject: absent pituitary infundibular stalk
Value: absence of the apical portion of the tubular structure extending from the hypothalamus to the posterior lobe of the pituitary gland

Subject: abnormal parotid gland myoepithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the stellate-shaped contractile cells with long dendritic processes that surround the secretory acini and intercalated ducts of the parotid gland, usually found in the glandular epithelium as a thin layer above the basement membrane but generally beneath the luminal cells; they display features of both smooth muscle and epithelium, such as numerous microfilaments with focal densities in the cytoplasmic processes, and desmosomes which attach them to the epithelial cells; their functions include contraction when the gland is stimulated to secrete, compressing or reinforcing the underlying parenchymal cells, thus aiding in the expulsion of saliva and preventing damage to the other cells

Subject: abnormal respiratory epithelium physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the pseudostratified ciliated epithelium that lines much of the conducting portion of the airway, including part of the nasal cavity and larynx, the trachea, and bronchi

Subject: abnormal intestinal epithelium physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the cellular avascular layer of the digestive tube passing from the stomach to the anus

Subject: abnormal intestinal epithelial transmembrane transport
Value: any anomaly in the process in which a solute is transported across the lipid bilayer of an intestinal cell, from one side of a membrane to the other

Subject: abnormal intestinal epithelial chloride transmembrane transport
Value: any anomaly in the process in which a calcium ion is transported from one side of a membrane of an intestinal epithelial cell to the other by means of some agent such as a transporter or pore

Subject: abnormal intestinal epithelial sodium ion transmembrane transport
Value: any anomaly in the process in which a sodium ion is transported from one side of a membrane of an intestinal epithelial cell to the other by means of some agent such as a transporter or pore

Subject: increased intestinal epithelial sodium ion transmembrane transport
Value: increase in the directed movement of a sodium ions from one side of the intestinal epithelial cell membrane to the other

Subject: decreased intestinal epithelial sodium ion transmembrane transport
Value: decrease in the directed movement of a sodium ions from one side of the intestinal epithelial cell membrane to the other

Subject: increased intestinal epithelial chloride transmembrane transport
Value: increase in the directed movement of a chloride from one side of the intestinal epithelial cell membrane to the other

Subject: decreased intestinal epithelial chloride transmembrane transport
Value: decrease in the directed movement of a chloride from one side of the intestinal epithelial cell membrane to the other

Subject: abnormal colon goblet cell number
Value: any anomaly in the number of goblet cells in the colon

Subject: abnormal alveolar macrophage number
Value: any anomaly in the number of round, granular, mononuclear phagocytes found in the alveoli of the lungs which ingest small inhaled particles resulting in degradation and presentation of the antigen to immunocompetent cells

Subject: increased alveolar macrophage number
Value: increase in the number of round, granular, mononuclear phagocytes found in the alveoli of the lungs which ingest small inhaled particles resulting in degradation and presentation of the antigen to immunocompetent cells

Subject: decreased alveolar macrophage number
Value: reduction in the number of round, granular, mononuclear phagocytes found in the alveoli of the lungs which ingest small inhaled particles resulting in degradation and presentation of the antigen to immunocompetent cells

Subject: dilated crypts of Lieberkuhn
Value: an expansion in the volume or area of the lumen of the crypts of Lieberkuhn

Subject: intestinal mucus accumulation
Value: increase in the amount of mucus contained within the lumin of the intestine

Subject: pancreatic acinus dilation
Value: the luminal space of the pancreatic acini are increased in volume or area, usually with an increase in contained fluid

Subject: bile duct epithelium hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size of the bile duct epithelium, usually due an increased number of cells

Subject: abnormal response to antigen
Value: anomaly in the immune response after exposure to an antigen

Subject: decreased response to antigen
Value: decreased or weak immune response after exposure to an antigen

Subject: increased response to antigen
Value: increased immune response after exposure to an antigen

Subject: abnormal sulfolipid level
Value: an anomaly in the concentration of lipids that possess a sulfur-containing functional group

Subject: obsolete abnormal sulfatide level
Value: anomaly in the concentration of the sulfolipids that contribute to myelin function and stability

Subject: decreased sulfoglycosphingolipid level
Value: decreased concentration of the sulfolipids that contribute to myelin function and stability

Subject: increased sulfoglycosphingolipid level
Value: increased concentration of the sulfolipids that contribute to myelin function and stability

Subject: decreased brain sulfoglycosphingolipid level
Value: decreased brain concentration of the sulfolipids that contribute to myelin function and stability

Subject: increased brain sulfoglycosphingolipid level
Value: increased brain concentration of the sulfolipids that contribute to myelin function and stability

Subject: abnormal bone mineral density of femur
Value: anomaly in the quatitative measurment of mineral content of bone in the long bone of the thigh

Subject: decreased bone mineral density of femur
Value: reduction in the quatitative measurment value of mineral content of bone in the long bone of the thigh

Subject: increased bone mineral density of femur
Value: elevation in the quatitative measurment value of mineral content of bone in the long bone of the thigh

Subject: abnormal arylsulphatase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: a phenol sulfate + H2O = a phenol + sulfate>

Subject: decreased arylsulphatase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction: a phenol sulfate + H2O = a phenol + sulfate>

Subject: increased arylsulphatase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction: a phenol sulfate + H2O = a phenol + sulfate>

Subject: abnormal aldehyde dehydrogenase activity
Value: anomaly in the ability to catalyze the oxidation (dehydrogenation) of aldehydes.

Subject: decreased aldehyde dehydrogenase activity
Value: increased ability to catalyze the oxidation (dehydrogenation) of aldehydes.

Subject: increased aldehyde dehydrogenase activity
Value: decreased ability to catalyze the oxidation (dehydrogenation) of aldehydes.

Subject: abnormal phenylalanine decarboxylase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: L-phenylalanine = phenylethylamine + CO2>

Subject: decreased phenylalanine decarboxylase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction: L-phenylalanine = phenylethylamine + CO2>

Subject: increased phenylalanine decarboxylase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction: L-phenylalanine = phenylethylamine + CO2>

Subject: abnormal delta-aminolaevulinate dehydratase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: 2 5-aminolevulinate = 2 H(2)O + H(+) + porphobilinogen>

Subject: decreased delta-aminolaevulinate dehydratase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction: 2 5-aminolevulinate = 2 H(2)O + H(+) + porphobilinogen>

Subject: decreased hepatic delta-aminolaevulinate dehydratase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction in the liver: 2 5-aminolevulinate = 2 H(2)O + H(+) + porphobilinogen>

Subject: increased delta-aminolaevulinate dehydratase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction: 2 5-aminolevulinate = 2 H(2)O + H(+) + porphobilinogen>

Subject: increased hepatic delta-aminolaevulinate dehydratase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction in the liver: 2 5-aminolevulinate = 2 H(2)O + H(+) + porphobilinogen>

Subject: abnormal aldehyde oxidase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: an aldehyde + H2O + O2 = a carboxylic acid + hydrogen peroxide>

Subject: decreased aldehyde oxidase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction:an aldehyde + H2O + O2 = a carboxylic acid + hydrogen peroxide>

Subject: increased aldehyde oxidase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction: an aldehyde + H2O + O2 = a carboxylic acid + hydrogen peroxide>

Subject: abnormal cholinesterase activity
Value: aberrant activity of the enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid

Subject: abnormal circulating cholinesterase activity
Value: aberrant activity of the blood of the enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid

Subject: decreased circulating cholinesterase activity
Value: decreased activity of the blood of the enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid

Subject: increased circulating cholinesterase activity
Value: increased activity of the blood of the enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid

Subject: increased cholinesterase activity
Value: increased activity of the enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid

Subject: decreased cholinesterase activity
Value: decreased activity of the enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid

Subject: abnormal coumarin hydroxylase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: coumarin + O2 + NADPH + H+ = hydroxycoumarin + H2O + NADP+>

Subject: decreased coumarin hydroxylase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction: coumarin + O2 + NADPH + H+ = hydroxycoumarin + H2O + NADP+>

Subject: increased coumarin hydroxylase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction: coumarin + O2 + NADPH + H+ = hydroxycoumarin + H2O + NADP+>

Subject: retinal macular degeneration
Value: retrogressive pathological change of the macula lutea

Subject: increased bone ossification
Value: increase  in the formation of bone or of a bony substance, or the conversion of fibrous tissue or of cartilage into bone or a bony substance

Subject: decreased bone ossification
Value: decrease in the formation of bone or of a bony substance, or the conversion of fibrous tissue or of cartilage into bone or a bony substance

Subject: decreased susceptibility to pulmonary hyaline membrane formation
Value: decreased likelihood of the presence of an eosinophilic hyaline (glass-like) material composed of fibrin, proteinaceous exudate and cellular debris, and lining or filling the alveoli, alveolar ducts and bronchioles

Subject: abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: D-glucose 6-phosphate + NADP+ = D-glucono-1,5-lactone 6-phosphate + NADPH + H+>

Subject: decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction: D-glucose 6-phosphate + NADP+ = D-glucono-1,5-lactone 6-phosphate + NADPH + H+>

Subject: increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction: D-glucose 6-phosphate + NADP+ = D-glucono-1,5-lactone 6-phosphate + NADPH + H+>

Subject: abnormal tyrosine aminotransferase activity
Value: anomaly in the ability to catalyze the transfer of an amino group from L-tyrosine to an acceptor, usually a 2-oxo acid

Subject: decreased tyrosine aminotransferase activity
Value: decreased ability to catalyze the transfer of an amino group from L-tyrosine to an acceptor, usually a 2-oxo acid

Subject: increased tyrosine aminotransferase activity
Value: increased ability to catalyze the transfer of an amino group from L-tyrosine to an acceptor, usually a 2-oxo acid

Subject: abnormal maltase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: alpha-maltose + H2O = 2 alpha-D-glucose>

Subject: decreased maltase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction:alpha-maltose + H2O = 2 alpha-D-glucose>

Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction:alpha-maltose + H2O = 2 alpha-D-glucose>

Subject: abnormal procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: procollagen L-proline + 2-oxoglutarate + O2 = procollagen trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline + succinate + CO2>

Subject: decreased procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity
Value: <decreased ability to catalyze the reaction: procollagen L-proline + 2-oxoglutarate + O2 = procollagen trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline + succinate + CO2>

Subject: increased procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity
Value: <increased ability to catalyze the reaction: procollagen L-proline + 2-oxoglutarate + O2 = procollagen trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline + succinate + CO2>

Subject: abnormal beta-glucuronidase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: a beta-D-glucuronoside + H2O = an alcohol + D-glucuronate>

Subject: abnormal spermatazoal beta-glucuronidase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: a beta-D-glucuronoside + H2O = an alcohol + D-glucuronate in the spermatozoa>

Subject: decreased beta-glucuronidase activity
Value: <reduced ability to catalyze the reaction: a beta-D-glucuronoside + H2O = an alcohol + D-glucuronate>

Subject: decreased spermatazoal beta-glucuronidase activity
Value: <reduced ability to catalyze the reaction: a beta-D-glucuronoside + H2O = an alcohol + D-glucuronate in the spermatozoa>

Subject: increased beta-glucuronidase activity
Value: <greater ability to catalyze the reaction: a beta-D-glucuronoside + H2O = an alcohol + D-glucuronate>

Subject: increased spermatazoal beta-glucuronidase activity
Value: <greater ability to catalyze the reaction: a beta-D-glucuronoside + H2O = an alcohol + D-glucuronate in the spermatozoa>

Subject: abnormal hypoxanthine phosphoribosyltransferase activity
Value: <anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: IMP + diphosphate = hypoxanthine + 5-phospho-alpha-D-ribose 1-diphosphate>

Subject: increased palmitoyl-(protein) hydrolase level
Value: increased level fo the enzyme that removes thioester-linked fatty acyl groups such as palmitate from modified cysteine residues in proteins or peptides during lysosomal degradation

Subject: decreased palmitoyl-(protein) hydrolase level
Value: reduced level fo the enzyme that removes thioester-linked fatty acyl groups such as palmitate from modified cysteine residues in proteins or peptides during lysosomal degradation

Subject: ectopic limbs
Value: more than the expected number of limbs differentiate during early embryogenesis

Subject: astasia
Value: the inability to stand due to muscular incoordination

Subject: floppy ears
Value: ears that are limp or hanging loosely

Subject: abnormal dystrophin level
Value: deviation from the normal level of the cytoplasmic protein that connects the cytoskeleton of a muscle fiber to the surrounding extracellular matrix through the cell membrane

Subject: decreased dystrophin level
Value: reduced level of the cytoplasmic protein that connects the cytoskeleton of a muscle fiber to the surrounding extracellular matrix through the cell membrane

Subject: increased dystrophin level
Value: greater level of the cytoplasmic protein that connects the cytoskeleton of a muscle fiber to the surrounding extracellular matrix through the cell membrane

Subject: abnormal guanylate cyclase activating protein-2 level
Value: abnormal level of the enzyme that accelerates the recovery of rods and cones from excitation by light in response to calcium proteins

Subject: decreased guanylate cyclase activating protein-2 level
Value: decreased level of the enzyme that accelerates the recovery of rods and cones from excitation by light in response to calcium proteins

Subject: increased guanylate cyclase activating protein-2 level
Value: increased level of the enzyme that accelerates the recovery of rods and cones from excitation by light in response to calcium proteins

Subject: abnormal UDP-N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphotransferase level
Value: <abnormal level of the enzyme that catalyzes the chemical reaction: UDP-N-acetyl-D-glucosamine + lysosomal-enzyme D-mannose to UMP + lysosomal-enzyme N-acetyl-D-glucosaminyl-phospho-D-mannose>

Subject: decreased UDP-N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphotransferase level
Value: <decreased level of the enzyme that catalyzes the chemical reaction: UDP-N-acetyl-D-glucosamine + lysosomal-enzyme D-mannose to UMP + lysosomal-enzyme N-acetyl-D-glucosaminyl-phospho-D-mannose>

Subject: increased UDP-N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphotransferase level
Value: <increased level of the enzyme that catalyzes the chemical reaction: UDP-N-acetyl-D-glucosamine + lysosomal-enzyme D-mannose to UMP + lysosomal-enzyme N-acetyl-D-glucosaminyl-phospho-D-mannose>

Subject: long tongue
Value: increased length of the mobile mass of muscular tissue and surrounding epithelial tissue occupying the cavity of the mouth and forming part of the floor

Subject: short tongue
Value: decreased length of the mobile mass of muscular tissue and surrounding epithelial tissue occupying the cavity of the mouth and forming part of the floor

Subject: large horns
Value: increased size of the one or more of the hard pointed parts that grows on the head of some animals

Subject: small horns
Value: decreased size of the one or more of the hard pointed parts that grows on the head of some animals

Subject: abnormal horn morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the hard pointed parts that grows on the head of some animals

Subject: abnormal horn pigmentation
Value: irregular or unusual pigmentation of the hard pointed parts that grows on the head of some animals

Subject: absent horns
Value: lack of the hard pointed parts that grows on the head of some animals

Subject: abnormal creatine kinase activity
Value: <altered ability of to catalyze the reaction: ATP + creatine = N-phosphocreatine + ADP + 2 H(+).>

Subject: decreased creatine kinase activity
Value: <reduced ability of to catalyze the reaction: ATP + creatine = N-phosphocreatine + ADP + 2 H(+).>

Subject: increased creatine kinase activity
Value: <increased ability of to catalyze the reaction: ATP + creatine = N-phosphocreatine + ADP + 2 H(+).>

Subject: abnormal hydroxymethylbilane synthase activity
Value: <altered ability of to catalyze the reaction: H(2)O + 4 porphobilinogen = hydroxymethylbilane + 4 NH(4)(+).>

Subject: decreased hydroxymethylbilane synthase activity
Value: <reduced ability of to catalyze the reaction: H(2)O + 4 porphobilinogen = hydroxymethylbilane + 4 NH(4)(+).>

Subject: increased hydroxymethylbilane synthase activity
Value: <increased ability of to catalyze the reaction: H(2)O + 4 porphobilinogen = hydroxymethylbilane + 4 NH(4)(+).>

Subject: abnormal palmitoyl-(protein) hydrolase activity
Value: <altered ability of to catalyze the reaction: palmitoyl-protein + H2O = palmitate + protein.>

Subject: decreased palmitoyl-(protein) hydrolase activity
Value: <reduced ability of to catalyze the reaction: palmitoyl-protein + H2O = palmitate + protein.>

Subject: increased palmitoyl-(protein) hydrolase activity
Value: <increased ability of to catalyze the reaction: palmitoyl-protein + H2O = palmitate + protein.>

Subject: decreased vascular endothelial cell proliferation
Value: decrease in the expansion rate of any vascular endothelial cell population by cell division

Subject: abnormal vascular endothelial cell adhesion
Value: altered ability of an endothelial cell in the vasculature to adhere to another cell or to a non-cellular component of the environment

Subject: increased vascular endothelial cell adhesion
Value: greater than expected ability of an endothelial cell in the vasculature to adhere to another cell or to a non-cellular component of the environment

Subject: decreased vascular endothelial cell adhesion
Value: less than expected ability of an endothelial cell in the vasculature to adhere to another cell or to a non-cellular component of the environment

Subject: abnormal vascular endothelial cell apoptosis
Value: change in the timing or the number of vascular endothelial cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: increased vascular endothelial cell apoptosis
Value: increase in the timing or the number of vascular endothelial cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: decreased vascular endothelial cell apoptosis
Value: decrease in the timing or the number of vascular endothelial cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal heart apex size
Value: any anomaly in the proportions  of the lowest superficial part of the heart, normally directed downward, forward, and to the left, and overlapped by the left lung and pleura; the heart apex is formed by the inferolateral part of the left ventricle and responsible for regulating ventricle contraction

Subject: jejunum polyps
Value: development of numerous growths that are connected to and protrude from the mucous membrane of the jejunum

Subject: abnormal beige fat cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of fat cells that are beige in color, thermogenic, and which differentiates in white fat tissue from a Myf5-negative progenitor

Subject: dilated capillary
Value: stretched or widened aperture of the luminal space of the small branching blood vessel that form a network between the arterioles and venules

Subject: abnormal capillary branching pattern
Value: any changes in the placement, morphology or number of divisions of the capillaries

Subject: abnormal capillary density
Value: any anomaly in the number of capillaries in a given cross-sectional area of a tissue

Subject: decreased capillary density
Value: reduction in the number of capillaries in a given cross-sectional area of a tissue

Subject: increased capillary density
Value: increase in the number of capillaries in a given cross-sectional area of a tissue

Subject: increased capillary tortuosity
Value: increase in the degree of twisting of capillaries

Subject: impaired leukocyte tethering or rolling
Value: reduced ability or inability  in the transient adhesive interactions between leukocytes and endothelial cells lining blood vessels mediated primarily by selectins and which are typically the first step in cellular extravasation

Subject: enhanced leukocyte tethering or rolling
Value: enhancement of the transient adhesive interactions between leukocytes and endothelial cells lining blood vessels mediated primarily by selectins and which are typically the first step in cellular extravasation

Subject: abnormal melanophage morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the  melanin-containing macrophages that obtain the pigment by phagocytosis of melanosomes

Subject: abnormal dentate gyrus neuron dendrite morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the highly branched tree-like process of a neuron in one of two interlocking gyri of the hippocampus formation

Subject: abnormal motor neuron dendrite morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the highly branched tree-like process of cells that innervate an effector (muscle or glandular) tissue and are responsible for transmission of motor impulses

Subject: abnormal pyramidal neuron dendrite morphology
Value: structural anomaly of the highly branched tree-like process of the neurons that have a pyramid-shaped soma with the apex and an apical dendrite pointed toward the pial surface and other dendrites and an axon emerging from the base

Subject: abnormal hippocampal pyramidal neuron dendrite morphology
Value: structural anomaly of the highly branched tree-like process of the hippocampal neurons that have a pyramid-shaped soma with the apex and an apical dendrite pointed toward the pial surface and other dendrites and an axon emerging from the base

Subject: abnormal retinal ganglion cell dendrite morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the highly branched tree-like process of neurons in the retina that receive neural inputs via bipolar, horizontal and amacrine cells

Subject: abnormal inhibitory learning
Value: anomaly in the process by which a subject learns to suppress a prior learned response

Subject: abnormal circulating hyaluronic acid level
Value: <any anomaly in the amount in the blood of hyaluronic acid, an anionic nonsulfated glycosaminoglycan containing the constituent sugars: glucuronic acid and glucosamine>

Subject: small optic nerve
Value: decreased size of the second cranial nerve which is responsible for conveying visual information from the retina to the brain; it extends from the retina to the optic chiasma where part of its fibers become the optic tract and cross to the opposite side and pass to the geniculate bodies

Subject: abnormal ureteric bud number
Value: anomaly in the number of the epithelial swelling on the metanephric duct that elongates to invade the adjacent metanephric mesenchyme

Subject: abnormal susceptibility to injury induced morbidity/mortality
Value: differences from the expected moribund state caused by trauma, especially that by physical means

Subject: abnormal myocardial fiber currents
Value: any anomaly in the electrical currents produced by cardiac ion channels, typically measured using  whole-cell patch-clamp techniques

Subject: abnormal mycardial fiber calcium currents
Value: any anomaly in the electrical currents produced by cardiac calcium ion channels, typically measured using  whole-cell patch-clamp techniques

Subject: abnormal mycoardial fiber sodium currents
Value: any anomaly in the electrical currents produced by cardiac sodium ion channels, typically measured using  whole-cell patch-clamp techniques

Subject: decreased olfactory sensory neuron number
Value: decreased number of the neurons in the olfactory epithelium that are activated by specific odorants

Subject: abnormal dendritic cell migration
Value: any anomaly in the movement of dendritic cells from one site to another

Subject: fused pharyngeal arches
Value: failure of two or more pharyngeal arches to fully separate

Subject: decreased vocalization
Value: decrease in the production of vocal sound

Subject: abnormal endoplasmic reticulum physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the irregular network of unit membranes, visible only by electron microscopy, that occurs in the cytoplasm of many eukaryotic cells

Subject: abnormal endoplasmic reticulum stress
Value: any anomaly in the accumulation of misfolded or unfolded proteins in the endoplasmic reticulum lumen; this accumulation maybe stimulated by genetic or enviromental factors

Subject: increased endoplasmic reticulum stress
Value: increase in in the accumulation of misfolded or unfolded proteins in the endoplasmic reticulum lumen; this accumulation may be stimulated by genetic or enviromental factors

Subject: abnormal Sertoli cell barrier morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the physical barrier found between adjacent Sertoli cells within the seminiferous tubules; the sertoli cell barrier consists of several types of cellular junctions including tight junctions, gap junctions and adhesion junctions, and divides the seminiferous tubules into the basal and apical (adluminal) compartments

Subject: abnormal Sertoli cell barrier function
Value: any functional anomaly of the physical barrier found between the blood vessels and the seminiferous tubules of the testes; this barrier between Sertoli cells is composed of  tight junctions, basal ectoplasmic specializations, and desmosome-like junctions

Subject: abnormal excitatory synapse morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a synapse in which an action potential in the presynaptic cell increases the probability of an action potential occurring in the postsynaptic cell

Subject: abnormal inhibitory synapse morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in a synapse in which an action potential in the presynaptic cell reduces the probability of an action potential occurring in the postsynaptic cell

Subject: abnormal ribbon synapse morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in a synapse characterized by an electron-dense ribbon, lamella (bar) or spherical body in the presynaptic process cytoplasm

Subject: abnormal asymmetric synapse morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in a type of synapse occurring between an axon and a dendritic spine or dendritic shaft; asymmetric synapses, the most abundant synapse type in the central nervous system, involve axons that contain predominantly spherical vesicles and contain a thickened postsynaptic density

Subject: abnormal symmetric synapse morphology
Value: any structurla anomaly in  synapse that lacks an electron dense postsynaptic specialization; in vertebtrates, these occur primarily on dendrite shafts and neuronal cell bodies and involve persynapses containing clusters of predominantly flattened or elongated vesicles and are typcially inhibitory

Subject: abnormal male germ cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of male germ cells whether they are undifferentiated or fully differentiated

Subject: abnormal germ cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the germ cell, that is, any of the reproductive (generative) cells of a multicellular organism, whether they are undifferentiated or fully differentiated

Subject: abnormal female germ cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly female germ cells whether they are undifferentiated or fully differentiated

Subject: increased brain iron level
Value: increase in the amount of iron present in the brain tissue

Subject: decreased brain iron level
Value: reduction in the amount of iron present in the brain tissue

Subject: increased heart iron level
Value: increase in the amount of iron present in the heart tissue

Subject: decreased heart iron level
Value: reduction in the amount of iron present in the heart tissue

Subject: increased intestinal iron level
Value: increase in the amount of iron present in the large or small intestinal tissue

Subject: abnormal glymphatic system morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the macroscopic waste clearance system that utilizes a unique system of perivascular tunnels, formed by astroglial cells, to promote efficient elimination of soluble proteins and metabolites from the central nervous system

Subject: abnormal glymphatic system physiology
Value: any functional anomaly in the macroscopic waste clearance system that utilizes a unique system of perivascular tunnels, formed by astroglial cells, to promote efficient elimination of soluble proteins and metabolites from the central nervous system

Subject: abnormal tetrachloroethene metabolism
Value: altered ability to metabolize tetrachloroethene, a chlorinated olefin solvent with a variety of industrial applications, a ubiquitous contaminant of ground water, soil, ambient and urban air, and is one of the most common pollutants present in many hazardous waste sites

Subject: abnormal blood vessel lumen formation
Value: any anomaly in the process in which a developing blood vessel forms an endothelial lumen through which blood will flow; in vertebrates, the lumen of all blood vessels is lined and formed by endothelial cells; in both vasculogenesis and angiogenesis, lumen formation takes place in a cord of endothelial cells and involves a complex mechanism composed of endothelial cell repulsion at the cell-cell contacts within the endothelial cell cords, junctional rearrangement, and endothelial cell shape change

Subject: abnormal nocifensive behavior
Value: any anomaly in a behavioral response to a noxious signal typically mediated by nociception

Subject: abnormal costotransverse joint morphology
Value: any anomaly in the structure of the articulation between the facet of the tubercle of a rib and the transverse process of a thoracic vertebra

Subject: abnormal starburst amacrine cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the retinal amacrine cells with a characteristic starburst shape of the dendritic arbor and that secrete both the the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid and the excitatory neurotransmitter acetylcholine

Subject: abnormal dopaminergic amacrine cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the retinal amacrine cells that express dopamine and are often identified by immunostaining for expression of tyrosine hydroxylase

Subject: abnormal cell cytoskeleton morphology
Value: any anomaly in the structure of the various filamentous elements that form the internal framework of cells, and typically remain after treatment of the cells with mild detergent to remove membrane constituents and soluble components of the cytoplasm

Subject: abnormal sucrose solution preference
Value: any anomaly in the desire to drink water containing sucrose compared to consuming straight water

Subject: abnormal galactolipid level
Value: any anomaly in the concentrations of the glycolipids whose sugar group is galactose and that do not have nitrogen in their composition in the body

Subject: muscle gating pore current
Value: an anomalous non-selective cation current that is unaffected by the normal pore blockers and therefore represents ion movement through a permeation pathway in voltage-sensor domain of the protein rather than through the central pore

Subject: increased kidney epithelial cell primary cilium length
Value: increased length of the cilia on cells of the renal tubule or collecting duct

Subject: decreased kidney epithelial cell primary cilium length
Value: decreased length of the cilia on cells of the renal tubule or collecting duct

Subject: absent kidney epithelial cell primary cilium
Value: absence of non-motile cilia on cells of the renal tubule or collecting duct

Subject: decreased intestinal iron level
Value: reduction in the amount of iron present in the large or small intestinal tissue

Subject: adipose tissue inflammation
Value: local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes in adipose tissue

Subject: abnormal radial glial cell number
Value: anomaly in the number of the supporting cells of the developing central nervous system that guide neuronal migration during development and exchange metabolites with developing and migrating neurons; these cells differentiate into astrocytes and some neuronal types in the adult

Subject: decreased radial glial cell number
Value: reduction in the number of the supporting cells of the developing central nervous system that guide neuronal migration during development and exchange metabolites with developing and migrating neurons; these cells differentiate into astrocytes and some neuronal types in the adult

Subject: increased radial glial cell number
Value: increase in the number of the supporting cells of the developing central nervous system that guide neuronal migration during development and exchange metabolites with developing and migrating neurons; these cells differentiate into astrocytes and some neuronal types in the adult

Subject: abnormal radial glial cell endfoot morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the tip of the elongated basal process that extends from the cell body of a radial glial cell through the entire cortical wall; the tip of the basal process, known as the basal endfoot, attaches to the pial basement membrane

Subject: radial glial endfoot detachment
Value: detachment of the radial glia cell endfoot from the pial basement membrane

Subject: abnormal radial glial cell apoptosis
Value: change in the timing or the number of radial glial cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: increased neuronal precursor proliferation
Value: increase in the ability of a neuroblast population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division

Subject: decreased neuronal precursor proliferation
Value: reduction in the ability of a neuroblast population to undergo rapid expansion by cell division

Subject: abnormal response to social novelty
Value: any anomaly in the interaction of an individual with a familiar versus a novel individual of the same species; in mouse the typical behavior is for increased interaction with the novel individual

Subject: abnormal social recognition
Value: any anomaly in the ability of an individual to recognize another individual of the same species during repeated encounters

Subject: abnormal megakaryocyte physiology
Value: any functional anomaly in the giant cell 50 to 100 micron in diameter, with a greatly lobulated nucleus, found in the bone marrow; mature blood platelets are released from its cytoplasm

Subject: abnormal megakaryocyte emperipolesis
Value: any anomaly in the process by which a a megakaryocyte is penetrated by another living cell; unlike in phagocytosis the engulfed cell remains viable and may exit the megakaryocyte without damage to either cell

Subject: enhanced megakaryocyte emperipolesis
Value: an increase in the process by which a a megakaryocyte is penetrated by another living cell

Subject: cystinuria
Value: excretion of excessive amounts of cystine in the urine

Subject: argininuria
Value: excretion of excessive amounts of arginine in the urine

Subject: ornithinuria
Value: excretion of excessive amounts of ornithine in the urine

Subject: lysinuria
Value: excretion of excessive amounts of lysine in the urine

Subject: prolinuria
Value: excretion of excessive amounts of proline in the urine

Subject: taurinuria
Value: excretion of excessive amounts of taurine in the urine

Subject: hyperthreoninuria
Value: excretion of excessive amounts of threonine in the urine

Subject: abnormal placental thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of one or more thrombi within the blood vessel network of the placenta

Subject: altered susceptibility to induced thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation of thrombi following stimulation of thrombosis by an external agent

Subject: abnormal cardiac thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of one or more thrombi in the heart

Subject: increased liposarcoma incidence
Value: <greater than the expected number of malignant tumors derived from primitive or embryonal lipoblastic cells; these may be composed of well-differentiated fat cells or may be dedifferentiated: myxoid, round-celled, or pleomorphic>

Subject: increased abdominal adipose tissue amount
Value: increase in amount of adipose tissue associated with internal organs

Subject: abnormal amnion physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the thin innermost layer of the extraembryonic membranes that contains the amniotic fluid; the membrane forms a closed sac in which the embryo and later, the fetus, is suspended and protected

Subject: increased amnion apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of cells of the amnion undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal fibroblast physiology
Value: any functional anomaly in the cellular physiological processes carried out by a fibroblast cell population

Subject: abnormal fibroblast chemotaxis
Value: any anomaly in the directed movement of a fibroblast cell population guided by a specific chemical concentration gradient; movement may be towards a higher concentration (positive chemotaxis) or towards a lower concentration (negative chemotaxis)

Subject: decreased fibroblast chemotaxis
Value: reduction in the directed movement response of a fibroblast cell population guided by a specific chemical concentration gradient; movement may be towards a higher concentration (positive chemotaxis) or towards a lower concentration (negative chemotaxis)

Subject: increased fibroblast chemotaxis
Value: increase in the directed movement response of a fibroblast cell population guided by a specific chemical concentration gradient; movement may be towards a higher concentration (positive chemotaxis) or towards a lower concentration (negative chemotaxis)

Subject: increased cardiac muscle relaxation
Value: greater than the normal ability of the cardiac/heart muscle to lengthen following contractions, often measured by dP/dt min

Subject: decreased cardiac muscle relaxation
Value: inability or reduced ability of the cardiac/heart muscle to lengthen following contractions, often measured by dP/dt min

Subject: abnormal freezing behavior
Value: any anomaly in the behavior defined as total cessation of movement apart from respiration or eye movement with the animal remaining alert with strong muscle tone; typically a response to potential danger

Subject: increased freezing behavior
Value: an elevated display, frequency, or duration of freezing behavior

Subject: decreased freezing behavior
Value: a decreased display, frequency, or duration of freezing behavior

Subject: increased kindling response
Value: increased epileptogenic changes, normally induced by daily sub threshold electrical brain stimulation

Subject: abnormal retinal bipolar cell electrophysiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the retinal biopolar cells as determined through electrophysiological recordings from single cells or summary recordings from multiple cells

Subject: abnormal beige fat cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of fat cells that are beige in color, thermogenic, and which differentiates in white fat tissue from a Myf5-negative progenitor

Subject: increased hepatocyte karyomegaly
Value: an increase in the number or proportion of liver cells with enlarged nuclei

Subject: abnormal conditioned place aversion behavior
Value: anomaly in the ability of an animal to learn and remember an association between an unpleasant or punishing stimuli with a neutral, unchanging environment

Subject: abnormal platelet alpha-granule number
Value: altered number of the most abundant secretory organelle found in blood platelets, and which store adhesive molecules such as von Willebrand factor and fibrinogen, growth factors and inflammatory and angiogenic mediators, which play crucial roles in inflammatory responses and tumor genesis

Subject: increased platelet alpha-granule number
Value: increased number of platelet alpha-granules

Subject: decreased platelet alpha-granule number
Value: decreased number of platelet alpha-granules

Subject: decreased platelet dense granule number
Value: decreased number of the electron-dense bodies occurring in blood platelets that store and secrete adenosine nucleotides and serotonin

Subject: increased platelet dense granule number
Value: increased number of the electron-dense bodies occurring in blood platelets that store and secrete adenosine nucleotides and serotonin

Subject: increased astrocyte size
Value: increase in the size of the large neuroglial (macroglial) cells in the central nervous system

Subject: decreased astrocyte size
Value: decrease in the size of the large neuroglial (macroglial) cells in the central nervous system

Subject: abnormal astrocyte size
Value: anomaly in the size of the large neuroglial (macroglial) cells in the central nervous system

Subject: abnormal social play behavior
Value: behavior performed in the absence of normal stimuli or behavior elicited by normal stimuli but not followed to the completion of the ritualized behavior pattern that is associated with the socialization of an individual into the group

Subject: decreased papilloma incidence
Value: fewer than the expected number of benign tumors consisting of villous or arborescent outgrowths of fibrovascular stroma covered by neoplastic epithelial cells occurring in a specific population in a given time period

Subject: absent b wave
Value: absence of the wave in the electroretinogram that reflects the health of the inner layers of the retina, including the ON bipolar cells and the Muller cells

Subject: abnormal front foot hair pigmentation
Value: an anomaly in the expected color gradient of hair covering the metacarpals and phalanges

Subject: rhegmatogenous retinal detachment
Value: a retinal detachment resulting from a break in the retina that allows vitreal fluid to pass into and accumulate in the subretinal space

Subject: serous retinal detachment
Value: a retinal detachment resulting from accumulation of fluid between the retina and retinal pigment epithelium in the absence of a retinal tear

Subject: tractional retinal detachment
Value: a retinal detachment caused by fibrous or fibrovascular tissue pulling the neuroretina away from the retinal pigment epithelium

Subject: abnormal intestine apoptosis
Value: change in the timing or the number of intestinal cells undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal NAD(P)H oxidase activity
Value: <any anomaly in the ability to catalyze the reaction: NAD(P)H + H+ + O2 = NAD(P)+ + hydrogen peroxide>

Subject: increased NAD(P)H oxidase activity
Value: <greater ability to catalyze the reaction: NAD(P)H + H+ + O2 = NAD(P)+ + hydrogen peroxide>

Subject: decreased NAD(P)H oxidase activity
Value: <reduced ability to catalyze the reaction: NAD(P)H + H+ + O2 = NAD(P)+ + hydrogen peroxide>

Subject: increased microglial cell activation
Value: increase in the change in morphology and behavior of a microglial cell resulting from exposure to a cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or soluble factor, during the maturation to the fully active phagocytic form

Subject: decreased microglial cell activation
Value: decrease in the change in morphology and behavior of a microglial cell resulting from exposure to a cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or soluble factor, during the maturation to the fully active phagocytic form

Subject: abnormal sperm progressive motility
Value: any anomaly in the ability of sperm to move in a more or less straight line

Subject: decreased sperm progressive motility
Value: decrease in the ability of sperm to move in a more or less straight line

Subject: abnormal axon radial sorting
Value: any anomaly in the process by which immature Schwann cells surround axons of mixed caliber and send cytoplasmic processes that resemble lamellipodia between axons, to progressively choose and segregate the larger axons at the periphery of the bundle

Subject: abnormal erythrocyte aggregation
Value: any anomaly in the ability of an erythrocyte to adhere to one or more other erythrocytes via adhesion molecules

Subject: decreased erythrocyte aggregation
Value: decrease in the ability of an erythrocyte to adhere to one or more other erythrocytes via adhesion molecules

Subject: increased erythrocyte aggregation
Value: increase in the ability of an erythrocyte to adhere to one or more other erythrocytes via adhesion molecules

Subject: decreased myelin sheath amount
Value: reduction in the amount of myelin surrounding nerve fibers or axons

Subject: abnormal myelin sheath amount
Value: any anomaly in the amount of myelin surrounding nerve fibers or axons

Subject: increased myelin sheath amount
Value: increase in the amount of myelin surrounding nerve fibers or axons

Subject: abnormal gum morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the fibrous investing tissue, covered by keratinized epithelium, that immediately surrounds a tooth and is contiguous with its periodontal ligament and with the mucosal tissues of the mouth

Subject: abnormal gum epithelium morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the stratified squamous epithelium of the gums

Subject: superior semicircular canal dehiscence
Value: absence of part of the temporal bone overlying the superior semicircular canal facing toward the dura of the middle cranial fossa creating a third mobile window

Subject: abnormal megakaryocyte progenitor cell number
Value: any anomaly in the number of the progenitor cells of the thrombocytic (platelet) line of cells

Subject: increased megakaryocyte progenitor cell number
Value: increase in the number of the progenitor cells of the thrombocytic (platelet) line of cells

Subject: decreased megakaryocyte progenitor cell number
Value: decrease in the number of the progenitor cells of the thrombocytic (platelet) line of cells

Subject: abnormal megakaryocyte progenitor cell physiology
Value: any functional anomaly in the earliest cytologically identifiable precursor in the thrombocytic series

Subject: increased megakaryocyte progenitor cell proliferation
Value: anomaly in the ability of the progenitor cells of the thrombocytic (platelet) line of cells to undergo expansion by cell division

Subject: abnormal circadian behavior
Value: any anomaly in the specific behavior of an organism that recurs with a regularity of approximately 24 hours

Subject: abnormal circadian behavior period
Value: any change in the cycle length of a behavior expressed when exposed to constant conditions without temporal cues

Subject: prolonged circadian behavior period
Value: increase in the cycle length of a behavior expressed when exposed to constant conditions without temporal cues

Subject: shortened circadian behavior period
Value: decrease in the cycle length of a behavior expressed when exposed to constant conditions without temporal cues

Subject: abnormal circadian behavior persistence
Value: anomaly in the ability for an animal to retain a circadian behavior when time cues are removed

Subject: arrhythmic circadian behavior persistence
Value: loss of a behavioral rhythmic pattern upon removal of time cues

Subject: abnormal circadian behavior phase
Value: anomaly in the phase relationship between a temporal synchronizing event (such as light cycle) and a behavioral phase reference point of an animal (such as activity onset)

Subject: advanced circadian behavior phase
Value: increase in the phase relationship between a temporal synchronizing event (such as light cycle) and a behavioral phase reference point of an animal (such as activity onset)

Subject: delayed circadian behavior phase
Value: decrease in the phase relationship between a temporal synchronizing event (such as light cycle) and a behavioral phase reference point of an animal (such as activity onset)

Subject: abnormal circardian behavior entrainment
Value: anomaly in the synchronization of a circadian behavior to environmental time cues such as light

Subject: abnormal locomotor circadian rhythm
Value: any anomaly in the rhythm of the locomotor activity of an organism during its 24 hour activity cycle

Subject: abnormal circadian sleep/wake cycle
Value: any anomaly in the cycle from wakefulness through an orderly succession of sleep states and stages that occurs on an approximately 24 hour rhythm

Subject: abnormal circadian hormone homeostasis
Value: any anomaly in the process in which an organism modulates its hormone levels at different values with a regularity of approximately 24 hours

Subject: abnormal ultradian rhythm behavior
Value: any anomaly in the specific behavioral actions or reactions of an organism that recur with a regularity more frequent than every 24 hours

Subject: abnormal basilar artery development
Value: aberrant formation or patterning or incomplete differentiation of the unpaired artery that is formed by the union of the two vertebral arteries, runs forward within the skull just under the pons, divides into the two posterior cerebral arteries, and supplies the pons, cerebellum, posterior part of the cerebrum, and the inner ear

Subject: abnormal brain vascular topology
Value: abnormal position of the blood vessels of the brain in relation to other structures

Subject: abnormal brain artery topology
Value: abnormal position of the arteries of the brain in relation to other structures

Subject: abnormal brain internal capsule topology
Value: abnormal position of the brain internal capsule

Subject: abnormal inferior vena cava topology
Value: abnormal position of the inferior vena cava

Subject: abnormal lens topology
Value: abnormal position of the lens in relation to other structures of the eye

Subject: abnormal middle cerebral artery morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the major paired arteries that arise from the internal carotid artery and supply blood to a portion of the frontal lobe and the lateral surface of the temporal and parietal lobes

Subject: abnormal middle cerebral artery origin
Value: any anomaly in the position from which the middle cerebral artery arises

Subject: abnormal ophthalmic artery morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the artery that arises from the internal carotic artery medial to the anterior clinoid process which branches to supply the eye and other structures in the orbit with blood

Subject: abnormal ophthalmic artery origin
Value: any anomaly in the position from which the opthalmic artery arises

Subject: abnormal ovary topology
Value: any anomaly in the position of the ovary in relation to other structures

Subject: abnormal superior mesenteric vein topology
Value: any anomaly in the position of the superior mesenteric vein in relation to other structures

Subject: absent inferior vena cava
Value: absence of the entire length of the principal vein draining blood from the lower portion of the body

Subject: left sided inferior vena cava
Value: the infrarenal segment of the inferior vena cava is present on the left side of the body instead of on the right side; typically as a result of regression of the right supracardinal vein and persistence of the left supracardinal vein

Subject: abnormal embryonic lymph sac morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the population of lymphatic endothelial cell precursors that will form the lymph vessels

Subject: absent motoric part of trigeminal nerve
Value: absence of the part of the trigeminal nerve containing motor fibers, this derives from the basal plate of the embryonic pons and goes into the mandibular branch of the trigeminal nerve

Subject: absent splanchnic nerve
Value: absence of the splanchnic nerve

Subject: heterochrony of entire embryo
Value: a change in the timing or rate of events that alters the size or shape of the entire embryo

Subject: persistent right umbilical vein
Value: failure of the right umbilical vein to regress

Subject: persistent trigeminal artery
Value: failure of the trigeminal artery, the artery that  supplies the basilar artery with blood during development, to regress

Subject: thin mandibular nerve
Value: a slender apperance of the mandibular nerve

Subject: abnormal physiological umbilical hernia morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the developmental umbilical hernia that occurs when the elongating intestine herniates into the base of the umbilical cord, this normally resolves when the size of the abdomen increases

Subject: abnormal sympathetic trunk morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the two long ganglionated nerve strands that run lateral to the vertebral column and extend from the base of the skull to the coccyx;

Subject: abnormal cervical sympathetic trunk morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the portion of the sympathetic trunk located in front of the front of the transverse processes of cervical vertebrae and neck of the 1st rib behind the carotid sheaths and in front of prevertebral fascia

Subject: absent cervical sympathetic trunk
Value: absence of the cervical section of the sympathetic trunk

Subject: abnormal dendritic spine density
Value: any anomaly in the number of dendritic spines in a given cross-sectional area of a dendrite

Subject: increased dendritic spine density
Value: increase in the number of dendritic spines in a given cross-sectional area of a dendrite

Subject: decreased dendritic spine density
Value: decrease in the number of dendritic spines in a given cross-sectional area of a dendrite

Subject: abnormal dendritic spine length
Value: any anomaly in the distance from the base to head of a dendritic spine

Subject: increased dendritic spine length
Value: increase in the distance from the base to head of a dendritic spine

Subject: decreased dendritic spine length
Value: decrease in the distance from the base to head of a dendritic spine

Subject: abnormal dendritic mushroom spine morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the dendritic spines that have a thin neck and large bulbous head

Subject: abnormal dendritic stubby spine morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the dendritic spines that have a bulbous head but lack a thin neck; these are typically prominent in postnatal development

Subject: abnormal dendritic thin spine morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the dendritic spines that have a long, thin neck and a small bulbous head

Subject: abnormal visceral yolk sac endoderm morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the portion of the visceral yolk sac consisting of endoderm-derived cells that is responsible for absorption of nutrients

Subject: abnormal visceral yolk sac mesenchyme morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the portion of the visceral yolk sac that is derived from mesoderm and consists of mesenchyme

Subject: abnormal visceral yolk sac physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the  extraembryonic tissue membrane, formed from the visceral endoderm and the extraembryonic mesoderm, which is located ventral to the embryonic disc and is connected to the presumptive midgut of the embryo; the yolk that it contains is the site of embryonic hematopoiesis and vitelline circulation is involved in early embryonic circulation; it is the origin of the primordial germ cells

Subject: renal glomerular protein deposits
Value: any anomalous accumulation of protein in the renal glomerulus

Subject: renal glomerular immunoglobulin deposits
Value: any anomalous accumulation of immunoglobulins in the renal glomerulus

Subject: whitened brown adipose tissue morphology
Value: brown adipose tissue displays a morphology more closely resembling white adipose tissue (eg. unilocular lipid droplets, decreased lipid droplet numbers)

Subject: browned white adipose tissue morphology
Value: white adipose tissue displays a morphology more closely resembling brown adipose tissue (eg. multilocular droplets, decreased lipid droplet size) including the emergence or brown or beige adipocytes in white adipose tissue; this may represent adaptation to increased thermogenic demand, exercise, injury (thermal injury), and/or disease (cancer)

Subject: decreased susceptibility to xenobiotic induced hyperthermia
Value: reduction in the expected increase  in body temperature following xenobiotic treatment to induced hyperthermia (eg. isopropanol)

Subject: decreased susceptibility to induced hypothermia
Value: smaller than expected drop in body temperature in response to treatment (cold-exposure, dietary restriction, ethanol treatment, etc..) designed to induce hypothermia

Subject: abnormal behavioral response to methylenedioxymethamphetamine
Value: anomaly in the behavioral response induced by methylenedioxymethamphetamine such as induced hyperactivity or stereotypic behavior

Subject: abnormal thalamus size
Value: anomaly in the average size of the large ovoid mass of paired bodies containing mostly grey matter and forming part of the lateral wall of the third ventricle of the brain

Subject: enlarged thalamus
Value: increased size of the thalamus

Subject: small thalamus
Value: decreased size of the thalamus

Subject: thalamus hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, of the thalamus

Subject: ectopic thalamus
Value: abnormal position of the thalamus

Subject: disorganized thalamus
Value: derangement of the pattern of thalamic tissues

Subject: increased cerebellar foliation
Value: the cerebellar lobules are increased in size or number

Subject: abnormal pons size
Value: a deviation from the normal size of the pons

Subject: decreased pons size
Value: decreased size of or number of the nerve fibers in the pons

Subject: increased pons size

Subject: abnormal ventromedial hypothalamic nucleus morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of a circumscript ovoid group of small neurons in the medial zone of the tuberal region of the hypothalamus delineated by a narrow, cell-sparse zone; this region regulates feeding, fear, thermoregulation and sexual activity

Subject: abnormal pontine nuclei morphology

Subject: abnormal premotor cortex morphology

Subject: abnormal photoreceptor outer segment size
Value: deviation from the average range of photoreceptor outer segment size for an organism

Subject: abnormal photoreceptor outer segment disc membrane morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the membranous stack located inside the photoreceptor outer segment, and containing densely packed molecules of the photoreceptor protein rhodopsin that traverse the lipid bilayer

Value: any anomaly in the width of the cross-sectional distance that extends from one lateral edge of the photoreceptor outer segment through its center and to the opposite lateral edge

Value: deviation from the normal number of the photoreceptor outer segments

Subject: decreased photoreceptor outer segment number

Value: increased number of photoreceptor outer segments

Subject: abnormal anterior cerebral artery topology
Value: abnormal position of the anterior cerebral artery in relation to other structures

Subject: abnormal common carotid artery topology
Value: abnormal position of the common carotid artery in relation to other structures

Subject: absent segment of superior cerebellar artery
Value: absence of a portion of the superior cerebellar artery

Subject: abnormal oculomotor nerve topology
Value: abnormal position of the oculomotor nerve in relation to other structures

Subject: absent masticatory muscles
Value: absence of all the muscles responsible for the movement of the jaws during mastication, including the masseter, temporal, and medial and lateral pterygoid muscles

Subject: absent pubic symphysis
Value: absence of the firm fibrocartilaginous joint in the median plane between the two opposing surfaces of the pubic bones

Subject: abnormal testis tissue architecture
Value: any anomaly in the texture of the testicular tissue

Subject: ectopic spleen
Value: a spleen located outside of its normal position

Subject: increased oculomotor nerve neuroma incidence
Value: greater than the expected incidence of a tumor derived from cells of the oculomotor nerve

Subject: single Mullerian duct
Value: presence of only one Mullerian duct instead of the usual 2 ducts

Subject: abnormal axon course
Value: any anomaly in the path taken by a process from the nerve cell body to a target

Subject: abnormal forebrain tissue architecture
Value: any anomaly in the texture of the forebrain tissue

Subject: abnormal jugular lymph sac morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in an embryonic lymph sac that forms at the junction of the future internal jugular/anterior cardinals and subclavian veins

Subject: decreased jugular lymph sac number
Value: fewer than the expected number of jugular lymph sacs; typically there are two of these

Subject: absent jugular lymph sacs
Value: absence of both of the jugular lymph sacs

Subject: increased jugular lymph sac number
Value: greater than the expected number of jugular lymph sacs; typically there are two of these

Subject: abnormal citrulline metabolism
Value: any anomaly in the chemical reactions and pathways involving citrulline, including metabolic, catabolic and biosynthetic processes

Subject: abnormal circulating citrulline level
Value: aberrant concentration in the blood of citrulline, N5-carbamoyl-L-ornithine, an alpha amino acid not found in proteins

Subject: increased circulating citrulline level
Value: increase in the amount per unit of blood of citrulline

Subject: decreased circulating citrulline level

Subject: increased acute myeloid leukemia incidence
Value: higher than normal incidence of cancer characterized by rapid onset of abnormal leukocyte proliferation, manifesting as a severe bleeding disorder from coagulation abnormalities, and bone marrow infiltration of abnormal myelocytes

Subject: increased acute undifferentiated leukemia incidence
Value: higher than normal incidence of cancer characterized by rapid onset of abnormal leukocyte proliferation where the leukocytes are too immature to be able to be classified; manifesting as a severe bleeding disorder from coagulation abnormalities, and bone marrow infiltration of abnormal myelocytes

Subject: abnormal type I cell of carotid body morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the round or oval neuroepithelial cells in the carotid body that contact other type I cells or capillaries and are capable of secreting a number of neurotransmitters

Subject: abnormal supporting cell of carotid body morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the supporting cells of the carotid body that have characteristics of glial cells and with processes that envelope the junctions between glomus cells and nerve endings

Subject: abnormal supporting cell of carotid body physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the supporting cells of the carotid body that have characteristics of glial cells and with processes that envelope the junctions between glomus cells and nerve endings

Subject: abnormal type I cell of carotid body physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the round or oval neuroepithelial cells in the carotid body that contact other type I cells or capillaries and are capable of secreting a number of neurotransmitters

Subject: abnormal pulmonary respiratory rate response
Value: any anomaly in the change in the number of breaths per minute induced by a stimulus

Subject: abnormal DNA-templated transcription
Value: any anomaly in the cellular synthesis of RNA on a template of DNA

Subject: abnormal cell motility
Value: any anomaly in a process involved in the controlled self-propelled movement of a cell that results in translocation of the cell from one place to another

Subject: abnormal peroxisome physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the small organelle enclosed by a single membrane that contains peroxidases and other enzymes involved in a variety of metabolic processes including free radical detoxification, lipid catabolism and biosynthesis, and hydrogen peroxide metabolism

Subject: abnormal exocytosis
Value: any anomaly in the process of secretion by a cell that results in the release of intracellular molecules (e.g. hormones, matrix proteins) contained within a membrane-bounded vesicle

Subject: abnormal actin cytoskeleton morphology
Value: any anomaly in the structure of the part of the cytoskeleton (the internal framework of a cell) composed of actin and associated proteins

Subject: abnormal microtubule cytoskeleton morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the part of the cytoskeleton (the internal framework of a cell) composed of microtubules and associated proteins

Subject: abnormal vacuole morphology
Value: any structural anomaly in the closed structures, found only in eukaryotic cells, that are completely surrounded by unit membrane and contain liquid material

Subject: abnormal olfactory behavior
Value: any anomaly in the actions, reactions, or performance of an organism in response to an odor

Subject: abnormal corneal epithelium thickness
Value: anomaly in the width or number of cell layers of the smooth stratified squamous epithelium that covers the outer surface of the cornea

Subject: increased corneal epithelium thickness
Value: increase in the width or number of cell layers of the smooth stratified squamous epithelium that covers the outer surface of the cornea

Subject: decreased corneal epithelium thickness

Subject: absent corneal epithelium

Subject: corneal epithelium hyperplasia
Value: overdevelopment or increased size, usually due an increased number of cells in the corneal epithelium

Subject: corneal epithelium hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, of the corneal epithelium

Subject: disorganized corneal epithelium
Value: derangement of the pattern of the smooth stratified squamous epithelium that covers the outer surface of the cornea

Subject: abnormal cornea physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the transparent anterior portion of the fibrous coat of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber; together with the lens, the cornea refracts light

Subject: abnormal corneal wound healing
Value: aberrant process of repair of trauma to the cornea, especially that caused by physical means

Subject: increased cornea fragility
Value: increase in the susceptibility of the cornea to damage or rupture

Subject: abnormal suckling reflex
Value: any anomaly in the ability to orient and open/close mouth in sucking pattern in response to external light touching or stroking of the chin

Subject: premature suckling reflex loss
Value: cessation of the suckling reflex occurs earlier in development compared to controls

Subject: delayed suckling reflex loss
Value: cessation of the suckling reflex occurs later in development compared to controls

Subject: abnormal lipogenesis
Value: any anomaly in the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of lipids

Value: any anomaly in the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of lipids that results in increased formation of lipids

Subject: decreased lipogenesis
Value: any anomaly in the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of lipids that results in decreased formation of lipids

Subject: immotile sperm

Subject: decreased mechanical nociceptive threshold

Subject: increased mechanical nociceptive threshold
Value: a higher than average point at which mechanical pain sensation is first detectable

Subject: absent mechanical nociception
Value: inability to sense mechanical pain

Subject: abnormal meiotic drive
Value: any anomaly in the process that results in the unequal transmission of alleles, haplotypes, or chromosomes from a parental genome to gametes

Subject: abnormal subglottis morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the lower portion of the larynx, extending from just beneath the vocal cords down to the top of the trachea; the structures in the subglottis are implicated in the regulation of the temperature of the breath

Subject: subglottis stenosis
Value: congenital or acquired narrowing of the subglottic airway, extending from just beneath the vocal cords down to the top of the trachea; subglottic stenosis can present as a life-threatening airway emergency and may require tracheotomy

Subject: increased lung apoptosis
Value: acceleration in the timing or in the number of cells of the lung undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: hippocampus atrophy
Value: acquired diminution of the size of the hippocampus associated with wasting as from death and reabsorption of cells, diminished cellular proliferation, decreased cellular volume, pressure, ischemia, malnutrition, reduced function or malfunction, or hormonal change

Subject: hippocampus hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to a reduced number of cells, in the deep lying structure of the cerebrum involved with memory storage and spatial navigation

Subject: increased retinal apoptosis
Value: increase in the number of cells in the retina undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: decreased retinal apoptosis
Value: decrease in the number of cells in the retina undergoing programmed cell death

Subject: abnormal bone marrow adipose tissue morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the functionally distinct adipose depot that is located within the skeleton and has the potential to exert both local and systemic effects on metabolic homeostasis, skeletal remodeling, hematopoiesis, and the development of bone metastases

Subject: abnormal bone marrow adipose tissue amount
Value: anomaly in the quantity of the bone marrow fat-storing cells/tissue

Subject: increased bone marrow adipose tissue amount
Value: increased quantity of the bone marrow fat-storing cells/tissue

Subject: small cervical lymph nodes
Value: reduced size of the lymph nodes found near the neck and shoulders

Subject: impaired central nervous system regeneration
Value: reduced or delayed ability to regenerate healthy central nervous system tissue following injury or disease

Subject: improved central nervous system regeneration
Value: faster or more complete regeneration of healthy central nervous system tissue following injury or disease

Subject: calcified brain

Value: increased ability of adipocytes to take in glucose

Subject: decreased adipocyte glucose uptake

Subject: increased cardiac cell glucose uptake
Value: increased ability of the cells of the heart to take in glucose

Subject: decreased cardiac cell glucose uptake
Value: reduced ability of the cells of the heart to take in glucose

Subject: increased muscle cell glucose uptake
Value: increased ability of muscle cells to take in glucose

Subject: decreased muscle cell glucose uptake
Value: reduced ability of muscle cells to take in glucose

Subject: abnormal meiotic telomere clustering
Value: any anomaly in the cell cycle process in which the dynamic reorganization of telomeres occurs in early meiotic prophase, during which meiotic chromosome ends are gathered in a bouquet arrangement at the inner surface of the nuclear envelope proximal to the spindle pole body; this process plays an important role in progression through meiosis and precedes synapsis

Subject: abnormal meiotic attachment of telomere to nuclear envelope
Value: any anomaly in the meiotic cell cycle process in which physical connections are formed between telomeric heterochromatin and the nuclear envelope, facilitating bouquet formation

Subject: giant platelets
Value: presence of abnormally enlarged platelets that are as large as or larger than the red blood cells in the microscopic field; giant platelets may be seen in myeloproliferative and myelodysplastic conditions, autoimmune thrombocytopenia, in association with severe leukemoid reactions, and in rare inherited conditions such as Bernard-Soulier syndrome

Subject: small Meckel's cartilage
Value: reduced size of the cartilage bar in the mandibular arch that forms a temporary supporting structure in the embryonic mandible and gives rise to middle ear bones and sphenomandibular and anterior malleolar ligaments

Subject: basioccipital bone hypoplasia
Value: underdevelopment or reduced size, usually due to reduced cell number, of the basilar process of the occipital bone in the base of the cranium that frequently forms a direct part of the occipital in the adult, but is usually distinct in the young

Subject: absent exoccipital bone
Value: absence of the bone or region on the lateral sides of the great foremen of the skull, which often forms a part of the occipital in the adult, but is usually distinct in the young

Subject: wide cranial sutures
Value: an abnormally increased width of one or more cranial sutures for age-related norms, generally resulting from delayed suture closure

Subject: Wormian bones
