Value: increase in the degree of twisting of the common carotid artery and/or any of its arterial branches

Subject: increased coronary artery tortuosity
Value: increase in the degree of twisting of any of the arteries that branch from the ascending aorta to supply blood to the heart

Subject: muscle hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into one or more muscles

Subject: vaginal hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into the vagina

Subject: testicular hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into one or both testes

Subject: abnormal retinal artery morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the central retinal artery that branches off the ophthalmic artery, running inferior to the optic nerve within its dural sheath to the eyeball; this artery provides the majority of the retinal arterial supply except for the layer of cones and rods; it splits into multiple terminal branches within the ninth layer of retina, which then comprise a cobweb of retinal arterioles and capillaries that nourishes the inner retinal layers

Subject: increased retinal artery tortuosity
Value: increase in the degree of twisting of the retinal artery

Subject: increased retinal vascular tortuosity
Value: increase in the degree of twisting of any of the retinal blood vessels

Subject: retinal artery stenosis
Value: abnormal constriction or narrowing of the retinal artery

Subject: retinal artery occlusion
Value: blockage of the retinal artery, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to the retina

Subject: abnormal retinal arteriole morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of any of the retinal arterioles

Subject: retinal arteriole stenosis
Value: abnormal constriction or narrowing of any of the retinal arterioles

Subject: retinal arteriole occlusion
Value: blockage of any of the retinal arterioles, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to affected regions of the retina

Subject: abnormal ventricular thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of one or more thrombi in the ventricles of the heart

Subject: abnormal liver sinusoidal endothelial cell morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the endothelial cells that line the hepatic sinusoids, constituting the sinusoidal wall; these represent the most abundant non-parenchymal hepatic cell population, are characterized by the presence of fenestrae clustered in sieve plates and lacking a basement membrane, play roles in filtration, endocytosis, antigen presentation and leukocyte recruitment, and in combination with Kupffer cells, constitute a scavenger system in the body

Subject: abnormal susceptibility to thrombosis induced morbidity/mortality
Value: differences from the expected moribund state caused by thrombus formation following stimulation of thrombosis by an external agent

Subject: increased susceptibility to thrombosis induced morbidity/mortality
Value: increased likelihood that an organism will display the expected moribund state caused by thrombus formation following stimulation of thrombosis by an external agent

Subject: subcutaneous hemorrhage
Value: bleeding below the skin

Subject: stomach hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into the stomach

Subject: intestinal hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into any segment of the small intestine and/or the large intestine

Subject: small intestine hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into any segment of the small intestine

Subject: large intestine hemorrhage
Value: bleeding into any segment the large intestine

Subject: abnormal arterial thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of thrombi inside one or more arteries, causing the obstruction of blood flow

Subject: abnormal venous thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of thrombi inside one or more veins, causing the obstruction of blood flow

Subject: abnormal hepatic portal vein thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of thrombi inside the hepatic portal vein and/or its tributaries, which include the splenic vein and the superior and inferior mesenteric veins

Subject: abnormal cerebral venous thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of thrombi inside any cerebral vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow

Subject: abnormal kidney venous thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of thrombi inside any kidney venous blood vessel, causing the obstruction of blood flow

Subject: abnormal vagina physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of the fibromuscular tubular tract leading from the uterus to the exterior of the body; it serves as a passageway for cervical mucus, menstrual fluid and other secretions out of the body; during sexual intercourse, it receives the penis and ejaculate, assisting in its transport to the uterus; during the birth process, it expands to provide a channel for delivery of a newborn from the uterus

Subject: abnormal circulating von Willebrand factor level
Value: any anomaly in the blood level of the large multimeric glycoprotein produced by vascular endothelial cells and megakaryocytes that chaperones blood coagulation cofactor factor VIII and tethers platelets to the injured blood vessel wall

Subject: decreased circulating von Willebrand factor level
Value: reduced blood level of the large multimeric glycoprotein produced by vascular endothelial cells and megakaryocytes that chaperones blood coagulation cofactor factor VIII and tethers platelets to the injured blood vessel wall

Subject: increased circulating von Willebrand factor level
Value: elevated blood level of the large multimeric glycoprotein produced by vascular endothelial cells and megakaryocytes that chaperones blood coagulation cofactor factor VIII and tethers platelets to the injured blood vessel wall

Subject: abnormal aortic valve commissure morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the space or area between each anchored aortic valve leaflet to the aortic wall; the aortic valve is composed of 3 commissures that act as support to the base structure of the cusps

Subject: abnormal lung thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of one or more thrombi within the blood vessel network of the lung

Subject: abnormal brain thrombosis
Value: any anomaly in the formation or presence of one or more thrombi within the blood vessel network of the brain

Subject: abnormal joint physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of any moveable articulation point of two or more bones

Subject: abnormal vasculature physiology
Value: any functional anomaly of any blood and/or lymphatic vessel

Subject: abnormal circulating zinc level
Value: any anomaly in the blood concentration of zinc

Subject: decreased circulating zinc level
Value: less than the normal concentration of zinc in the blood

Subject: increased circulating zinc level
Value: greater than the normal concentration of zinc in the blood

Subject: decreased mammary duct terminal end bud number
Value: reduced number of unique club-shaped epithelial structures formed at the tip of the mammary duct at the onset of puberty (approximately 3 weeks of age in mouse) under the action of circulating hormones; normally, TEBs proliferate, ramify, and actively invade the fad pad to allow the formation of a complex branching structure; this process of branching morphogenesis concludes at about 10-12 weeks of age in mouse, when TEBs have traversed the length of the fat pad and a fully developed ductal tree has formed

Subject: increased mammary duct terminal end bud number
Value: greater number of unique club-shaped epithelial structures formed at the tip of the mammary duct at the onset of puberty (approximately 3 weeks of age in mouse) under the action of circulating hormones; normally, TEBs proliferate, ramify, and actively invade the fad pad to allow the formation of a complex branching structure; this process of branching morphogenesis concludes at about 10-12 weeks of age in mouse, when TEBs have traversed the length of the fat pad and a fully developed ductal tree has formed; increase in TEBs is often associated with increased ductal outgrowth and branching morphogenesis

Subject: abnormal Descemet membrane thickness
Value: anomaly in the thickness of the transparent homogeneous acellular layer found between the substantia propria and the endothelial layer of the cornea

Subject: decreased Descemet membrane thickness
Value: reduced thickness of the transparent homogeneous acellular layer found between the substantia propria and the endothelial layer of the cornea

Subject: increased Descemet membrane thickness
Value: increased thickness of the transparent homogeneous acellular layer found between the substantia propria and the endothelial layer of the cornea

Subject: abnormal brain blood flow rate
Value: aberrant rate of blood flow in the blood vessels supplying the brain

Subject: decreased brain blood flow rate
Value: reduced rate of blood flow in the blood vessels supplying the brain

Subject: increased brain blood flow rate
Value: elevated rate of blood flow in the blood vessels supplying the brain

Subject: abnormal cerebral blood flow rate
Value: aberrant rate of blood flow in the blood vessels supplying the cerebral hemispheres

Subject: decreased cerebral blood flow rate
Value: reduced rate of blood flow in the blood vessels supplying the cerebral hemispheres

Subject: increased cerebral blood flow rate
Value: elevated rate of blood flow in the blood vessels supplying the cerebral hemispheres

Subject: sudden unexpected death in epilepsy
Value: sudden, unexpected death in an organism displaying seizures resulting from a persistent epileptogenic abnormality of the brain, with or without evidence for a seizure immediately preceding the death, in which there is no evidence of other disease, injury, or drowning that caused the death

Subject: abnormal retinal horizontal cell density
Value: any anomaly of the density of the laterally interconnecting neurons in the outer plexiform layer of the retina that connect rods of one part of the retina with cones in another part of the retina

Subject: decreased retinal horizontal cell density
Value: decrease of the density of the laterally interconnecting neurons in the outer plexiform layer of the retina that connect rods of one part of the retina with cones in another part of the retina

Subject: increased retinal horizontal cell density
Value: increase of the density of the laterally interconnecting neurons in the outer plexiform layer of the retina that connect rods of one part of the retina with cones in another part of the retina

Subject: abnormal retinal rod bipolar cell density
Value: any anomaly of the density of the bipolar cells that function in low light and transmit signals only through amacrine cells

Subject: decreased retinal rod bipolar cell density
Value: decrease of the density of the bipolar cells that function in low light and transmit signals only through amacrine cells

Subject: increased retinal rod bipolar cell density
Value: increase of the density of the bipolar cells that function in low light and transmit signals only through amacrine cells

Subject: coronary artery spasm
Value: a multi-factorial, transient, and abrupt reduction of luminal diameter of an epicardial coronary artery due to inappropriate constriction of coronary smooth muscle that can generate distal ischemia

Subject: pulmonary arterial medial hypertrophy
Value: increase in mass of the tunica media of the arteries in the pulmonary circulation

Subject: abnormal testicular artery morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of either of a paired branch of the abdominal aorta that supplies blood to the testis

Subject: decreased testicular artery wall-to-lumen ratio
Value: a decrease in the ratio of vascular wall thickness to luminal diameter in the testicular artery compared to controls

Subject: increased testicular artery wall-to-lumen ratio
Value: an increase in the ratio of vascular wall thickness to luminal diameter in the testicular artery compared to controls

Subject: calcified testicular artery
Value: pathologic deposition of calcium salts in the testicular artery, a branch of the abdominal aorta that supplies blood to the testis

Subject: retinal inner nuclear layer degeneration
Value: a retrogressive impairment or destruction of the retinal layer that contains the cell bodies of bipolar, horizontal, and amacrine cells

Subject: decreased aortic weight
Value: decrease in the average weight of the aorta

Subject: increased aortic weight
Value: increase in the average weight of the aorta

Subject: hemiparesis
Value: mild loss of strength in the limb(s) and sometimes face on one side of the body

Subject: hemiplegia
Value: severe or complete loss of muscle function (paralysis) in the limb(s) and in some cases the face on one side of the body

Subject: forelimb paresis
Value: mild loss of strength in one or both of the forelimbs

Subject: hindlimb paresis
Value: mild loss of strength in one or both of the hindlimbs

Subject: decreased circulating phytosterol level
Value: decrease in the amount of phytosterols in the blood; commonly ingested phytosterols include beta-sitosterol, campesterol, and stigmasterol

Subject: hypolipidemia
Value: abnormally low concentration of lipids in the circulating blood

Subject: decreased lymphocyte chemotaxis
Value: reduction in the directed movement of a lymphocyte in response to an external stimulus

Subject: increased lymphocyte chemotaxis
Value: increase in the directed movement of a lymphocyte in response to an external stimulus

Subject: enlarged cauda epididymis
Value: increase in the average size of the tail of the epididymis

Subject: small cauda epididymis
Value: decrease in the average size of the tail of the epididymis

Subject: small corpus epididymis
Value: decrease in the average size of the body of the epididymis

Subject: abnormal gastrula morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the pear shaped trilaminar embryonic stage in which the primititve streak elongates, the epiblast cells migrate medially towards the streak, enter the primitive groove and migrate laterally to organize into the intraembryonic mesoderm (epithelio-mesenchymal transition) between the embryonic ectoderm and primitive endoderm; the notochordal process forms and extends, and the disc becomes pear shaped as the notochordal process grows

Subject: abnormal Ebner's gland morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the serous salivary glands which reside adjacent to the moats surrounding the circumvallate and foliate papillae just anterior to the posterior third of the tongue, anterior to the terminal sulcus; these exocrine glands secrete lingual lipase initiating the process of lipid hydrolysis in the mouth and empty their serous secretion into the base of the moats around the foliate and circumvallate papillae; their secretion presumably flushes material from the moat to enable the taste buds to respond rapidly to changing stimuli.

Subject: abnormal nictitating membrane morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the translucent fold of the mucous membrane of the conjunctiva present in some animals that can be drawn across the eye for protection and to moisten it while maintaining visibility; in many mammals, a small, vestigial portion of the membrane remains in the corner of the eye; in mice, the nictitating membrane is very small and composed of a very thin core of cartilage covered by loose connective tissue

Subject: abnormal lacrimal sac morphology
Value: any structural anomaly of the upper dilated end of the nasolacrimal duct that is lodged in a deep groove formed by the lacrimal bone and frontal process of the maxilla; it connects the lacrimal canaliculi, which drain tears from the eye's surface, and the nasolacrimal duct, which conveys this fluid into the nasal cavity; like the nasolacrimal duct, the sac is lined by stratified columnar epithelium with mucus-secreting goblet cells, and is surrounded by connective tissue
